review.reviewText: My one and very serious complaint about this hotel is that the bathroom had a sliding barn style door. It provided little privacy as it did not close securely or lock.
This was a very nice hotel which provides a good range of facilites and is an ideal jumping off point for various excursions
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is very convenient to all sorts of attractions
review.negativeRemarks: The bar service left a little something to be desired. Not exactly atmospheric

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is in an ideal location. Small stroll to Fishermans Wharf, Walgreen and Trams. Most staff where polite and helpful except for a couple that wrecked it for the rest. The room is spacious enough for a family of four. Only downside is no room service.

review.title: excellent location

review.title: Clean and nice hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: Great hotel!  Only thing missing is room service and all day restaurant within hotel. Breakfast was tastey!

review.title: Happy
review.reviewText: Great hotel, friendly staff, & perfect location. Very satisfied.

review.title: Awesome place
review.reviewText: This place is amazing. Unique compared to other hotels in the area. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Central in the Fishermans Wharf area
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Good location with everything easily assessable.

review.title: Cute and Comfy room Close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
We arrived around 2pm and were able to check in right away. The lady that checked us in was really friendly. Our room was ADORABLE! I was so sad when I had to leave, it was one of my favorite hotel rooms that I have ever stayed in!!! The bed is very comfortable - decor is amazing as well as the bathroom - the shower had perfect pressure, LOVED the shampoo/conditioner/body wash line they use as well. My favorite touch was having a throw blanket and pillows. 
There's a Walgreen's just a block away, it's very close to the Cable Cars and of course Starbucks :) Also loved that it was just a couple minute's walk to Fisherman's Wharf.

Tip: Most places will charge you a .10c bag fee so bring along reusable shopping bags that can fit in your purse :)
review.positiveRemarks: Seriously.. EVERYTHING! Staff, room, bed, bathroom/shower, throw blanket, mini fridge, decor....
review.locationRemarks: Close to Cable Cars, Walgreens, Fisherman's Wharf, Restaurants.

review.title: Great value!
review.reviewText: Great value, accommodating staff, clean facilities and good location. Easy access to restaurants and not too far from most tourist sights. Highly recommend it.

review.title: Close to Fisherman's Wharf, sketchy area, noisy.
review.reviewText: Hotel is noisy and overpriced. This is a two star hotel charging four star rates. If you are okay with overpaying, fake "concrete" walls, the noise, but having the convenience of walking a few blocks to Fisherman's Wharf, then go for it. The hotel looks good in photos, but there is nothing authentic about the industrial "concrete" looking walls you see in the photos. Those "concrete" walls are thin material painted to look like concrete, for the photos I'm guessing. Walls are easy to hear through. You hear everything going on outside of your room... outdoors, the rooms and bathrooms surrounding yours and the hallway... even far down the hallway from the room you are in. The hallway seems to amplify sound, conversations, laughter, etc. some distance away from your room. If you notice in some of the promotion photos, some of the rooms have ear-plugs on the bedside table. There's a reason for that. Questionable stains on sofa seat in my single King bed room. Carpet seemed clean and bed was fairly comfortable. Bathroom is small, but nice.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to Fisherman's Wharf, close to E and F train pick up drop off, close to cable car turnarounds if willing to stand in line for 1 or 2 hours.
review.negativeRemarks: Those "concrete" walls in the photos? Not concrete... fake. Thin walls painted to look like concrete. Easy to hear through walls, noisy.

review.title: Nice hotel 3 blocks from pier
review.reviewText: The front desk staff were a little arrogant at check-in, but the concierge was friendly and helpful throughout our stay. There is no restaurant on site but there are so many within walking distance it wasn't too much of an issue. The beds are very comfortable, but the room is quite small with only one chair to sit in and no table.  The hotel is on a VERY busy corner and the windows are single pane glass.  There were a lot of sirens and car honking that would wake us up during the night.  We were on the top floor which is the 3rd floor.  The location is perfect for walking to all the sights; the pier, Chinatown, Little Italy, other tourist attractions, restaurants, and all the transportation stops.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, comfortable bedding
review.negativeRemarks: Insulated windows in the rooms, grab bar in the bathtub

review.title: Perfect location, close to Pier
review.reviewText: Very comfortable room, excellent, informative hotel staff that were very helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: location - close to pier but not right in the hustle and bustle

review.reviewText: Hotel is very clean and trendy right by Fisherman's Wharf. Hotel staff was very knowledgeable and helpful when asked for recommendations of restaurants and the cheapest ways to get to things.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a wonderful location! There was nothing I didn't like except the air conditioner was never cold enough for me!

review.title: Beautiful hotel, perfect location!
review.reviewText: Hotel is really good located (5-10 minutes walk from basically everything) and it smells super good in the lobby! Parking is overpriced. (56$ usd). We have realised at our second day in SFO that you can pay meter during the day and stay parked all night long (untill 8am) on the street. Beautiful deluxe room. Soft matress.

review.title: Nicely renovated
review.reviewText: We stayed at Pier 2620 for 2 nights and found the hotel easy to get to, very clean, and close to just about everything you'd want to see in San Francisco.  The front desk staff were very friendly My brother in-law broke his leg the day before we arrived, and couldn't make the trip, so the hotel allowed us to cancel one of the 3 rooms we booked, even though it was after the cancelation time.  Very generous and greatly appreciated.  We will definitely stay here the next time we visit San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, and cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: Close to all tourist destinations.  Can walk almost everywhere.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
All very easy, room clean and big
Coffee and tea in the room
Great location

review.title: Modern and trendy but not sterile
review.reviewText: Super Clean, fantastic beds , quiet , roomy . Great location.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Had a wonderful week-end. Helpful and friendly staff.  Great location
Very clean, excellent experience. We'll be back for sure . Thank you to the staff for being so accommodating.

review.title: Position is great
review.reviewText: Great stay , 2 nights the bar staff was great, 1 night had lost the plot, room was spotless, had opening windows, will stay again

review.title: Perfect
review.reviewText: Hotel was A+++. Was clean, staff was friendly and most of all it was convenient to every thing. We loved San Francisco and loved Fishermans Warf. We will definitely be going back and staying here again... Perfect Vacation....

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Hotel has all the things you need and a great location as near the Bay and public transportation and handy for walking. Beds a bit soft for me but otherwise more than adequate.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel prime position for sight seeing.Staff really friendly would not hesitate to book this hotel again, brilliant holiday.
review.positiveRemarks: everything,room,cleanliness,friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: Close to fisherman's Wharf lots to do there, great restraunts good location for sight seeing.

review.title: Boutique Hotel, Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Well priced boutique hotel a couple blocks from Jefferson St (main area of Fisherman's Wharf). Close enough to be convenient (easy walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and several public transport lines) but far enough to not be too noisy. Beds were VERY comfortable and linens (sheets and towels) excellent quality. Furnishings in excellent condition - looked like the room had been recently refurbished. All staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. Foyer always smelt fresh and clean. Loved staying here. Would happily stay again - and gladly recommend to friends/family.
review.negativeRemarks: Blinds didn't block the light enough. Aesthetically pleasing, but not particularly effective.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square.

review.reviewText: Nice size room and very comfortable. Great location. Much better than Union Square.

review.title: My second stay.
review.reviewText:
As always , stay was great. 
What I like is, when you enter the room there is no smell. Nothing.
Thats the perfect feeling.

Bed comfortable, Im in Interior design business and products that were use are hight quality. Someone did great job. Bathrooms are well planned, rooms also.
Good job !!!
review.positiveRemarks: Bathroom
review.negativeRemarks: I checked in and my first room 220 was smelling like marijuana. They switch me to another room right away.
review.locationRemarks:
Great Hollywood cafe on next block.
Boudin bakery also not far away.

review.reviewText: Great location, near the wharf for good sight seeing

review.title: Very good hotel
review.reviewText: Friendly and accommodating staff. Clean hotel. Near to pier 399, fast check in and out. Safe hotel.

review.title: Room too noisy
review.reviewText: Overall a nice hotel in a good location.  Staff were warm and welcoming. It seems however that the hotel was built as cheaply as possible. Every time the person in the room above mine moved it sounded like they were coming through the ceiling. Did not make for a very restful stay.

review.title: Great Cozy Location
review.reviewText: We stayed for a few days and it felt unique and cozy. The concierge was able to book us a last minute wine tour for the next day. Very clean and comfortable. It was under construction, so the noise level was loud. The hotel is located on a very busy corner, so if you like the sounds of the city this is your spot. Parking is insanely expensive, but so is the rest of the city. I feel $45 a day is ridiculous, especially for guests of the hotel. However, the staff was very nice and helpful to give map of city, tell where the good places to eat were, and make suggestions for things we wanted to do. We would definitely stay here again!
review.positiveRemarks: Décor, staff, and location.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking fees for garage for hotel guests. $20 max a day.
review.locationRemarks: It's by the bay, fisherman's wharf, grocery store, liquor store, dinning, shopping.

review.title: Ideal for a stay near the Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: The hotel is located with easy access to all the restaurants and tourist activities of the Fisherman Wharf. We were provided with a late book out and staff were excellent.
review.positiveRemarks: Convienient location and large clean rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Slightly noisy when taps are running in other rooms.
review.locationRemarks: All the restaurants you need are within walking distance.

review.title: Close to everything touristy
review.reviewText:
We stayed here for two nights, primarily for the location. Reserved a "Signature Room" which we received a handicap accessible room on the first floor. Check-it was fast and easy, a $100 deposit hold was placed on a credit card upon checkin. We were not expecting a handicap room when we first entered the room. The room was VERY large, which was a bit unsettling but we did appreciate it's size. 

We enjoyed the location, which was about 3 blocks from the fisherman's wharf, close to everything including a Walgreens and a Dennys. Large TV was good, hallways and lobby always had a funny smell.

We didn't care for the shower pressure, which was low - confirming other reviews. Walls were also paper thin; I am usually a heavy sleeper but people moving upstairs and through hallways the entire night woke me up more than 4 times. We also think the thermostat on the AC was broken, we would wake up in the middle of the night with the AC off, super hot but the thermostat read 66 which was the lowest. Room lighting was also an issue, we came checked in the evening and could not find a single switch to light our room - later found out each light had its own switch.

The room looked very stylish with it's decor but the room and hallways seemed aged and looks and feels like it needs a revamp.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, comfy bed, large TV, nice lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise level, room lighting, room decor,.
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans wharf, Walgreens, Pizza, Dennys, Restaurants.

review.title: Good hotel at Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Hotel is situated in a very good area for accessing transport to other areas of San Diego. There are plenty of good restaurants nearby and we would recommend the Hollywood Cafe for breakfast. Very close to the Wharf and all the attractions there.
review.positiveRemarks: Very friendly staff who always greeted us when we arrived back.. Concierge swrvice is good offering lots of help and advice. Nice internal courtyard.
review.negativeRemarks: we were woken each day around 6am by a small child in the room above continually running around, jumping off the bed and sliding the bathroom door 😔
review.locationRemarks: Fab location, loads to see and do. Would recommend a trip to Alcatraz but book early.

review.title: Close to all the sites
review.reviewText:
good location for Pier 39, Presidio, China town and a $5 cab ride to Beach Blanket Babylon!!!
would book an inside room next time we visit...
review.positiveRemarks: Location, location, location-very helpful front desk
review.negativeRemarks: faster internet, and a decent coffee maker in the room-it seem impossible to get a good cup of coffee in the room.
review.locationRemarks: visited Pier 39, Presidio, GG Bridge, China Town, good crab sandwiches...

Location was awesome and within walking distance of all Fisherman' Wharf attractions.  Great experience would go back in a heart beat.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, staff, rooms.

review.title: Right Near the Activity
review.reviewText:
Our first trip to San Francisco.  This was a great location in Fisherman's Wharf to get started.  Walking distance to many restaurants and activities.

Don't bother rent a car . . . plenty of transportation alternatives and I used a lot of 'em, Uber, cabs, buses and BART.  Didn't get to try the Trolley or Cable Car.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice small bar with a tender who could make a great tasting Manhattan.  Concierge service was very helpful.

review.title: Very nice hotel close to Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel.  Comfortable room.  Just a few blocks walk to Fisherman's Wharf.  $$$$.
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful rooms. Close to Fisherman's Wharf. 6 in our group and had very nice adjoining rooms.

review.title: splendid location with signature room style
review.reviewText: This hotel has friendly staff and is super close to fishman's wharf. Also the signature room makes you fell like you are living under sea. Great experience!

review.title: Great location and super staff!
review.reviewText: We had a great stay!  Perfect for my daughter and I!

review.title: Modern , industrial look hotel
review.reviewText: A few minutes walk from Fishermans Wharf and close to restaurants. Very nice interior although sliding bathroom door would not stay shut. We spent one night here so had little time to experience it well.
review.positiveRemarks: Smart hotel in good location.
review.negativeRemarks: Ability to keep sliding doors shut.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Fishermans Wharf and a range of restaurants.

review.title: Nice Place By the Wharf - San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hotel was located near the Wharf, but was on a very quiet street away from crowds.   Location was within walking distance to great eateries too.
review.positiveRemarks: Room was very comfortable. Great pillows and bed.  Staff was very pleasant and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Really should add hand rails in the shower area, very high step out of the tub area.
review.locationRemarks:

Go via a tour bus. Viator is a great tour company.

review.reviewText:
We were very pleased with the hotel.  Very clean, friendly staff, and close to fisherman's wharf.  Beds were a
little too soft for our likings.
review.positiveRemarks: The location.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds were pretty soft.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location. You can get to the entire bay from this location!

review.reviewText: Staff was friendly and helpful, room clean, roomy and comfortable. There is a lot ofstreet noise on the North side of hotel.

review.title: quality, clean accomodation
review.reviewText:
A very clean and well maintained room. Decor was modern and up to date. Two queen beds were very comfortable. Bathroom well equipped with good quality body wash & shampoo. Towels were a good size and were changed daily as requested. Coffee maker in room, though no real milk or biscuits to Ho with the coffee.
At this price, complementary bottled water should be in all rooms No water, even for purchase, in rooms.
review.positiveRemarks:
Cleanliness, beds, 2 lifts that were quick and never overcrowded. 
Close to Fishermans Wharf. Excellent maid service.
review.negativeRemarks:
Complimentary bottled water in rooms woul be a nice touch.
Wifi was complimentary, but wasn't as efficient as it should be.
review.locationRemarks: Close to shops, restaurants and Fishermans Wharf.

review.title: Perfect no frills hotel
review.reviewText: Pleasantly surprised.  Hotel was very clean and inviting.  The staff were friendly and helpful.  However, the rooms are small and we had very little storage space.  Also, it doesn't really have a restaurant.  More of a small eating area where you can purchase breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location.  Looks new.  Good deal for the price.
review.negativeRemarks: Would be nice to have coffee in the lobby like some of the larger hotels.  Definitely needs more storage space, but don't see how they could fix that.
review.locationRemarks: Three blocks from Fishermens Wharf. Plenty of good restaurants in the area.

review.title: Close to Fishermans wharf but not spectacular
review.reviewText: Hotel is noisey from the street and they other rooms. No milk for making tea although tea bags provided. Cleaner kept taking towels and both matts despite notices asking you to reuse due to water shortage. Took 2 days to sort problem with sink plug. Air conditioner kept switching on noisey in the middle of the night and could not be switched off. Not a lot of storage places and despite booking for 3 people not enough towels were left when they were removed.
review.positiveRemarks: Location although other hotels in same area may be better.
review.negativeRemarks: Maintenance, training of cleaners to follow hotel policies, milk for those who drink only tea, more storeage and better instructions on the air condi.
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans wharf, pier 39 the beach, boat trips to various San Francisco locations, the cable cars.

review.reviewText: We had a very nice 5 night stay.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Noise from traffic was apparent
review.reviewText: Room setting is uniq However the noise from the traffic was apparent. Walking distance to tourist attraction
review.positiveRemarks: Room setting
review.negativeRemarks: Water bottles foc
review.locationRemarks: 7-20 min Walking distance to all tourist attraction

review.reviewText: Enjoyed the experience, nice rooms, felt like being on a ship.
review.positiveRemarks: Decor of room with nautical theme

review.title: Hotel Close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Rooms are refreshingly different but comfortable. They have an industrial feel with slightly different fittings which is great for a change. Reception staff were really friendly and helpful but Concierge was awful virtually telling us what we should do with very little patience. Breakfast was expensive but really good quality. Also Fisherman's Wharf is a great location to view the rest of San Fransisco although the Wharf was a little too touristy for our tastes.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms were of a good quality.
review.negativeRemarks: The concierge services - we asked once and didn't go back.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location for the Wharf plus access to the Cable Cars / buses.

review.title: The hotel was close to attractions I wanted
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and a pleasant place to stay. It was close to or near walking distances to attractions I wanted to visit. Public transportation is available and easy to use for farther attractions.
Great stay would stay again clean room pleasant staff great location
Lovely décor, 2 blocks from Fishermans Wharf. Walking distance to many tourist sites.

review.title: Good choice for first time visitors to San Fran
review.reviewText: Got dropped off by taxi at hotel around 10:30am expecting to leave bags with bellman until afternoon check in. Instead, desk staff got me in a room right away. Then when I asked for a good place for lunch, he recommended Boudin Bakery. We took his suggestion and had a great crab and corn bread bowl.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location a short walk to Fishermans Wharf attractions.

review.reviewText: Well placed for Fishermans Wharf and Little Italy. Room was clean and modern ... good shower!
review.negativeRemarks: Wi fi was a bit slow

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Check in ok, room well appointed. Basic bar area. Handy to have parking.  Near to Fishermans Wharf, so good for Alcatraz and close to Cable car.

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText: This hotel was close to everything. Great places to eat as well. Really close to Fishermans Wharf. The bellman was terrific. ...went over and above his job to help us out.

review.title: Vacation
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, close to everything especially Pier 39.
Nice sized room, relatively quiet, well maintained. Good location. A great base for my two teenage sons and I while we visited the city.

review.title: Very cute hotel in Fishermans Warf.
review.reviewText:
Great location, we walked from the hotel to most of all touristic points. Very clean and modern, everything looks new. 
Loved it!

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Good experience and cetral location.  Staff was excellent
a great start to our holiday - well located hotel.  A restaurant would have been an advantage but a few near by - pillows were lovely and soft

review.title: nice hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Staff were friendly and hotel clean.  Our room had some issues with leaking air conditioner unit as well as a some leaking from the room above ours.  We stayed for 7 nights and had a first floor outside (overlooking the street) room.  Was very loud, it would have been nice to have given us an interior room given we were there for so long.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was key and the hotel was clean
review.negativeRemarks: Some issues with the room (leaking) as well as noise from the street.
review.locationRemarks: Great location walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirdhelli Square.

review.title: Family vacation in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Pier 2620 hotel is an excellent family hotel down at Fisherman's Wharf.  We stayed for 5 nights and thought the location was great...just a couple of blocks away from the madness of the wharf, yet much quieter in terms of foot traffic. Our room (3rd floor) had a nice view of the hills around the city though the auto traffic was sometimes a bit too noisy. Amenities were ok...no pool, free wi-fi, free coffee and water (2 small bottles).  Everything in SF is expensive during summer so be prepared to pay $350 per night after taxes.  Recommend that you take advantage of close proximity to North Beach and walk up the small incline to enjoy meals there at a lower cost than offered at the touristy wharf.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Near multiple bus lines, so easy access to any part of town!  Beds were very comfortable. Housekeeping did an excellent job.  We were able to check in early after an early arrival.

review.title: Close to all attractions
review.reviewText: Rooms were very nice . Looks like they spent money on all the little things . Fixtures, counters, beds , Etc...   All very nice . Very comfortable room with nice bathrooms . Staff was mixed. Had one woman that went out of her way to help and had one guy that was a jerk ...  Very disappointed that they wanted to charge me $48 a night to park .  Total ripoff . I found parking around the corner for $36 a day . Overall , great hotel . I will stay there again . Just can't park there

review.title: The hotel was over priced, over populated.
review.reviewText: I feel I was deceived, we paid over 800$ to stay there and they didn't include breakfast that blows my mind. Also 150$ for parking, it was our 20 year honeymoon we went through 6 states over 3k miles and stayed in 4 hotels their prices we from 150$ a night to 88$ a night all free parking and free breakfast. I fell lied to and disappointed with their hotel.

review.title: Unique hotel close to everything
review.reviewText: Even though check in started at 3 p.m., they let us check in at 11:30 a.m. Hotel is in nice area, just a couple blocks from the Fisherman's Wharf, Lombard street, Little Italy, and Ghirardelli Square. So many places to eat and shop! Hotel is well kept and very clean. Will definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Friendly, helpful staff.  Clean, comfortable room.  Great location.  Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square, cable cars, public transporation.

review.title: Great place!!
review.reviewText: We definitely enjoyed our stay at Pier 2620. We arrived early and were able to check in early. The hotel is only a few blocks from the Wharf and MUNI transportation. Our morning flight out was cancelled and they pushed our check out time for two hours at no charge, then stored our bags while we toured around waiting for our new flight. Everyone was super friendly and the room was impeccably!!! If I ever visit SF again, I will certainly stay at Pier 2620!!!

review.title: Super location for a reasonable price
review.reviewText: We loved the location - close to Fisherman's Wharf and Ghirardelli Square.  Easy access to public transportation.  Staff were very helpful and friendly.  The room was very comfortable - cool, heavy, wharf-style decor so different from average.  There was a huge TV.  We had a courtyard room so it was very quiet.  Probably the only drawback was that the sliding bathroom door didn't really close completely.  We did not eat at the restaurant but there were plenty of good breakfast cafes nearby.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, room, staff.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square and cable cars.

review.title: Nice hotel near Fisherman's Warf.
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice. It was conveniently located a few blocks from Fisherman's Warf. We liked the room decor as it imitates the docks and also had period light fixtures. The room was very clean and the maid service was very good.
review.negativeRemarks: My wife and I stayed with our 18 year old son with two queen beds. With three adults, the room could use more drawers.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel was in walking distance from Fisherman's Warf, which has countless restaurants and shops nearby.

review.title: Only good thing was the location!
review.reviewText:
The maid service was atrocious, our room looked on to a courtyard and the maid left the full length window wide open on more than one occasion, even though we expressed our concern to the front desk about the easy access for intruders, and the fact that our room was freezing by the time we returned at night!  The maid took away our part bottle of wine, but left the garbage and left over pizza which was with the garbage for two days! Our body wash and conditioner were empty the whole 9 nights we were there, and only occasionally did the maid leave new soap and hand lotion! Several days there was no bath mat left for the next day! The blanket from the couch was never replaced even after being left with the dirty bedding, because it was stained from a drink being spilled over it! 
Under the slatted window seat a red light flashed continuously lighting up the room throughout the night making it hard to sleep! Several times part of the power would be out in our room at night time, and sometimes we had no lights at all! We asked the concierge for some advice and she told us that she had only moved to SF less thank 2 weeks ago and  her advice was to get a taxi everywhere cos getting anywhere was awful? She offered no suggestions for trips or tours and gave no advice on getting tickets! We ordered a town car to take us to the airport and the one they sent couldn't even fit 3 bags, so the trunk was open the whole trip! Overall disappointing!

review.title: hotel centrally located to wharf. Can walk too.
review.reviewText: Facility clean, roomy, comfortable,hotel service pleasant and helpful. Transportation easy to use. Suggest purchasing 3 day MUNI pass. Works on cable cars and public buses. cost efficient.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms updated, clean, staff helpfulness.
review.negativeRemarks: Room services dishes left in hall all day. There where not a lot but it looked tacky next to all the good points.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel is a short walk away frm cable cars, wharf, public transportation. Can walk anywhere. near most tours.

review.title: Great decor, location and food.
review.reviewText: Hotel upgraded us to a suite for the first night  as the room type we had booked was full. They gave us complimentary breakfast to apologise that we would have to move then let us stay for the duration of our four nights. This was lovely and we really appreciated it. My only reservation was that it was a little noisy as the insulation between rooms was a little thin. Not so bad for us but worse for our children sleeping in the living area.
review.positiveRemarks: Decor, location
review.negativeRemarks: Noise insulation

review.title: Perfect lication
review.reviewText:
The people were very friendly and helpful.
Very clean rooms.
Great food very close.
We road the Golden Gate Bridge bike ride.
It was great!

review.title: Walking distance to the wartf

Very nice place to stay , close to everything . 
 Staff very helpful and friendly.

review.title: Great location for families!
review.reviewText: We usually stay at another hotel in the area, that was booked the weekend of our stay.  Lucky for us, we found Pier 2620!  Staff wasn't overly helpful, but since we stay in this area frequently, we really didn't need to ask too much of them.  Check-in/check-out went smoothly, got exactly the room we reserved, and the room was great, if on the small side.  Some of the light fixtures & plugs in the room were temperamental, but everything else was great!  Clean, contemporary furnishings, great shower head, and just enough room for our family of 4 plus a newborn.  Room service would be a nice & needed addition, but other than that, we really enjoyed our stay and will definitely be back!'

review.title: Great Hotel in a Great Location.
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed the stay.  Our room was clean and comfortable.  The gym had great equipment.  Wifi was not so good, but everything else was great!

review.title: Great rooms, close to the heart of San Fran
review.reviewText: We had a great time staying here. The staff were friendly. The atmosphere was very professional. Rooms were amazing. The hotel was easy to find and close to all areas.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was amazing. Large, clean and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast buffet was definitely not worth the money, however Denny's is just a block down the street. Also the hotel parking was extremely pricey
review.locationRemarks: The location was superb. Small walk to Fisherman's work and to Pier 39. Extremely convenient as traffic in that area is very congested.

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText: It was just a little noisy especially at night. The window panes are so thin that you can hear all the noise coming from the outside. The good thing though is it's in the heart of the city. Close to everything. From the airport to the union square

review.title: 4 nights in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
This hotel was fantastic!
The desk staff were excellent. At check in we were given a map of the city and the key tourist attractions highlighted. The room was lovely and just like the images online. There was a lounge area, fridge, well equipped bathroom and large comfortable bed.  
The location is perfect - a Walgreens is just over the road and Fishermans Wharf just a 10 minute walk. There is a cable car stop just 5 minutes away. Be warned - if you want a cable car ride get there early or be prepared to queue. We waited for over an hour around 3pm at the stop by Union Square and left the queue as we thought it was probably going to be another couple of hours!! We got to the stop close to the hotel at 9.30am and got on the second car. By the time we got to Union Square the queue was already as long as it was at 3pm the day before!
The hotel concierge booked us into the shuttle service for our journey back to the airport, which proved much cheaper than the taxi we got from the airport to the hotel. We didn't realise we would need to book this, but did organise the day before our departure.
Overall a fantastic hotel.

review.title: Great location for Fisherman's Wharf & cable cars
review.reviewText: Clean rooms, well appointed, modern decor. Two queen beds was great for two adults and two under tens sharing. Supermarkets, coffee shops, cable car turn tables, bike hire and restaurants were all within a couple of blocks.

Very pleased with everything,staff was very helpful with restaurants.....

..............

The only downfall is that we were on the 1st floor and could hear loud and clear what the drunks were yelling out. We also heard cars honking continuously for whatever reason. If this was on the 2nd floor or higher, we probably wouldn't have heard much of the outside noise. Overall was excellent though :)

review.title: Location and hotel conditions are worth my stay.

review.negativeRemarks: The complimentary breakfast at club room should include more hot dish like oatmeal and gravy.

review.title: great visit, great hotel
review.reviewText: We arrived early and the hotel let us check in early. Upper floor, room 357 was comfortable and clean. great view of courtyard below. Hotel was centrally located near Fisherman's Wharf but not overly busy. Trader Joe's, Ross and much more within walking distance. Room had everything we needed.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
I booked five nights at this hotel.  It was just what I was looking for: perfect location- walking distance from pretty much everything, cool decor in a non- chain hotel. It was definitely pricier than a lot of other options,  but given the location and the appearance of the hotel, it appeared worth it. 
Check in was typical of any hotel.  It's situated on just three floors making it easy to get around.The room looked just as cool as the photos,  but given the price I expected more than the basics.Two little bars of soap,  small lotion, and refillable bottles of body wash and shampoo/conditioner attached to the wall. There was a small fridge and a coffee maker with a couple creamers and sweeteners. The bathroom was clean, but not as cared for as expected. The bedding was wonderful; I could have stayed in bed all day if there wasn't so much to do! 
I didn't dine at the hotel or use the store, so I cannot comment on those. There is a peaceful outdoor area in the middle of the hotel, which the fitness center looks out on. I did use the fitness center once.  It could use some lighter weights but other than that it had a good variety of equipment. 
The only issue I had during my stay was the noise level.  It sounded as if the windows were open because I could hear conversations taking place on the sidewalk below, including being woken up by a man yelling obscenities to himself which carried on for some time. 
Overall,  cool looking hotel with basic amenities in a great location.

Other reviews mention the noise can be a bit much there is no soundproofing in the rooms- we were by the pool and it was very loud when there were swimmers but honestly, we were so worn out each day, I slept right through any other noise. Staff was great, I left a bag behind on accident and they are shipping it to me! They also had a concierge who was often meeting with folks to help them plan their stay. We had a lot of tours leaving out from this area so it was a perfect home base.

review.title: Nice Hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: I really liked this hotel.  Very nice lobby, and the room was very modern and clean.  It is within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf.  They let us check in several hours early, and let us check out a couple of hours late.  There were only two things I didn't like. They charge $50/day to park in their garage.  I wish I would have known this when I was looking for a hotel.  And they don't have any inexpensive food options at the hotel.  We had a room on the street side, and you could here the traffic in the morning.  They do have rooms that face their courtyard where this would not be an issue. Overall, I was happy, but $50 for parking is ridiculous.

review.title: Perfect Stay!
review.reviewText: This hotel is very nice. It is close to everything and an easy walk to public transportation (if you need it). There is a cable car right around the corner that makes getting around the city very easy. The walk to the Wharf is a very short walk. We would get up in the morning and walk by the bay and have breakfast. Getting back to the hotel for changing clothes, resting and getting back out and about was perfect. The hotel staff is excellent. We arrived very late the first night and checking in was simple and the staff took the time to give us maps of the city, recommend somewhere we could get something to eat and give us ideas of places to go in the morning. I really can not say enough about this hotel, staff and location. It was really perfect. I will stay here again. Thanks for making our stay perfect!!

Shower was a little strange, but otherwise it was a nice room and walking distance to fisherman's warf activities & Lombard street. Odd to me that parking at other garages was less expensive than in the hotel where we were already paying for a room

review.title: $66 per night parking for "oversize" vehicles

Great location!  Quick walk to Fisherman's Wharf where we caught ferry to Sausalito, rented bikes, and saw the sea lions. Rooms were nicely decorated and comfortable. Only downside, our room was on the first floor facing a busy street and the noise was loud at night. We could hear the garbage trucks early in the morning.

review.title: Walking Distance to the Pier
review.reviewText:
The hotel had a nautical theme that was very attractive.  The room was large with a comfortable king bed. The cleaning staff was meticulous and did an excellent job of cleaning the room. The breakfast buffet had a good assortment of fruit, sausage, bacon, eggs, croissants,yogurt, breads and potatoes.  The restaurant staff was efficient and very helpful.   The Front Desk and Concierge staff were also very accommodating.  Our toilet seat was broken and when we called for a repair, the technician showed up within 5 minutes of the phone call.  The hotel has a great Happy Hour with very reasonably priced drinks and wines that are in self-serve dispensers.  The staff is eager to help with any requests. 

This hotel is only two blocks from the Pier. The only problem was that the windows are not insulated well because you
could hear both the conversations and the traffic on the street.
review.positiveRemarks: The attractiveness of the decor, the location, the staff, the size of the room, the comfortable bed, the cleanness &, the breakfast buffet.
review.negativeRemarks: Insulating windows to stop the noise level from the street.
review.locationRemarks:
Only a short two block walk to the Pier, very close to Restaurants,Walgreen, & Stores.
Easy access to Cruises, Tours, Hop on Hop Off Bus, & Trolley.

review.title: Decent option near Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: If you plan to stay near Fisherman's Wharf and want a reasonable value, Pier 2620 might work for you. It has more elegance and character than most of the other chains in the area. Beds are comfortable. There is breakfast on site (for an extra fee) and valet parking. But there are a few major discomforts that would keep me from ever staying there again. It's not a good choice for light sleepers. The rooms have single pane windows and it sounds like the street noise is happening inside your room with you. We could hear conversations that were taking place below on third floor room, and there was a lot of traffic. I travel with a very loud noise machine, but it wasn't enough to drown out the traffic sounds. There are also no curtains--just wooden slat blinds that don't close very well, so a tremendous amount of light came into the room and there was nothing we could do about it. Light within the room was also a problem: all of the lamp shades were made of clear glass. They looked really cool--until you turned the lights on and were blinded. I was also very disturbed that clean towels and bath cloths are stored in wire baskets on the floor in the bathroom--right beside the toilet.

review.reviewText: Very comfortable, quiet room in a good location.  Very accessible for Fisherman's Wharf, Little Italy, sightseeing buses and cable cars.  Hotel staff friendly and efficient.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, cleanliness and quiet area at night.  Large room with seating space, comfortable bed.
review.locationRemarks: Located in walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf, Little Italy and cable car terminus.  Access to coastal walk.

review.reviewText: Loved the location! Very close to all the activities at Fishermans Warf
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the location! Very close to all the activities at Fishermans Warf

review.title: Good location close to Embarcadero.
review.reviewText:
Easy check-in.  Staff responsive to requests.  The outside roof deck was great for enjoying morning coffee or an afternoon/evening glass of wine.  

My daughter left her university class ring in the room when we checked out and discovered it when we arrived at airport.  She telephoned the front desk and they sent someone to the room, retrieved the ring, and shipped it back to my daughter.  They offered to send it to the airport by limo, but there was not enough time before our flight.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, room, roof deck.
review.locationRemarks: Ghardelli Square, Pier 39, US Park Service Maritime Museum, Alcatraz Tour Boats, Hyde-Powell Cable Car

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Great location, very comfortable rooms and very clean. Hotel staff was nice and friendly. Walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf and many restaurants/shops, in addition to cable car and public transit. The price was good. The only downfall is that the breakfast buffet was pricey, we walked to other places to eat, but it would have been convenient to have a restaurant that was more affordable or one that you could order from the menu in the hotel. All in all, I would stay here again.

review.title: Pleasant hotel in easy reach of most San Francisco
review.reviewText: Check in was fast, the staff very pleasant and helpful and the room was comfortable and clean with plenty of space to spread out in .
review.positiveRemarks: A comfortable,informal environment and its close proximity to all you need
review.negativeRemarks: The internet signal in the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: easy walking distance of fisherman's wharf and cable cars into the town centre . Restaurants,groceries,pharmacies,laundry all near too.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Close to everything including Safeway and dad enough away from the tourist noise on Fisherman's Wharf. Modern , trendy  Great breakfast and afternoon snacks. Great hotel would really recommend staying there.

review.title: Location was excellent.
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, looked like the pictures. The location was excellent. Very walkable to all the tourist areas. The weekend consignor was very helpful with transportation, restaurants to go to. Breakfast, and bar prices were expensive. Lots of other places to go to for cheaper. Noise from the floor above every morning, but otherwise the front desk was very helpful and pleasant.

review.title: over priced and noisy
review.reviewText:
bad a/c system
no room service
doors were very noisy didn't get to sleep at all

review.title: Perfect location in the fishermans wharf area
review.reviewText: We arrived early and were assigned a room immediately.  Very nice hotel.  Different from the chains in a good way.  Staff was friendly.
The hotel is OK, great location for walking about and getting on tour busses.  No food available and parking charge is CRAY!!!

review.title: Nice hotel, good location
review.reviewText:
Great hotel, great location. Modern, clean, funky decor. Staff very friendly and helpful . 
Only negative was rather noisey, traffic in street below , passers by and other people running taps etc,
Great experience! Friendly staff and very clean. Great location near the pier and public transportation

review.title: Nice hotel near the wharf
review.reviewText: Nice hotel near the wharf. Easy walk restaurants and public transportation.
Rooms are dark. The corridors are so long. It makes you feel that you are in a motel rather than  hotel. Its price should be at least 25% cheaper.

review.title: Great new hotel at the Wharf
review.reviewText: Everything was modern and clean with a Fisherman's Wharf nautical theme. Great location with restaurants and shops within walking distance at Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39 and North Beach. Also close to public transport which made it convenient when visiting the Walt Disney Family Museum at the Presidio. If you do this, ask for a bus transfer and take two different buses to take you right near the museum. The refrigerator came in handy, and the big screen TV were welcome amenities. Everything was clean and modern and we really enjoyed it. We have stayed at several hotels on the wharf but this has been our favourite. One point I would make is you should request a room on the top floor to avoid having any loud stomping from guests in the room above you.
review.positiveRemarks: Modern bathroom and clean rooms. Great location. Good size rooms with large screen TV.
review.negativeRemarks: We had some loud crashing noise that sounded like heavy weights hitting the floor in the nearby gym. Perhaps the gym could close earlier.
review.locationRemarks: Close to great Italian restaurants in North Beach and on Fisherman's Wharf. Close to shops and public transport.

review.title: Another great stay at Pier 2620
review.reviewText: 2nd time staying at Pier 2620. Great location, near my favorite SF breakfast spot - Buena Vista. Polite and courteous staff. Parking garage is simple. Good spot to launch from whether you on bike over the Golden Gate Bridge or grab an Uber to Union Square for a meeting. I'll be back!
review.positiveRemarks: location and new, modern rooms, also like the self-serve food / beverage downstairs
review.negativeRemarks: nada
review.locationRemarks: Buena Vista, bike rental, Golden Gate

review.title: This is 2 star hotel in a good loction
review.reviewText: I pay $269 and pay $48 for parking inside a hotel and fee $37.   It's better to look for 5 star hotel.  The room is very small and not clean.  I pay for bearkfest $24 it's not includ.   The picture for this hotel confuse me.  This is my last time in this hotel
review.positiveRemarks: Noting
review.negativeRemarks: Advertise the true it's 2 star hotel
review.locationRemarks: It's a good loction next to fisherman and pier 9

review.reviewText: very nice and clean rooms. Excellent location if you want to stay next to the piers. Staff can be a bit nicer.

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText:
Great experience staying at this hotel for a week! The location is fantastic and hotel staff was very nice and helpful.
The room was modern and clean.
review.positiveRemarks: location, staff, cleanliness
review.negativeRemarks: street side room was very noisy
review.locationRemarks: Minutes away from Fisherman's Wharf! Bike rental across the street. Close to many restaurants and shops.

review.title: Good location, spacious rooms
review.reviewText: Overall good hotel but bathroom had a mildew like smell and while it was clean the smell was a turn off. Also noticed fisheye outside rooms in halls not picked up over our 2 day stay. location near Fishermans Warf.

review.title: Nice small, intimate bar. Very nice staff.
review.reviewText: Stayed only one night, but staff were very nice, and helpful.

review.title: Close to everything!
review.reviewText: The room was clean.  The decor was delightful and fun.
review.positiveRemarks: Central to everything.  Staff very helpful.

review.title: Great hotel overall
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was very nice, clean, and conveniently located.  The staff was extremely nice and helpful.  The only qualm I had was that the wall seemed to be paper thin.  We heard EVERYTHING.  Including the guests above us stomping around at 6am every morning.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Hotel desk people not too friendly. The valet man friendliest of all. Desk people too busy doing???

review.title: Fantastic find steps away from the water.
review.reviewText: Some confusion on initial check in (asked for king bed they gave us 2 queens) but after some requesting they were able to accommodate and upgrade
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean and well maintained. Perfect location for walking around the pier and downtown.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast was just ok...but everything else made up for it.
review.locationRemarks:
PIer.
Downtown.
Parks.

review.title: Close to fisherman's wharf but…
review.reviewText: Room was clean and comfortable, nights were very noisy on the street side. Would like to have had towels up off the floor and not in wire baskets on the floor. They fell in danger of the splash zone.  Metal closet door  made annoying creaking sound like the ship; maybe that was part of the ambience.

review.title: First visit to San Francisco
review.reviewText: Had a wonderful time! My only comment...hotel only served breakfast. At the end of a long day of walking. I just wanted to relax and eat there. Had to walk around to a local eatery.

review.title: Nice hotel close to pier and bay.
review.reviewText: The design of the room is very unique! We love it!
It has a great location. Fisherman's wharf is only three blocks away.

review.title: Looks nice, but all other senses offended
review.reviewText: My family and I were greeted by a yelling person cursing out the front desk person.  I felt bad for the front desk, but since they didn't say anything or apologize for the profanity in front of my toddler I began to realize that maybe this happens often.  In a city, I expect a diverse group of people, but this is unacceptable. Later that evening I came down to the front store to get a bottle of water and the front desk personnel were very unfriendly.  Thought maybe it was me, but after saying hello in a pleasant voice, still unpleasant. The windows seemed like hey were open and we could hear everything outside and got the smoke smell from people smoking on the sidewalk.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, priced ok for last minute stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff-guest hospitality.
review.locationRemarks: Great walk to the water, was able to explore most of the wharf in a decent amount of time on foot.

review.title: Needed Hotel while on business
review.reviewText: Nice Location, clean rooms with lot's of space, Excellent workout facilities.
review.positiveRemarks: Room decor and Health facilities were 5 star.
review.locationRemarks: Easy walking distance to Peer area, Safe neighborhood

review.reviewText: Hotel was very trendy and unique.  It was one of the nicer hotels we saw (we did a excursion that did hotel pick-ups at numerous hotels).
review.positiveRemarks: Uniqueness

review.title: very clean and unigue
review.reviewText:
The rooms are spacious with a kind of industrial feel to the interior design. I really like the hanging lamps, metal lockers for dresser and closet space, and the overall feel of the room. Kind of like being in a "battleship". Not boring at all. The bed however was one of the worst beds I have ever slept on. The middle of the mattress sank so deep I felt as if I was falling into a hole all night. 
Other than the awful, awful bed, the room and overall experience was fantastic.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, spacious rooms. Very quiet.
review.negativeRemarks:
GET NEW BEDS!!!! HORRIBLE BED.
Spray some WD-40 on the locker doors. They squeak very loudly. I knew when all of my neighbors opened their locker.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location to food, entertainment etc. That is why I chose this hotel, & also that it is reasonably priced compared to other hotels in the area.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText:
The location of the Hotel was great. We were a few blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and we were within walking distance of the Cable Cars and the bus system (Which is very good). We didn't need a rental car even though we
booked one early on. The Concierges were very helpful but they stayed very busy so you have to be patient.
review.positiveRemarks: The location of the Hotel, the furnishings inside the hotel and the staff of the Hotel were excellent. I would definitely stay at Pier 2620 again.
review.locationRemarks: Location was excellent. Close to Little Italy, Chinatown, Fisherman's Wharf, Cable Cars and the bus system.

review.title: San Francisco Getaway
review.reviewText: The room was amazing clean and comfy...loved the bed and pillows great sleep. The only complaint is that the noise from outside can be hear clear in the rooms - which makes hard to sleep or sleep until later. But, overall great staff and super fast check in.

review.title: Hotel 2 blocks from the Pier!
review.reviewText: My husband and I had a wonderful time. We were in close proximity to all activities.
review.positiveRemarks: Wonderful decor; Staff was helpful and very professional.
review.negativeRemarks: Adding a full service restaurant..
review.locationRemarks: A multitude of restaurants, tours, bus, trolley and much more!

review.title: Great location, nice hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice, the staff helpful and friendly. Great location close to pier 39, cable cars, restaurants. Only complaint was the very high cost of their so called breakfast. 21.95 for cold eggs & bacon. They had fruit or cereal. Make your toast in toaster that did not work. I complained about the price and the lacking food. They only charged me for one instead of two meals. Plenty of other places to get breakfast close by I would stay there again

review.title: Great hotel, good location
review.reviewText: Staff was friendly, hotel was nice with fun decor, perfect location in San Francisco

review.title: Great location close to Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Friendky staff - hotel was in a great location a few blocks from Fishermans Wharf Loved the room decor and beds were comfortable.

review.title: Great hotel and location
review.reviewText: Love the large TV in the room and the room layout

review.title: Staff was Fantastic!!!!
review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful and rooms exceed expectation. Short walk to Fisherman's Wharf.  Great for a family and/or business person.

Very good hotel And great ubication , near to fisherman wharf 
Across the street there is a walgreens and 2 or 3 blocks in and out , Apple bees

review.title: Two days is not enough
review.reviewText: We only had 2 days so opted for a bus tour. Saw the highlights and know what we'll do when can come back for a longer stay. The hotel was walking distance to most everything and staff was super friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay here again.
Club access was worth the slight price difference. It included breakfast and drinks throughout the day to pack while we explored the city.

review.title: Good position, but potentially noisy
review.reviewText: It was close to Fisherman's Wharf and the staff were friendly and helpful. We stayed in 3 different rooms over 5 nights - two of them were fine and we slept well, but one was right above a busy intersection and we hardly slept that night. They happily moved us, as this seemed to be a common complaint. There was no restaurant nor room service, which we would have appreciated the night we arrived.
review.positiveRemarks: Its position, and it had recently been refurbished
review.negativeRemarks: Double glazing on windows near the traffic would be helpful. Room service or a restaurant / bistro would be nice
review.locationRemarks: Plenty of tourist things to do around Fishermans Wharf

review.reviewText: Would have been nice to have breakfast or an option to eat in. It was close to piers and shops. Concierge was no help at all and terrible with directions. Staff was more helpful with giving me local choices to eat and visit

review.title: Nice Hotel in a very good location
review.reviewText: Good hotel near Fisherman's Warf. Nice location with lots of restaurants nearby. Had a conference at Fort Mason and it was a few minutes walk from the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Good Location, Clean, nice Rooms
review.negativeRemarks: Service. I had asked for a King bed. I was told no rooms available with King bed. After getting the keys, i saw the next person asked for a king bed.

review.title: Great location, clean with nice beds for sleeping.
review.reviewText: We stayed for three days and two nights.  The staff was helpful and our room was very comfortable; it was close to many activities and public transport.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel Staff and the Room
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, Musee Mechanique, Pier 39, Pier 33 (Alcatraz)

review.title: Modern, Nice, Quiet, Close to Shops and Eats
review.reviewText: Great for gathering with family and friends. Nice room close to lots of sights. Staff are very accommodating.

review.title: Location Location
review.reviewText: A great location close to Fisherman's Wharf and all forms of transportation.  Hotel decor was great and very clean. The hotel was very noisy though. You could hear other guests walking above and in the hallways, along with bathroom noises next door and a lot of street noise.  Quite a lot of restless nights.

review.title: Not an enjoyable stay
review.reviewText:
Staffs wasn't friendly and not very helpful. 
Room is clean but dark and noisy. 
I can hear every single noise from the floor above us.
Parking is so $$$$.

Location is the only advanage.

review.title: Great place to stay near the pier!!
review.reviewText:
Pier 2620 Fisherman's Wharf was a great place for us for 5 days and 4 nights.
We felt comfortable in the hotel and the staff was friendly and trustworthy.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, safe, friendly staff, close to tourist attractions.
review.negativeRemarks: Not a lot comes to mind- great place
review.locationRemarks: Alcatraz tour, Hop on/Hop off bus tours, Sea Lions, Walking along the water line, watching the boats, great eating... lots to do.

review.title: mark and libby room 130
review.reviewText:
We stopped in room 130 it was clean and tidy,we had concerns about the noise which could of come from patio area outside are room( ground floor) but it was never used on are visit by any one after 6 .00 pm over all a vey enjoyable stay the staff was very friendly and helpful 
P s if you are wanting a good restaurant in the area go to beech street grill all organic food and exallant service top notch

review.title: Nice hotel couple blocks from Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Nicely renovated room; very comfortable beds; bathroom door doesn't close properly; windows don't seal so street traffic is loud; $45/car parking at hotel
The only thing I would say that was a negative was the outside noise/traffic was loud enough to hear from inside our room on the third floor. We were woken up by cars driving by and construction.

We walked up and down the Pier many times, in and out of shops, eating, taking lots of pictures and people watching.  
Took the Grand Double Decker Bus Tour which was incredibly interesting - thank you Bri!  You were a delight.
Took the Cable Car tour around and got off in China Town before boarding the Cable Car again back to where we started.
Ate delicious crab, blackened snapper, chowder and crepes and a great meal in an Irish Pub.
Was always greeted by a smiling employee when we entered the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful hotel everywhere you look.  Computer/printer available, very modern and clean!  Staff very polite, friendly and helpful.  Top Notch.
review.negativeRemarks: room doors are loud when they close - and that is it!
review.locationRemarks: Close to lots of shops, restaurants, convenient tour info/tkt centers and get in lots of walking if that is what you like to do.  Very interesting.

review.reviewText: Very convenient location. Very friendly and professional staff.
review.negativeRemarks: More lighting in the room.Improve breakfast. Larger variation.

review.title: Great location, too noisy
review.reviewText: I loved the staff and the look of the hotel. It was in a prefect location but the noise level was out of control. The rooms are not insulated enough and you can hear EVERYTHING from your neighbors and the people above you. We did not get any sleep the whole time we were there. Anytime someone opened a bathroom door or their phone rang you heard it. It's a shame because I loved everything else about the hotel.
Pier 2620 is a beautiful, cozy, and clean hotel. I would stay here again. The staff was friendly and helpful. Even though check out is at 1100, parking is available till 3:00pm.

review.title: Only stay here if you get an inside room
review.reviewText: We stayed at Pier 2620 for 2 nights.  Our first night we stayed on the first floor and our room overlooked the street and was right above the delivery truck loading dock.  The windows were so bad that it seemed like they were open when they were not.  We could literally hear peoples conversations as they walked on the sidewalk.  And the truck noise was unbearable with trucks arriving at various times all through the night.  After only getting about 3 hours of sleep, we asked the front desk staff to relocate us to an inside room.  They arranged for a move and it was so much more pleasant.  If we had been in an inside facing room both nights, my review would be 4.5 to 5 stars.  As it was, I would put the first night as a 1 and the second night as a 5.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was very nice.  The room was clean
review.negativeRemarks: Get better windows.  Parking was $45 per night which seems high, but I think it is what other hotels are charging.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf area of SF is a great place to visit.  There are plenty of attractions within walking distance.

review.title: Chic & Clean - Close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: We only stayed one night and it was more than fine.  Didn't get to checkout much of it but will say the room was clean and had been recently renovated.  It's also in a great location - just a few quick blocks to Fisherman's Wharf.  I would recommend it.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, cleanliness

review.title: Close to fisherman's watf
review.reviewText:
Very nice hotel Love the decorations.  Priclia at the front desk is the BEST, so friendly and knowledgeable about the area recommended us a great resturant to eat at for dinner and called us a resurvation.  She is awsome.  
You can save money on not getting the "club breackfast "  they have there.  It is not bad but just a little better then your average free continent breackfast in my opinion.  Overall great hotel will stay there again for sure!!

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Everything was great.  Room was very clean, spacious and not noisy at all in our side of the hallway.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Lady at the tour desk was chewing gum while talking to us - not good!
review.locationRemarks:
Breakfast at a place called "8 AM" was amazing.  
Stinking Rose in Little Italy was excellent.  Go to Embarcadero for upscale food.

review.title: Great location but noisy
review.reviewText: The hotel was just ok. Interesting decor and great location near fishermans wharf. Housekeeping was excellent. However the reception staff was not very inviting especially noting we were an Expedia booking. No upgrade was offered and the room was on a very noisy street- particularly at 2-4am when the street is cleaned and during the day when the construction crew for th hotel came on shift. Not a good scenario for kids who need sleep ( and parents!). No amenities- just a basic room.

review.title: Convenient and Cozy
review.reviewText: Easy to park and safe in and out requires key.  Quick check in and information.  City noise  noticable but bring ear plugs if you  are sensitive  to noise at night.  You are in a busy area so get used to eat.  Breakfast reasonable choices, and prices for city.  Denny's down the block if you are economizing.  Breakfast servers very friendly and welcoming.  Took time to visit a little and share city insights.  Interesting industrial decor.  Clean and comfortable
review.positiveRemarks: Location and breakfast on site, nice room, safe and easy parking.
review.negativeRemarks: Lower the parking ticket/ key slot if you are in a sports car it is difficult to reach.  Had to ask for help upon leaving just lucky valet walking by.
review.locationRemarks: Wharf, water and lots to look at and take in.  Chain sea food resturants but go to local long standing  Scomas make a reservation.  Yummy.

review.title: Great location, very convenient.
review.reviewText: The location was the best part about the hotel. The design was modern and the rooms were clean and contemporary.
review.positiveRemarks: style, design, location
review.negativeRemarks: better lobby bar
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans Wharf, cable cars, lots to do

review.title: Nice hotel, near Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Nice hotel but if your room is on the outside the street noise is loud in the am. Only a couple blocks walking distance from Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Great hotel, easy access to Fishermans wharf and m
review.reviewText: Great stay!  Hotel was great, clean, safe and friendly!
Great modern hotel near the warf with excellent staff

review.title: Close to the piers
review.reviewText: Didn't like the metal closet with 2 drawers. Very bare bones hotel. The people at registration and concierge were friendly and helpful.

review.title: Clean hotel with friendly staff.
review.reviewText: This hotel is spectacularly clean and tidy in every respect, and the hotel staff is very friendly.  We had a great experience throughout our entire trip.  My one fault, and many reviewers have pointed this out, is the cost.  I knew going in that I would have to pay $45 per night for parking, and hey, its San Francisco so every hotel is going to have a similar rate.  What irks me though is then finding an additional $6+ per night for parking tax.  That should be included in the $45.  The breakfast buffet is also way overpriced for something you get for free at a Best Western.  Overall though, I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is fantastic and the entire hotel is clean and tidy from top to bottom.
review.negativeRemarks: Prices.

review.title: Better place to start your journey around...
review.reviewText: We're orginally from Schaumburg, IL. We flew from ORD to LAX and have stayed for 2 days at Anaheim Marriot Hotel close to Disney. Then we'd rented a car and drove more than 6 hours to San Francisco to see the Golden Gate and etc. Although Marriot Hotel is well known, Pier 2620 was far better based in our experience. The TV screen is bigger and HD, room was better and it has free wifi. If we ever come back, we would still choose Pier 2620.
Very nice and clean hotel. Everything looks new. Very good location, short walk to Fishermans Warf, to Cable Car and to the famous Lombard Street.

review.title: Pricey
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, friendly staff. The only issues we had are the fees, parking, and Hugh taxes. One night stay ended up costing us over $500 just for the hotel a 3.5 star. The reason for only four stars, the price.

review.title: Great Location in San Fran
review.reviewText: We wanted a hotel near enough to Fisherman's Wharf to be able to walk to all the restaurants and ferries, and this was perfect.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was well situated, the staff was helpful, the breakfast was speedy and good. The rooms were clean, and well maintained.
review.negativeRemarks: I don't like hotel rooms without adequate lighting.  Without the drapes fully opened it was difficult to see well in the room, especially for reading
review.locationRemarks: Very near Fishermans Wharf, ferries to Alcatraz, Angel Island.  Restaurants on the wharf.  Needed a taxi or Uber to get to other areas of the city

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Close fishman wharf, which is really convenient if you want to tour the area. However, the decorations in the room is kind of depressing.

review.title: Ok but not great
review.reviewText: Noisy location. Room decor is interesting but the bathroom door sounds so loud when opening and closing. No in room dining and just a basic hotel.

review.title: Excellent location near Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
Excellent location
Staff was very friendly and helpful
Food was OK
This is a very nice hotel, with a great location. Clean, modern with all the amenities a person needs. The bar area is fantastic with a nice selection of wine. Highly recommended!

review.title: Nice, clean hotel, central location
review.reviewText:
This hotel was a great experience! The rooms are all unique with a nautical gothic theme, extremely clean, well maintained and updated. The staff was extra friendly. I was not able to make the first night of my 3 night stay, and even with a last minute cancellation, I was not penalized with fees! That was extremely generous of the property. I also paid "best rate guarantee" when booking. My rate came down a lot of expedia from when I booked until my actial stay, and I was charged the lower rate. This hotel knows customer stevie and how to make clients happy.
The gym was also clean and had a good variety,

review.title: Very nice hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great spot, has a well-trained and attentive staff and in our estimation a strong competitor to the nearby Hyatt and Marriott properties.

review.title: A wonderful change from the typical hotel
review.reviewText: We loved our stay at the Pier 2620 hotel.  It was in walking distance of nearly everything we wanted to see.  The hotel was modern, clean and our room was great - even our teenagers loved it!  Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText:
Good: super nice and helpful staff, good location close to attractions, big room, comfortable bed, may be a bit soft to people with back problems, clean sheets, white and fluffy towels. 
Could improve: hard to find where the power outlets are, would be better to have a few on the nightstands. Only one hook in bathroom, not enough to hang clothes and towels, clean towels are in the wire baskets  on the floor, it makes me question if the towels at the bottom are clean  I would prefer not to have the decoration pillow on bed, they don't seem to get washed for every new guest.

review.title: Perfect location for all walks of life.
review.reviewText: Close to everything. Very nice. Upgraded. Safe. Family friendly. You have to pay for breakfast. Meh.

I was surprised by the size of the room; it was very large and the bed was wonderful. All fixtures were new and everything was very clean. For our stay, it was convenient to the Fishermans Wharf area and to the Lombard street.
Very clean, close to Wharf, Cable Car turn around and Ghriadeli Square.  I would stay again!

review.title: Great experience!
review.reviewText: Upon checking in, the helpful receptionist informed us that our room was upgraded to a larger room. The new room was in a corner of the building, giving us more space and pretty decent views of the Wharf and surrounding shops. Truly amazing experience!

review.title: nice, close to Fisherman's Warf.
review.reviewText: Staff was very accomidating in helping us find good places to eat, giving directions.  Very polite.
review.positiveRemarks: loved the decor.  Would love to know what that wonderful smell was everytime you entered the lobby.  Even asked, it was heavenly.
review.negativeRemarks: I think I would say having coffee in lobby at all times where you could get to it at night.  never found coffee.
review.locationRemarks: we found Hop on Hop off to be close by very helpful since we did the daytime and night tour.  Starbucks close by was great.

review.reviewText: Stayed overnight for my husband's birthday. It was in a great location for walking to  wharf and piers.

review.title: Very nice hotel!
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, clean, friendly and informative staff.  Choice of valet or self-parking ($45.00 or $35.00) in a covered parking garage.  Room was very nice and modern.  Most importantly, you are only steps from Fisherman's Wharf and all it has to offer.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, Joe's Crab Shack, shopping, lots of places to eat, etc.

review.title: Great location & rooms shame about the noise
review.reviewText: The only bad thing I have to say about this hotel is the noise level at night. You can really hear traffic in the rooms. There was also a delivery of hotel linen at 3am outside our bedroom window which kept us up for 2 hours. When we bought it up with the staff they were very apologetic and gave us a complimentary breakfast which was good management but it needs to be sorted or else they'll have lots of other complaints. Rooms were great beds were very comfortable.

review.title: Nice hotel in the heart of the wharf
review.reviewText: Arrived on a Friday night, front desk staff very friendly.  Was checked in quickly and when asked some questions as where to get a quick bite to eat that night one of the front desk staff immediately pulled out a map of the wharf while asking what kind of food etc I was looking for and circled several locations.  In the am- the concierge was very helpful to  find a breakfast spot and help us figure out to arrive where we were meeting a tour group.  Also she provided us with a few coupons as well.  Everyone else in the hotel was very personable as well.  Room was a good size and bed was comfy.  Style in room was themed - dresser and drawers etc looked like metal lockers, walls were distressed to look like packing crate- everything as if you were at a pier. Walking distance to waterfront, restaurants, shopping etc.
review.positiveRemarks: As stated above in review- friendly staff and great location.
review.locationRemarks: shopping, restaurants, piers are close by and various tourist areas for sightseeing as well

review.reviewText: surprisingly pleasant. the walls are a bit thin so you can hear traffic in the hallway and sometimes in the next room, but otherwise it was worth our time and money to stay here. it's also beatifully located so we walked everywhere

review.title: Nice clean hotel
review.reviewText: Positively surprised about the hotel we didn't even know exist! Very clean and comfortable, trendy decorated room (1st floor). Some nice details in the room. Hotel stuff was nice and helpful. Big parking lot with a lot of space.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, clean, free wife!
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive parking
review.locationRemarks: Right next to Fisherman's Warf. Easy access  everywhere.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel was amazing. The parking was for 24 hours, made the day trip very easy for us. Comfy beds, really nice. The only thing was that when we checked in the employee was  not friendly. He was so nice to the guy in front of my boyfriend and I, then was cold and standoffish to us. But we were greeted by two other staff members in the elevator that were so nice. So still all in all, wonderful place.
review.positiveRemarks: I loved the view of the city, the decor was awesome.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Nice hotel but overpriced!  Over $400.  Worth half.
Friendly staff. Room was very clean with plenty of room. Great location. Short walk the Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Good location, staff was pleasant
review.reviewText: Our room was adjacent to the courtyard which was loud during the day but thankfully quiet at night, not sure if that is due to courtyard hours or if we just got lucky. The bathroom could have been cleaner there were many soap or possibly toothpaste remnants on the walls (in plain sight for housekeeping to wipe off) also the bathroom was pretty small so just one of us could get ready at a time.

review.title: Close to wharf and other attractions
