review.title: convenient.
review.reviewText: don't charge for parking or lower the outrages rate. the bar needed something more than one TV and more ambiance. TV channel not enough and have rental movies still in theaters available like other top hotels.

review.title: Great location, but very noisy
review.reviewText: The hotel is right in the middle of Fisherman's Wharf which was very convenient.  We were on the top level, but it felt like we were out in the middle of traffic, it was that loud.  Had to double check that our windows were closed because it sounded so close.  Had a terrible time trying to sleep.  The AC didn't work well either; took hours to get the temperature down a couple of degrees. Was uncomfortable getting ready in the hot room.  The facilities were nice and the room was decorated well, but would not recommend unless you are okay with lots of noise from the traffic.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was great and decorated well.
review.negativeRemarks: Better, noise-proof windows and improved AC.
review.locationRemarks: Right in the middle of Fisherman's Wharf. Great location to walk everywhere.

review.title: Walking distance from fishermans wharf
review.reviewText: Great hotel, excellent staff, extremely friendly and helpful. The room (we had a king size suite) was amazing from the industrial fashioned furniture to the super comfy bed. We plan on staying there again when we return to the wharf.

review.title: Good Location

review.title: Hotel is only a few blocks from the wharf.

review.title: It was perfect close to the pier...wonderf
review.reviewText: Wonderful. The hotel was clean and the staff was wonderful. Thanks

review.title: Ideally location in San Fran
review.reviewText:
I went to  SF for a short 3 night trip, having been to SF before I knew I needed to be nearer Peir 39, so to find this hotel was ideal.

The hotel was a lovely walk from Peir 39, and a short walk to Washington square. If your up for a longer walk, Union square was Under 30min walk away ( uphill and I was going slow).

If you walk out of reception turn left, and walk down the road ( by the side of the hotel) at the end of the block ( across the road) is the Masion end of the Powell Masion Tram stop. Still a walkable distance as its past union square.

If you come out of the hotel and turn right, at the end of the block ( to the left and across the road) is the 2nd stop of the hop on hop off bus. Or if you keep walking straight down, you come to the water front.

I love the feel of the hotel, the rooms have a nice Morden industrial feel to them, they are clean and comfortable.  The staff where all very frendily and very helpful.

I know some people had listed they had trouble when checking in, but there we had no issue at all. Very easy, very quick.

This will know be my go to hotel in San Fran. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone else.
review.positiveRemarks:
I loved the loation of the hotel, ideal for Peir and sounding areas
The room decor is modern industrial which works well & all staff were really nice
review.negativeRemarks: I didn't like the baskets the towels in the bathroom were kept in, they were on the floor under the sink, which was a pain.
review.locationRemarks:
Nice short walk from Pier 39, tram stop and hop on hop off bus located at the end of the block.

Plenty of shops and restaurants within easy reach

review.title: Nice hotel super close to the beach!
review.reviewText: I chose to stay close to fishermans warf because I was traveling w/my two young boys, ages 11 & 6) and all the walking we were going to be doing I didn't want to have such a long walk bk to the hotel. the hotel staff greeted us right away and were so nice to my boys & I. The room was very clean and comfy for us all. It had a mini fridge perfect for my boys snacks I took as well as drinks. after a long day it was great to just relax in such a comfy room in such a nice hotel! I would deff stay there again!

review.title: Wonderful location

It's close to the wharf, Starbucks and cable car 1 block away.  I was happy with the choice.  I think the Buffet was too pricey personally, $21.95 per person but I was on a fun trip so did it anyway, I would definitely stay there again for the price I got online.  Reminder also, the parking is extra for guests so inquire about the cost!

review.title: Nice hotel in the heart of the wharf
review.reviewText: Love th decor of the room. It was a perfect location with so much within walking distance. The bar was nice. The wine machines did not work however. Bar staff was friendly and helpful. Only other thing I wish they had was laundry service on site. We did not eat at the restaurant. It was easy to find street meter parking which they only charge you during the day which was nice as we had a car for one day of our stay in San Fran. We had a room with a king size bed. There was a nice little sitting area with a couch as well. Decent size for 2 people. I would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to others.

review.title: Walking distance to most main attractions
review.reviewText: We only stayed for 2 days but we're very pleased with this hotel. It is walking distance to fisherman a wharf, china town even the Golden Gate Bridge.  The room was well cleaned and had a nice fisherman themed room.

review.title: Nice hotel, Chinatown and the wharf are close by
review.reviewText: Nice hotel and main attractions are close by such as The Wharf and Chinatown
Great rooms with a happy staff. We had a great experience there

review.title: Nice hotel that is close to the Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
The hotel was nice and close (walking distance) to Fisherman's Wharf and cable cars.  However, for the price we paid, the hotel room was a disappointment.  Our room was right above the main entrance and it was very noisy at night.  At 3am, the street sweepers go past, and then shortly after that, the rubbish collection occurs, and then very early in the morning, you start hearing the cable car bells and the concierge blowing their whistles for taxis.  I thought they could've done some sound proofing on their windows!  The air conditioning in the room can also become quite loud.

If you value your sleep, I recommend you book another hotel!

review.title: Well above what I expected.
review.reviewText: Without question this place is my hotel whenever I'm staying in San Fran. All new rooms and super modern. Like the style they went with from the heavy sliding doors to the industrial look and feel.  I almost don't want to give this review because I don't want to lose my hidden gem. And the staff were great. Really could not have been better

review.title: Lovely modern hotel
review.reviewText: Great place to stay within easy walk of Fishermans Wharf. Loved the decor and room not to everyone's taste but was definitely mine. Better than all the chain places nearby.

review.title: Brilliant
review.reviewText:
One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. Everything you want, need and possibly ask for. 

Extremely comfortable room, which is very spacious. 

The King room we stayed in had so much character.

Our bed was very comfortable.

I would highly recommend it to everyone. 

I will be definitely staying there when we are back at San Francisco.

Parking is very expensive Es advised when we booked 30-39 when we arrived we were advised $ 65 per night. We found alternative parking 1 block away for 29 per day. 
Hotel staff were not friendly and welcoming

The rooms are great and very clean and the staff was very helpful.    I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone looking for a hotel in the fisherman's wharf area of San Francisco.  I've stayed in the area three or four times and this was by far my favorite hotel

review.title: Nice, but mixed feelings on location
review.reviewText:
The hotel room itself was excellent, a well done industrial feel (concrete styled wall, sliding wooden bathroom door), and I enjoyed the experience.
However, in the morning, the traffic outside was loud. The hotel did accommodate by providing ear plugs, but I would rather not have to sleep with them.
Transportation was a pain. Getting to the hotel from SFO mid-afternoon required an Uber for ~$35 and took 40 minutes. Getting back to SFO cost the same for two with a taxi to the BART, but took two hours mid-morning. So either plan a lot of time for travel, or go in the off hours where Uber does not do surge pricing.
Other than that, the location was excellent for exploring the North-East side of San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The design and convenient location for touring.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel transportation to/from public transit.
review.locationRemarks: Hard to get to, but once you are there, very walk-able to the typical tourist jaunts.

review.title: Nice and Cool Hotel.
review.reviewText:
Pier 2620 it a pretty hotel with nice decoration.. the staff is super easy going...
the room its nice a pretty noisy and no don't have a lot of natural light.

review.title: Wonderful!
review.reviewText: From Bill at the front desk to Joanna the Concierge, we couldn't be happier. Very cordial and gracious staff. Nicely appointed rooms and a great location!

review.title: Very nice, close to everything
review.reviewText: Checked out from another hotel we did not like and stayed here for our last night in San Francisco.  The stay was much better than the previous hotel.  The customer service was great.  Rooms were very nice and comfortable.  We had a garden room and it was very quiet from any street noise.  Slept very well.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfort and style
review.negativeRemarks: Could use a pool

Also very close to the Italian neighborhood, China Town, Downtown, etc. when I walked into my room I was amazed at how beautiful it was! I really dig the way it was furnished. It was modern/industrial, yet still cozy. The fitness room was also amazing.. Great hotel!
The hotel is nice and clean but the parking situation is not so great consider they charge $45 per day.

review.title: Perfect

review.title: Nice hotel close to many attractions
review.reviewText: Loved the location, staff, cleanliness, restaurant, bar. The room just wasn't "comfortable" for a couple of reasons. Lighting wasn't adequate for reading, nowhere to sit except on bed ( there was a chair but it was in an odd place which made it uncomfortable to use), the walls were not adequate to keep sounds from your neighbors rooms from penetrating your ears.
review.positiveRemarks: Mentioned above
review.negativeRemarks: Mentioned above
review.locationRemarks: Walk to Fishermans Wharf, tons of wonderful coffee shops, restaurants, shopping, Coit Tower, Lombard Street, City Lights Bookstore, bicycle rentals.

review.title: Very modern and comfortable
review.reviewText: I liked the hotel overall and I would definitely come back to this hotel if I were to ever come into the area again. It was very clean and the decor looks very nice. The view from the room I got was just a wall, but I didn't mind that. It was a garden view room so no outside noise from the streets. My only complaint is that room service employees are extremely loud in the morning to early afternoon. They tend to talk to each other loudly or watch loud videos on their phones. The walls are very thin so you can hear everything. Near the end of our stay, the kids that came in to the room across the hall were really loud and noisy which ruined our good stay. You can hear noises from other rooms such as when they open/close the bathroom door or if they stomp around. Other than that I loved the hotel. Besides the times when it was noisy, it's usually very quiet and empty in the halls and lobby. It wasn't as empty later on when it was the weekend though. We expected our room to have no AC due to reviews I read, but there was an AC/heating unit! It was hidden inside a white cabinet so it'd match with the decor. I think they did a great job on the remodeling.
review.positiveRemarks: The decor. The bed is very comfortable. Shower head is one of those waterfall ones. AC/heater unit!! It's hidden inside a white cabinet to match decor
review.negativeRemarks: Noise level. The walls and floors are very thin. Room service is also very loud outside in the halls.
review.locationRemarks: The location was great. Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, Ghiradelli Square, trolley station to get to Union square and Chinatown.

review.title: Great location, amazing staff.
review.reviewText: From our arrival to our departure, our experience was amazing and extremely easy. The staff was always available and helpful. We had a delayed flight and the hotel held our bags while we took advantage of our extra time. The rooms are amazing and so specious. Great find and future go to!
Great hotel, well-located near Fishermans Wharf and clean and well-decorated rooms. Would be happy to stay there again, or recommend it to a friend.

review.title: Great hotel, close to everything!
review.reviewText: Great hotel within a walking distance to all attractions at Fisherman's wharf or close to the street and cable cars to take you anywhere you need. Even walked to then Golden Gate from the hotel - about a 7km hike. The only downside is no restaurant but you can order from any restaurant and have it delivered. Would stay there again.

review.reviewText: I went to San Francisco to watch the State Championship Football game. Saddleback Gauchos vs. City College of San Francisco. I stayed Saturday night at your hotel. I'm still trying to straighten out the valet charges on my bill. Gisele was supposed to email me copies of statements yesterday AM. As yet I haven't received anything. That's unsatisfactory.

review.negativeRemarks: Gisele could send me the statements she promised yesterday.

review.title: Good hotel.  A little expensive.
review.reviewText: The hotel was good, but a little expensive for what they offered.  Breakfast was kind of pricey (especially considering nearby hotels offered free breakfast).  I would have preferred a hotel a little closer to where the action was, but it was not bad.  The concierge was very helpful.  Once I figured out the streets and layout of the city, I really liked the hotel.  I would consider staying at this hotel again.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, helpful concierge.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast was kind of expensive.
review.locationRemarks: I wish the hotel had been a little closer to the tourist attractions.  At first, I found it hard to find anything.  But not bad.  Fun things nearby.

review.title: Great location, wonderful rooms, & family friendly
review.reviewText: You couldn't ask for a better hotel.  It's only a couple of blocks from a food market, Fisherman's Wharf, and the bus stop.  My spouse loved their fitness center and kids thought it was the best hotel they've stayed in.  We've vacationed in England, Wales, France, Germany, Italy, Chech Republic, Holland, Austria, China, and Taiwan; and, there isn't enough room to list all the states we've been to so that's saying a lot for the hotel.  The Concierge was especially helpful with her restaurant and recreation recommendations (California Academy of the Sciences...kids loved it!).  It was Thanksgiving day and we used Uber for our ride from and to the airport.  Our wait for Uber was only 1 minute to get back to the airport, something the driver attributed to the hotel's prime location.  We try to get to San Francisco at least once a year and our next stay will definitely be at this hotel.  You can't go wrong with Pier 2620...clean, wonderful rooms, fabulous fitness center, awesome staff, and unbeatable location!
review.positiveRemarks: Spacious rooms, friendly staff, knowledgeable Concierge, and Location, Location, Location...
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, Bay cruise, Bay Aquarium, Ghirardelli, and restaurants galore, but don't limit yourself...public transport is awesome!

review.title: Loved the room
review.reviewText:
What a delightful experience ! The staff was friendly and helpful. The concierge , butterfly, was very helpful giving us ideas for our special day in San Francisco . The room was fresh with upgraded linens. My wife enjoyed the decor , industrial chic. My son enjoyed the upgraded 50" tv. I enjoyed a room sized for three and a large service 
dog. This is the only hotel under $200 with two queen sized beds. Parking was convienent and secure. Staff recommended a local eatery that she patronizes , cod mother close by $ and fresh and good portions, my son thought the British vinegar was honey, it was very good. I would rate pier 2620 as a good SF value and a good base to see our favorite city.

review.title: Nice location, but loud
review.reviewText: We just spent five nights at this hotel. The room was decorated nicely and it was a quick walk to Fisherman's Warf. The overall experience was fine, but the traffic noise was pretty loud on the first floor. Earplugs were provided by the hotel, and we had brought our own, so the noise didn't bother us. The rooms are dimly lit for effect, but this very inconvenient for real life. Also, there are notes mentioning the water shortage, and to hang up your towel if you will use it again, except that there is only one small towel hook for hanging. No other place, not even for a hand towel. Nice in theory, not great for the follow through. These are small issues that were more observations than problems.

Very cool hotel with an attention to detail and boutique feel. More importantly, the staff were so helpful with questions about how to get to where.

review.title: Good hotel close to tourist attractions
review.reviewText: This hotel was perfect for our stay as we didn't have a lot of time to visit the city. It was close the Alcatraz tours, Pier 39 and the cable car, making it easy to make the most of our stay.

review.title: Awesome employees, never heard a sound!
review.reviewText: Always have issues with noisy guests and unfriendly staff. Pier 2620 was the opposite of that statement. Can't wait to go again! Perfect location for wharf walk and cable car ride through city.

review.title: Incredible hotel - massive room
review.reviewText: Asked to be moved to a higher level floor and given a superb room. Apartment size, clean and abundance of towels. Five minutes walking distance to Fishermans wharf. Superb stay. Highly recommended.

review.title: Walkable and safe
review.reviewText: Easy parking experience, earlier check in and later checkout a huge plus. Also allowed to park in garage after checkout until late.

review.title: Modern hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Really great hotel right off fisherman's wharf.  I would stay there again next time I'm in San Francisco.
If you want to see all about San Francisco you have to stay in this hotel. Great place for pier and Big bus for travelers.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Fishermans  Wharf
review.reviewText: This hotel is very nice. Staff was friendly and helpful. Good location close to the Wharf. My only objection to the room was the lighting was very poor. Parking at $45/day added quite a bit to our costs. Very limited food options if you want to eat there.

review.title: Helpfull staff, clean and good location
review.reviewText: Hotel was in a good location for us, staff were really helpful and friendly. Booked a king room through expedia but only a double queen available when we arrived (however we did check in late due to 6hr flight delay), but room was really nice so didn't matter! Rooms were really clean and originally furnished.

review.title: Great hotel w great access to that part of SF
review.reviewText: I'd stay there again.  Great staff.  Great home base for your trip to SF.

review.title: Great Hotel.
review.reviewText: Great Hotel,friendly helpfull staff and close to Fishermans Wharf..
review.positiveRemarks: Recently refurbished,great bed,very clean and quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: Great as it is.
review.locationRemarks: Short walk to Fishermans Wharf,cable car and pier 33.Plenty of eating spots,supermarkets close by.

review.title: Earplugs provided for a reason
review.reviewText: Earplugs provided in room because it is LOUD. Also, paid upgrade for King bed online, only to arrive and be sold out. No refund on upgrade. Never staying here again.

We really enjoyed our stay here. The hotel was decorated so stylish and really contributed to the experience of staying on the wharf. Locatuon was convenient with easy walking distance to major sites. The only thing that I would say that the hotel was lacking was a better lounge atmosphere, other than that it was great.

review.title: A Decent Hotel
review.reviewText: All hotels in San Fran are expensive and so at least this had a good location and a very acceptable spacious modern room.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was good. The hotel was clean and modern and although some renovations were going on it wasn't a burden.
review.locationRemarks: The concierge suggested a nice little breakfast spot, the name of which I can't recall, but it was a 5 minute walk and the food was original & tasty.

review.title: Within walking distance to Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was helpful. Bar area was friendly. Jacky bartender was awesome

review.title: Nice hotel close 3 block to the Warf.
review.reviewText: Clean, comfort hotel, nice experience. However for the price the wine sampling machine was broke and there is an additional $45 charge to park your car overnight in the parking ramp- so all the incidentals begin to add up.
review.positiveRemarks: 3 block walk to the Warf
review.negativeRemarks: expect for the price things to be working and parking would have be a lower fee

review.title: Loud
review.reviewText: Room was right on the street and windows were so thin it sounded like there were no windows!  Loud all night long with traffic that might as well been in the room with us.
Clean and comfortable accommodations with a helpful staff.  Newly remodeled rooms have a nice look.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: We had a great stay. The staff was very helpful and very nice. The room was clean and we had everything we needed. The hotel is really well situated. The only downside of this place is the poor soundproof between rooms. We could hear our neighbour next door snoring and we could also hear people footsteps from the room up. It did not really bother us however it you are a lite sleeper it might be an issue. Also be aware of what you get charged for from the hotel. We had an extra charge for something we did not do. We spoke to the front desk they apologized and removed the charges. However, the customer after us had the same issue.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms are spacious and very clean.
review.negativeRemarks: The way people get billed for their purchases at the bar.
review.locationRemarks: The location is great very calm compared to downtown and transportation (bus, cable cars, etc..) very easy to access.

review.title: Too noisy
review.reviewText: We should have known when there were complimentary ear plugs on the night stand.  The walls and floors are too thin and the noise kept us awake all night.  Nice rooms but it does not make up for the noise.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean rooms and decor was nice.
review.locationRemarks: Great location to ward and restaurants

review.title: Great place for business and family!
review.reviewText: We had a great stay at Pier 2620!  The staff was very friendly and we were close to many of the tourist attractions.  Our time was divided between business and leisure and the hotel was perfect for both.  They were in the process of updating the hotel, rooms were comfortable and clean!  Great hotel!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, location, location!
review.negativeRemarks: The sliding bathroom door was a little odd, it was also loud, so we could hear the room above sliding their door.
review.locationRemarks: Ghiradelli Square, Pier 39, Alcatraz, Golden Gate Bridge and Park, Palace of Fine Arts.

review.title: NICE AREA TO STAY FOR TOURISTS
review.reviewText: THE HOTEL IS A GOOD CHOICE BUT THE MONEY YOU PAY IS TOO MUCH FOR WHAT THEY OFFER. WE STAYED FOUR NIGHT DURING SEPTEMBER-OCT 2015 AND EXCEPT THE FACT THAT YOU CAN HEAR ANYTHING THAT GOES ON TO THE OTHER ROOMS, WE HAD THE CLUB ROOM WHICH MEANT ACCESS FOR BREAKFAST TO THE CLUB LOUNGE. THE CLUB LOUNG IS A VERY SMALL PLACE WITH NO VIEW ON THE THIRD FLOOR AND THE BREAKFAST IS A JOKE. 3 BREADS TO BE TOSTED COFFEE / JELLY AND ONE EGG DISH EVERY MORNING. FREE SODAS AND WATER AND THATS IT. IN GENERAL THE ROOMS HAVE NO VIEW AND OURS IN PARTICULAR WAS JUST OPPOSITE A GYM OF THE OPPOSITE BUILDING AND EVERYONE COULD SEE INSIDE OUR ROOM UNLESS BLINDS WERE DOWN. ON THE OTHER HAND THE LADIES AT THE CLUB LOUNGE AND THE CONCIERGE WERE EXTREMELY POLITE AND HELPFUL IN CONTRAST WITH THE LADIES AND GENTLEMEN AT THE FRONT DESK WHO WERE THERE BUT ALWAYS THERE WAS A FAULT WITH THEIR SYSTEM AND HAD TO GO DOWN AGAIN LATER ETC ETC. IN GENERAL I WOULD SUGGEST THE HOTEL JUST FOR THE AREA AND THE NICE ROOMS

review.title: Fed up with the normal hotel box? Try this!
review.reviewText:
It was a pleasure to stay in somewhere with a character all of its own. The newly fitted rooms are fashionably designed, welcoming and spacious. The free wifi was a surprise and it works in the farthest corners of the building. For the business traveller, Club 2620 is a must. Spending too much time in hotels across many countries it never fails to amaze me how many forget that it's the people that make all the difference. In Pier 2620, the majority of staff proactively seeks to help you and make your stay a memorable one, no matter how busy the individual may be. If there is an achilles heel then it is a very small pocket of senior personnel who sadly let their colleagues and the hotel down with insufficient client care.
The hotel serves breakfast but you are also only minutes walk from both the harbour and the F tram which runs into Market via Pier 39. For dinner go online and try GrubHub. The log is simple and you can pay most providers in cash. Veracio's pizza serves perfect ceasar salad! The hotel bar is open in the evenings and one Sunday per month there is a live jazz band - superb!
review.positiveRemarks: Quality of accommodation; size of rooms; free wifi and approach to guests
review.negativeRemarks: Better customer training for reception staff and senior management
review.locationRemarks: Try Ferry Plaza Wine Merchant - great wine plus cheese, bread and pate available in the Plaza so make your own picnic!

review.title: God location, Friendly and helpful staff.
review.reviewText: My overall experience with this hotel was ok. There was nothing special about it that you do not get from other hotels. I do not know if I would stay there again or not.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. It was close to many things such as public transportation and places to have a good meal.
review.negativeRemarks: It would be nice if they offered some kind of breakfast that is included in the cost of the room. A swimming pool would have been nice.
review.locationRemarks: The location was good. It was close to many attractions that you could walk to.

review.title: Nice hotel, friendly staff
review.reviewText: Somewhat of an upscale hotel. Very clean and offered good service. It wasn't my style of decor, it was "urban-chic". I prefer a homier more traditional style. The room was clean, if a little small. Metal accents and furniture, again, not my style. The beds were very comfortable with attractive, clean linens.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location for Fisherman Wharf activities, including ferry docks for sightseeing outings. Very friendly staff with a helpful concierge.
review.negativeRemarks: Can't really change this now, but I prefer hotel bathrooms where the sink is outside the room with the toilet and shower.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the bus routes and ferry docks. Not a long walk to Ghirardelli Square. Good restaurants nearby.

review.title: Great Hotel, Great location
review.reviewText: After studying many hotels on many web sites I selected Pier 2620 Hotel for our stay while in San Francisco.  I couldn't have been more pleased.  The rooms were very clean and comfortable.  The hotel had just finished a complete remodel and everything was just wonderful.  The beds were very comfortable with new mattresses.  The over all look was what I'd call industrial sheik.  It's nice to see something different from the typical boring hotel décor. The front desk, room attendants, concierge were terrific.  They all were extremely helpful, knowledgeable, and very pleasant to deal with.  We had signed up for a overnight tour during the middle of our week stay.  The hotel lets us check out for a night, hold our luggage, and check back in, saving us the cost of a nights stay.  I would highly recommend this hotel for these reasons as well as its close proximity to Fisherman's Warf.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything, nothing I didn't like, but I confess I did not eat at the hotel so I can't comment on that issue
review.negativeRemarks: Hummm, nothing I can think of
review.locationRemarks: The location was great, just a quick three block walk to Fisherman's Warf.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice. Rooms looked awesome. Location was awesome.  Only thing was that I called to ask if they still had construction going on and was told no and when we arrived construction was still taking place.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and décor.  I also liked the security of getting to the rooms having to have your room key to get on the elevator.
review.negativeRemarks: Price on rooms could be a more affordable and Later bar hours Lighting around the building would be helpful its kind of dark in areas
review.locationRemarks: Location was in walking distance shops and dining as well as tourist location.

review.reviewText: Only issue hotel in renovation and water turned off! No compensation

review.title: Trauma induced weekend!
review.reviewText:
Upon arrival, the Front Desk Clerk was "busy doing other things" and apologized that he did not assist us. Finally, after preparing keys, etc. for other guests who were not present, he did check us in. He seemed totally distant and not interested in assisting our overall questions, etc.

The room was in good condition. I the late afternoon on Friday, we heard loud construction sounds coming from
adjacent rooms.  I mean VERY loud sounds......hammers....saws.....etc. Also loud talking among the workers.
Since we were in the mood to get out and about....we did not let this bother us in the least.

The next morning, both myself and a family member awoke to the acrid odor of GLUE.....and to the construction sounds once again. This was mid-morning on Saturday as we were adjusting to jet lag and the time change of
the West Coast. The smell of glue made both of us DIZZY with HEADACHES!  Upon getting out of bed I felt kind of woozy from the smell. I phoned the front desk to report this hazard and was asked if I wanted another room!
I said that this was not an option but a health necessity. We went downstairs and asked to speak to the Manager who minimized this entire experience. She did say she would not charge us for the overnight but could not direct any payment until Expedia was contacted since it was booked through them. She had "no idea" as to when a refund would be given to me. We received a cart to move our belongings to another room which was acceptable.

Not returning here!
review.positiveRemarks: Location only
review.negativeRemarks: The Manager could have been more understanding as to the possible gravity of this situation and offered more immediate compensation.
review.locationRemarks: A short walk to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Close to the beach
review.reviewText: The trash can was very small.and they did have enough trash can for us in the room.

review.title: Great hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText: Whilst it was recently puchased the refurbishments are well underway and what a great job they are doing. The decor is fantastic and once fully completed will be a great place for all to use. Front counter staff could be better on customer service but overall it was a great hotel.

review.title: Noisy Hotel
review.reviewText: I got a corner room and it was very noisy. They give you ear buds to use for the noise rather than fixing the issue with interior and exterior. The other issue was the bath tub was clogged and it look lot of time for water to flush out. The towels provided were also not good as fur came out of them.

review.title: Mutton dressed as Lamb
review.reviewText: On first appearances it appears to be a good hotel, everything is brand new. But once you spend a night here you are praying for it to be your last. The functionality of our room was terrible, bad road noise, bad air conditioning, and no room service.  A telling sign that this hotel is sub standard is when checking out the staff don't ask about your stay - they are obviously already well aware of the negative response to come.

review.title: Few blocks the Fishermans  Warf and Pier 39.
review.reviewText: Easy short walk to the pier or to the cable car turn around. Some of the hotel must have been under construction because there was plastic covering the carpet in the halls, but not inconvenient. Breakfast was ok. Not much for vegetarians but the fruit was fresh. Weird spot for the dinning room, 3rd floor down a long hallway, what's that about? Room was nice, had upgraded for a view and all we could see was a stop light and tree. Someone else's hair was still in the tub, kinda gross. Everything else seemed clean. Bed was very comfortable.  Staff was very helpful and hand out coupon books for pier 39.

review.title: Nice hotel - God location. Great interior design
review.reviewText: This is a very nice boutique hotel. Close to Fisherman's Wharf. The public areas smell great - I know that's not usually something that you would notice but every time you walked in it was apparent. The staff was friendly and the appointments are very nice. I loved the design - light industrial.

review.title: Nice updated hotel
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay. The staff was friendly, and the room was very comfortable and modern. It was a quick walk to Fisherman's Wharf, shopping and restaurants. I'll definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends.

review.title: Front Desk
review.reviewText:
I had mixed feelings about the front desk.  The initial encounter was ok but the gentlemen could have been more detailed about the parking garage process.  Because he was not informative, I ended up not being able to get out of the garage because I did not request my key-card to be programmed for the garage.

Another incident was getting that issue resolved but I had to deal with another desk person during that time.  The personality just seemed slight unfriendly but not majorly, just as they I sense petard from the gentleman as though I should have known to ask for my key-card to be programmed for the garage!

Other encounters with the front desk and the concierge were very pleasant.

Lastly, the first floor was under renovation so there where some encounters of works on the floor.  The hall looked like it was done so it was mainly plastic taped down the hall way so the works didn't track anything on the carpet as they worked between different rooms.  This is something that can't be helped during maintenance times but I just wanted to add it to the review for folks that would have an issue with this type of thing.  I did not ask how long they anticipate the work ton continue.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the location and the cleaning staff were very pleasant and took care of the room well.
review.negativeRemarks: The initial check it should provide a little bit more smile and information about the parking garage in regard to the key-card.
review.locationRemarks: There were plenty of great places to visit such as the pier down by the Warf and the Gold Gate Bridge of course.  Pat's Cafe' is highly recommended.

review.title: Overall a good place to stay.
review.reviewText:
The hotel is a great location.  Easy walk to the pier, tour bus pick up locations, and good dining.  It is in an area with a lot of great Italian food, and of course, seafood.
The hotel itself was in the middle of renovations when we were there (9/15).  The new rooms are  nice and comfortable woth a very "wharfy" theme.  Staff was great and the concierge very helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and the staff.
review.negativeRemarks:
The lighting in the rooms tends to be a bit dark.  
There are a number of lamps, but the style thqt they are does not put out a lot of light.
review.locationRemarks: The wharf has many activities for adults and children.  Pier 39 is great fun and all of the bay cruises depart from here.  Alcatraz Island is there.

review.title: Great location, recently refurbished.
review.reviewText: Refurbished to a high standard. We will stay again, no doubt.

review.title: Modern and Clean
review.reviewText: This hotel was walking distance to Fishermen's Wharf, Lombard Street, the shopping district, and China Town. It is modern and clean, with a large flat screen tv, recently renovated decor, and s restaurant and lounge downstairs. It is in a busy part of town, so complimentary ear plugs are provided for sleeping. Request a top floor for quieter rooms.

review.title: Excellent location but no double glazing
review.reviewText:
Excellent location for all tourist hot spots. Easy distance to end of both Powell-Hyde and Powell-Mason cable car lines and nearby bus stop with buses to Golden Gate Bridge. Easy flat walks to piers 33, 39 and the Ferry Building.
Hotel very clean and nice if you like the urban feel. However, there is no double glazing and we had an outside room near a road junction which was noisy.

review.title: Great location and if can't find anything else
review.reviewText: This is an old hotel refurbished and they've done a great job. However, in terms of practicality not so much. Our room had no ceiling light, just lamps here there and everywhere so the lighting isn't even. The bathroom whilst beautiful only had 1 hook for 1 towel so I had to improvise for our extra towels. Also I get the door is meant to be "industrial" to fit in with the refurb but it doesn't completely shut and there's no way of properly locking it. We didn't think that this would be good for a family or any more people than 2. The safe was located right at the bottom of the wardrobe and was very old fashioned with a key rather than a code so I spent our holiday carrying that around (and the fear of losing it as according to the sign it was the only key to that safe). The room was really noisy as it faced the street with the dumpster so we heard garbage trucks a number of times although we expected this when we noticed the ear plugs provided.... But little did we expect to hear our neighbours bathroom at all hours (seriously scared me one night when I was just dozing off) or our neighbours upstairs as they walked back and forth. We also ordered food the first night (not from the hotel as hey don't have this service but they recommend an online site which you can order from local restaurants) and we had some leftovers we wanted binned (but didn't fit in the bin) and whilst we placed them with the plates for collection the food was never disposed of during our stay

review.title: Surprised.
review.reviewText: Very noisy (earplugs provided on nightstand), construction happening on floor we were staying, staff not very friendly, kind of stiff, expensive for value received.  Liked the location, very central, enjoyed the decor and the room was clean and comfortable (except for the noise).
review.positiveRemarks: Very modern and liked the central location to so many attractions and venues.
review.negativeRemarks: Lower price, sound proof windows, discount for being placed on floor with construction being done.
review.locationRemarks: WONDERFUL.  Either very accessible by taxi, but most within walking distance.

review.title: Under construction
review.reviewText: Had to dodge construction  workers everyday,  should have discounted for this mess

review.title: Excellent location, quiet and 2 blocks from action
review.reviewText: We were able to get everywhere in the city from this location without any difficulties. Enjoyed the quietness of the area but also enjoyed the noise only 2 blocks away from Pier 39!!!

review.title: Good location, close to fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: Would definitely stay here again. Love the industrial decor.  LOVE the bed, it was one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in.

review.title: Close to everything Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText:
Great hotel, friendly staff.  One block to Cable Cars, 3 blocks to Fisherman's Wharf, Great restaurants for all budgets within easy walking distance (and I am 72 years old),  
Trader Joe's and Safeway two blocks away, Walgreen's a block one way and two blocks the other.  
Located far enough down slope that it is an easy return from sight seeing.
Staff is knowledgeable about places to eat in the area.
Comments about work in building are unwarranted.  They are working on a normal schedule and can not accommodate your headache if you stay out all night drinking.
review.positiveRemarks: A very tourist friendly location.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location for all things Fisherman's Wharf.  MUNI transportation is always close, Cable Cars, Trolleys, buses within 2 or 3 blocks.

review.reviewText: Just couldn't sleep due to the horrible noise from the outside. The windows didn't keep any noise out and the ear plugs provided were ridiculous. I paid top money for the room and was presented with ear plugs to sleep!!

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: We loved the location of this hotel and the staff were all very nice and helpful during our stay. Our only complaints would be the shower is one of those waterfall ones which had no water pressure and it was really close to the wall so it was hard to really use it. The beds were uncomfortable so we both had bad backs by the end of a 4 night stay and the bathroom doors are really loud so you can hear all of the neighbors doors constantly opening and closing. The decor was really awesome though and stayed with the "sea" theme. Beautiful rooms with lots of space. Mostly everything in the Wharf is walking distance.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Shower heads, beds, bathrooms doors should be more quiet.
review.locationRemarks: walk to shops, restaurants, fun activities etc.

review.title: Good location for walking
review.reviewText: Very clean hotel even with construction going on. Great location for all we wanted to do in fishermans wharf.

review.title: Noisy and bed was lumpy
review.reviewText:
My room was noisy - not just street noise, but the air con clattered and groaned all night. 
The staff were just ok, a bit casual and not all that focused on helping 
And the parking - not just $45/night ex tax, but on three occasions in two days, the card machine upon exit or entry failed. This meant waiting for an attendant to come while cars backed up in the street behind you. 
Never again will I consider this hotel!

review.title: Great Tourist Hotel
review.reviewText: It is close to everything walking distance, very cool design, new, friendly, totally recommend.

review.title: Easy and a little offbeat
review.reviewText: This was an easy experience. The reservation was easy and without undue complication (unlike many large-city hotels, who seeem to require unnecessary info and who have cryptic components to their reservation software). The check in was equally easy - no lost reservation, no hidden fees, no bs about checking in late after a late-arriving plane, cancelling the reservation and then providing a room "so we must redo your reservation at a higher rate". The staff was efficient, friendly, knowledgable. The room itself was clean and newly renovated. The decor was a little peculiar, sacrificing functional for a funky pseudo-warehouse look. For example, the towels were stored in hand-made wire baskets in the bathroom floor. Even the smallest overflow at the sink or bathtube makes the towels wet and unusable. Ditto for lighting. Bare low-wattage lightbulbs may meet the decorator's desired ambiance, but it makes the room too dark for reading. I gather that the interior designer threw more sissy-fits than the owner. Breakfast restaurant is very expensive, but the food isn't bad.
review.positiveRemarks: The convenient location
review.negativeRemarks: Better lights, get the darned towels off the floor, provide soap that lacks floral scent.
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of the Fisherman's Wharf district.

review.title: Close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Newly renovated hotel (industrial theme), great location. Close to Fisherman's Wharf area - great area to explore on foot or by bicycle (rentals available, can ride across the Golden Gate Bridge).
review.positiveRemarks: I like the industrial fell of the rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: A pool would be a nice additional, parking was quite expensive.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, Hyde Street Pier, Access to Alcatraz and boat tours, USS Pampanito (submarine), close to cable car.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Hotel clean and updates. Courtyard side so nice and quiet. Easy walking to everything we wanted to see. ANZ extremely helpful staff.

review.title: Very average
review.reviewText:
Breakfast limited choice
Noisy workmen in the room next door at 7:30am. Managed to get them to change our room for the next night, but why would you book us into a room that was going to be noisy early in the morning
Fire alarm test with absolutely no warning the next morning . Wow did we get out of bed fast.
Last morning of our stay, bang on the door at 8 am , to announce the arrival under the door of our account.
No restuarant .
3 blocks from the wharf. Lots of hotels much closer
review.positiveRemarks: Not much. Concierge was very helpful.also other sources of noise.
review.negativeRemarks: Significantly more attention to noise during improvements and
review.locationRemarks: Location was OK but was further from Fisherman's Wharf than you would imagine from their advertising

review.reviewText: Location was very good , near Fisherman's Wharf, street cars and cable cars.  Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful.  No pool though which was disappointing for my son but we did know that before booking.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly and courteous staff.  Rooms were clean and had a simple elegance.  Location was convenient especially for visitors like us/
review.negativeRemarks: We were not advised that fire alarm was going to be tested and were caught by surprise.  Caused a little mayhem as we were about to check out.
review.locationRemarks: Great Location, near the Fishermans Wharf, cable car, Ghiaredelli Square and near pick up point for Big Bus, a hop on and hop off service.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel is under renovation but overall it was a pleasant experience. Great location, comfortable bed and pleasant staff. I would stay here again next time in San Francisco for sure. Looking forward to seeing it complete although the work being done didn't really impact my stay. The computers/printers on the ground floor were an added bonus for needing urgent things printed. I enjoyed my stay.

review.title: Very nice hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: Fantastic location 3 blocks from everything.  Recently nicely renovated.  Very nice staff specially Aletha (front desk), David (Asst Mgr)  who were very accommodating.  But, must stop to see Debbie (Chief Concierge) to get her great recommendations for tours, restaurants and more.  Excellent!
review.positiveRemarks: Location and cleanliness
review.locationRemarks:
Grayline tours was 2 blocks.  Pier 39 3 blocks
Cable car station 2 blocks.  Many, many good restaurants.

review.title: Newly remodeled hotel and conveniently located!
review.reviewText: We are a family of 4 and recently stayed at Pier2620 the last week of Aug. We stayed in a room on the 3rd floor which allowed us acces to eat breakfast and snacks/drinks throughout the day/night in the Club Room. Our room was newly renovated and very nice. Hotel is extremely clean and within walking distance to Pier 39, Lombard St and all the wonderful Italian restaurants. Loved it!

review.title: Under Construction
review.reviewText: Our whole floor was under construction — more workers in the place then there were people staying there. I bit uncomfortable

review.title: VERY CLEAN
review.reviewText: Under construction on our floor. Noisy during the day.  Room was very nice. Staff was very helpful.  One main complaint was we went down for breakfast thinking it was a buffet included in our room.  No signs were out on entrance. Got our plates and sat down to eat, then noticed a very small sign on table about 2"x2" that the buffet was $22.50 plus a very small order of orange juice was $4.50. Breakfast ended up costing $53.00 for two.  Thought this was a ridiculous price and should have been posted as you came in. Could have gotten breakfast anywhere for half the price.  Information lady was very helpful helping us get around to different activities.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience
review.negativeRemarks: Menu before you walk in for breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Close to wharf for all excursions

review.title: Good location, beautiful and modern decor
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel with nice amenities.  However, the hotel was renovating the other rooms on the first floor where our room was located, which was not disclosed prior to booking. The room was very nice and clean, the front check in staff was indifferent, one of our concierges was fantastic but the other gave misinformation.  There is a lack of insulation though so you can hear guests walking above you. I would suggest staying on the 3rd floor.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: great hotel, perfect location, clean, spasious rooms, modern, nice bar area, good gym. Overall  a great experience!!

review.title: Great location. Currently renovating.
review.reviewText: Great spot just 5 minutes from the historic Fishermans Warf. They are renovating which means a lot of activity. The new rooms are very nice and very clean.

review.title: Short walk to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: My family of 4 only booked one night at this hotel and it was everything I expected a high rated hotel to be. It was just two short blocks to Fisherman's Wharf, which was nice. The room was very clean and beds comfortable. It had all the "little" amenities you would expect. The only thing that wasn't pleasant was the night time noise from outside. I have to sleep with windows open for true comfort and it was quite noisy outside; drunk people, a car drag racing down the street, and at one point somewhere, some woman was wailing. Day time seems nicer with families about, but once the sun goes down, it becomes filled with "seedy" people.
Good location to see everything. Staff friendly and rooms clean and comfortable!

review.title: best hotel
review.reviewText: great location, recently renovated, attentive staff

review.title: Nice hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText:
The registration process was smooth and uncomplicated.
The staff was friendly and professional.
review.positiveRemarks:
The location, room size, the bed.Cleanliness. 
Friendly employees.
The ladie's at the concierge desk were very knowledgeable and personable.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant availability in the evening.
review.locationRemarks: Ability to walk to Fisherman's Wharf, the Big Bus line and Little Italy.

review.title: Close to fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: The hotel is  nice. We really loved the room's decor. However the room temperature was 78degrees when we arrived.I turned down the ac to 60 degrees.the room temperature never got below 75 degrees all night long.We complained about the temperature within one  hour of our arrival, a  facility engineer was sent our room and said the ac unit was in perfect working order.To be fair it has been unusually warm in San Francisco, but in a three  star hotel your room should be cooler than the outside temperature.

review.title: nice hotel; close to  the Bay

review.positiveRemarks: Close to Fisherman's wharf
review.negativeRemarks: Bed  pillows were hard & heavy and staff would not replace them.  Only breakfast was available in diner.  Security person perceived as racist.
review.locationRemarks: Great location--Fisheman's Wharf 4 blocks away

review.reviewText: Nice location and the staff was helpful. The hotel was in the middle of a remodel and the new rooms are very trendy. However, we walked by the same dirty dishes 3 days in a row.

review.title: Nice hotel walking distance from pier 39
review.reviewText:
Comfortable , clean and well decorated.
This hotel is at walking distance from all main San Francisco attractions

review.title: Nice Renovation

review.title: Close to the attractions and city transportation
review.reviewText: Hotel is perfectly located near all the attractions on the Wharf. Great sites and food options. City transportation close by made getting around very easy. Hotel was going through some renovations but the noise and mess was kept to a minimum. Over all our stay was awesome and the hotel was exceptional.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff friendly, clean and quiet. Great fitness facility on site.
review.negativeRemarks: can't think of anything

review.title: Nice location but noisy.

review.title: Clean, friendly hotel central to everything!
review.reviewText: Absolutely loved Pier 2620! Clean, friendly, central (walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, the Embarcadero, Little Italy, Chinatown, Union Square). A less than 10 minute bus ride to the Marina, Russian Hill communities too. Say hi to Joan and Jacky; the best at the hotel bar!

review.title: Great stay close to the Pier

Faced the street so a little noisy and the air conditioning was "touchy". We took the wooden cover off the air and it worked much better. Entire hotel getting redone but 1st floor still in progress. Would definitely stay here again.

Very nice people

review.positiveRemarks: The staff was friendly.  The lobby had a clean smell upon entering.  Dining area was very nice.  The prices were high.  So were others in the area.
review.locationRemarks: The bay was only three blocks away.  Boat rides, cable car rides, and many restaurants nearby.  Good location for Fisherman's Wharf activities.

review.title: Perfect place to stay with access to the Wharf
review.reviewText: Can't say enough about the comfort and care at this hotel.  Loved the staff and the rooms and the location.  They even give you ear plugs if you need them. Close to great food, tours, Starbucks, and lots of fun activities.  We loved it and I am recommending to everyone I know.  Thank you Expedia for including it in my travel choices.  Beautifully and newly decorated.
review.positiveRemarks: everything
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing that I can think of, it's got all the comforts you need or would want.
review.locationRemarks: near great food and all the great tours by boat or bus or cable car.  so convenient, what a perfect location.

review.reviewText: Beautiful rooms, modern. Hotel staff is only moderately friendly. Doing renovations so it was loud at times but overall it was a great experience and nice location.

review.title: LOCATION WAS PERFECT

review.negativeRemarks: PARKING PRICES
review.locationRemarks: CABLE CAR I BLOCK AWAY, FISHERMANS WHARF, PIER 39 WAS A FEW MINUTES AWAY.

review.reviewText: This hotel is under some serious construction and we were unfortunately placed right next to it. The rooms are nice; unfortunately, weren't able to enjoy it with the intense construction noise.  Need to disclose this to your guests prior to booking. Also when your doing heavy construction management should not sell the rooms adjacent to the noise.

review.title: Ideal location - Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: 3 blocks to Fisherman's wharf, 2 to Trolley Cars. 3 blocks to tour buses. Lots of other attractions in walking distance. Hotel staff very helpful. Room spacious and clean. Hotel has no restaurant but does offer buffet breakfast for $21.95.
review.positiveRemarks: Spacious room. Staff helpful and courteous. Location is excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: WiFi cut in and out in room. A full restaurant would be nice addition.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Fisherman's Wharf, Bus Tours of city, Trolley station to downtown. Boat tours of Harbor at Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Nice hotel. Centrally located

review.title: Great hotel

review.positiveRemarks: Great location,size of rooms and all staff
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing

review.reviewText: Excellent hotel, nice people and very confort Room

review.title: Great time; Great stay!!!

review.positiveRemarks: The location and the staff

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Visited several restaurant on Pier 39.  Great food at Bubba Gump Shrimp Company. Had a blast at Ripley's Believe It or Not and the Aquarium of the Bay was great.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff very friendly. Location is great. Walking distance to Pier 39. Near restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: LIGHTING IN THE ROOMS.

review.title: Try a different hotel
review.reviewText:
My son and I were looking forward for quite some time to spending time together in San Francisco. Unfortunately, the accommodations were less to be desired.  The hotel is currently under construction...and I do mean construction. Hallway floors were lined in plastic, no way to avoid the smell of paint or the hammering and drilling which began promptly at 8 AM without fail (even on the weekends).  I understand that they are trying to renovate the hotel but it's really too bad that they couldn't just close the hotel and finish the work all at once. It was awful.

Getting to the gym was a problem as well.  It was open but you just have to figure out how to get there around the construction. No signs were available to redirect guests and I overheard several other guests complain about this as well.  The room was nice, but as long as they are renovating, why not consider double pane windows instead of offering a cheap dime store pair of ear plugs (which were set by the night table).  The shampoo and conditioner dispensers were empty as well. I would have called to request them to be filled but I didn't even realize they were empty until I was in the shower the next morning after we checked in. Overall, it was one of the worse places I have stayed as far as comfort. Definitely would not recommend this hotel to anyone right now. Maybe things will improve after the renovations...I hope.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is in a good location. Close to Fisherman's Wharf, Trolley's etc.

review.title: Reservation should mean "Reserved"
review.reviewText: Everything was fine with the exception that our two queen bed reservation (for 3 people) was not available and the front desk thought we would settle for one king and a regular couch (did not fold out to a bed).  But king room did not even have couch.  Staff made it right with second room, but we should not have had to go through any of this, for we had a reservation.

review.title: Nice hotel  close to  Fisherman's Warf.
review.reviewText: Decor was neat made up like a fisherman's room.  But the lights were to bright (no shades) just wire cages over them in the bedroom area.  That's my only complaint.
review.positiveRemarks: Very very clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Lighting in rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Close to a lot of resturants and ships

review.title: Good location for the price
review.reviewText: Hotel is under construction. We got a new room which was fine. everyone had problems with the key cards to get into the rooms and use the elevator. Use hotel reccomended van service to get to airport. Said they took credit cards but drive said no when we got there. Bad end to a nice trip.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was good.
review.negativeRemarks: Key card system.

review.title: Hotel is under MAYOR CONSTRUCTION
review.reviewText: The hotel is under mayor construction, there is plastic liners on the carpet as you walk to your room, you can feel the dust. Once construction is completed it's going to be a nice hotel but for what they charge per night it's not worth it to stay there right now, too much construction stuff every where, outside de hotel, inside the hotel, an entire area of the parking structure is used as the warehouse for all the construction that's going on. Then you can hear the workers banging early in the morning.

review.title: Close to the Warf
review.reviewText: Hotel was under construction so there were some noise and the first day we were there we couldn't use the water until 4:00pm. Bed was very comfy and the room was clean.  Parking wasn't great. Location was great. Close to the Warf, lil Italy and Ghiradelli

review.title: Great location, but under construction
review.reviewText: Started construction at 7:55am. Hotel staff were very friendly and would enjoy this hotel after everything is finished upgrading. Bed comfortable and good size room.

review.title: Dirty and dusty
review.reviewText: Great location and affordable. However it's currently under construction it was a bit noisy and very dusty. Also, the cleaning person brought and left a soiled towel.

review.title: Great room and location
review.reviewText: We had a fantastic stay but be aware that the hotel is undergoing major renovations so expect some noise, detours and other potential inconveniences   Our room was recently renovated and was very comfortable and stylish
review.positiveRemarks: Location and room size.

review.title: Great location but.....
review.reviewText: Stayed in a newly renovated room for 3 nights.  Pretty to look at but not functional.  No plugs for chargers, bathroom faucets installed backwards, nautical design cute but room dimly lit and hard on eyes.  Maintenance had to remove window seat because it  blocked the air flow and room would not cool.  And when we checked in we wondered why there were ear plugs on the night stand unt construction started promptly at 7 am the next morning.

review.title: Beautiful and great location
review.reviewText: The hotel is under renovations and we stayed in one of the new rooms.  They are beautiful.  And the location  can't ask for better. Minutes walk to Fishermans Warf.

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: Normally I hate hotels - but this is a very clean and well kept hotel, with friendly and helpful staff.
review.positiveRemarks: The location of the hotel is perfect. You can walk, bike or take a trolley to all the sightseeing musts San Francisco has to offer.
review.locationRemarks: Things to do: walk to Fisherman's Wharf, the Palace of Fine Arts, bike the Golden Gate Bridge or take a trolley to China Town.

review.title: Great location. Noise starts at 5.00am
review.reviewText: Great location. Trams 3 mins walk. Fishermans Wharf 5 mins walk. Pier 39 10 mins. Ferrys under and around bay 5 mins. Starbucks and Dennys ( for coffe and/or cheap breakfasts 3 mins away. Room big. Beds comfortable. Shower good. noisey, but didnt expect it to be quiet. Between 11 pm and around 5.00 am it was quiet though.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was perfect.
review.negativeRemarks: Wish it had a swimming pool, would make it a fab hotel.
review.locationRemarks: The location was ideal. In the middle of the tourity Fishermans Wharf, but far enough away from it too.

review.title: Good location bad customer service
review.reviewText: The hotel has a great location but remodeling made it dusty, the room and hallway smelled like fresh paint with a strong smell. Most of the staff were very nice but house keeping was very rude. We came back to our room at 3:30 and the room had not been serviced. When a house keeper was asked she was very rude to my wife and after calling the front desk our room was cleaned but we had to wait for about an hour, and then had to leave the room for a long time to have it cleaned after a long day of walking around and wanted to rest.?

review.title: Work/Family
review.reviewText: I traveled to San Francisco for work and visited with family.  This hotel was just rennovated and I love the modern style.
review.positiveRemarks: The decor is very modern and the beds were comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: They did not offer room service.  Also there was quite a bit of traffic noise.  They provided ear plugs on the night stand... but still.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is walking distance from the Wharf and so many of the spectacular things the City has to offer.

review.title: Close to fishermans warf and Pier 39.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel , can be a little noisy but so tired from sight seeing slept great . Remodeling so rooms look great with Dock/Ship character . Wish hotel had a hot tub though but not a big deal .
Very expensive its best to stay the night out of town and just drive in.

review.title: Under Renovations
review.reviewText: This hotel is under major renovations. It is very noisy from 7 am until the late evening hours. The hallways are dusty and very crowded with workers carrying building supplies and power tools. Once the renovations are do e, this hotel will be beautiful and it is in a great location. Until the renovations are complete, I would not book this hotel.

review.title: Avoid.....construction work may ruin your stay.
review.reviewText:
We were informed by front desk at check in of construction work. No mention of this at booking. Receptionist told us she was giving us "newly refurbished rooms, but there might be a bit of dust in corridor due to work on other rooms".
She lied. Rooms were in the unchanged part of hotel on first floor so lots of street noise plus construction workers arrived at 7:30am every morning. At times corridor was thick with dust.
No discount on price to reflect this. Breakfast is a total rip off.

review.title: Great location, modern
review.reviewText: Fantastic hotel close to wharf and many eateries. Rooms were being renovated during the day but our newly done room and corridor made up for the noise. Great beds, lovely staff.

review.title: Good location, clean, poor services...
review.reviewText: First off, this is my second attempt at writing this review because the first one was rejected for mentioning the exorbitant room rates. The location of this hotel was idea — just 5 min walking to the center of Fisherman's Wharf area. As hotels sometimes do, there was maintenance going on during my whole week's stay there. However, beyond the mere inconvenience of early-morning (9 a.m.) drilling and hammering noise, this hotel made water unavailable for hours at a time at the most inconvenient times like 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. It would have been prudent for the hotel to mention this before our booking or at least at during check-in.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Client services, consideration for the customer, especially if the hotel is conducting maintenance. How about scheduling maintenance times better?
review.locationRemarks: 5 min from the center of Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: This was a great location. The concierge was extremely helpful and the staff was great. I didn't give a 5 for facilities because they were still finishing up some of the rooms, we were on the 3rd floor. So during the day there was a little banging and hammering with construction guys finishing up rooms.  I will stay here again. First time to San Francisco and will not be the last.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs a pool. Everything else was great.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to Fisherman's Wharf. Little Italy is not far and Chinatown is close as well. Didnt need a car, everything you need is right there close by

review.reviewText: Everything was just fine.  Close to the pier(s), close to great food, clean, and fun decor.  All members of our expedition successfully accomplished sleeping and bathing here.  I personally found the aroma of the shampoo quite pleasing.  One member of our party threatened to steal a throw pillow because she liked it.  Hotel staff suggested we check with their supervisor.  We declined.  Pillow not stolen.

review.title: Very close to Lombard st and fisherman's wharf
