Also, we were told granola and yogurt on third floor were complimentary, but door was locked and we could not access items. Does granola have to be kept under lock and key...lol????
review.positiveRemarks: Great location
review.negativeRemarks: Disclose if there is ongoing construction at hotel when room is booked.
review.locationRemarks: See above

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: We were in a newly renovated room. It was modern and clean. 2 Queen beds was a huge plus for our family of four! Other rooms were being renovated, luckily we weren't right beside one, so noise was not a factor.
review.negativeRemarks: Storage for clothes was clunky. Not a big deal, but an alternative to the big metal locker should be considered.
review.locationRemarks: Location was only couple blocks off Fisherman's Wharf and cable cars. Marriott, Holiday Inn, Hyatt were within stones throw if you are considering the

review.title: Very convenient to many sights by foot!
review.reviewText: We loved our stay at pier 2620! Very nice hotel with a friendly staff and our breakfast there was delicious!! It was the perfect choice for our stay! Will def be back when in San Fran !

review.title: Excelent hotel
review.reviewText: I was verry pleased with this hotel. It's located a very short distance to the water front.

review.title: Great Staff
review.reviewText:
Our oldest son wanted to visit San Francisco as his graduation from high school trip.  We booked 2 rooms for the 6 of us (3 adults, 2 teenagers and one 7 year old).  The rooms were comfortable and clean.  The theme was a little industrial for our taste but it was clean and nice.  
The hotel was under construction so we had no water for part of one day and it was dusty in parts of the hall.  Despite that, the staff of the hotel more than made up for that.  
I made a huge mistake in the dates so we had stay an extra day.  The entire city was sold out so the hotel staff, particularly Alicia (sp.?) was so helpful.  Alicia called several hotels to see if we could get a room for an extra night.  She then worked out a deal with her manager and got us a room for the night and even got us an extra roll away for one of the kids.  She also got us breakfast!  We also did not have time to ship a package that we bought so she took our package to UPS for us after we left and gave change to the house keepers.  WOW!!!! We have never gotten treatment this good anywhere before.  She was truly heaven sent!
Needless to say, we would recommend this hotel to anyone!
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were very, very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: There was a homeless man on the sidewalk under our window for a couple of nights philosophizing loudly at 4:00am.  Security would be nice.
review.locationRemarks: It is 3 blocks from Pier 39 so there are all types of activities and cruises.  The aquarium is near there.  There are many great restaurants.

review.reviewText: Good price and location. Close to everything and staff very helpful
This was a great hotel. Clean, fun and walking distance to the Pier. Great location.

review.title: What a nice surprise!!
review.reviewText:
Arriving in SF without reservations made yet, we needed a place to stay. We went on-line and found something close to the wharf. This hotel is very well situated in the middle of "everything"!! The staff is gracious and accommodating. The room was recently remodeled (like yesterday) and so so so comfortable.

Thank you!!
review.positiveRemarks: Everything
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing

review.title: Awesome
review.reviewText: From the minute we arrived-everyone very friendly and very helpful !! Always pointing us in the right direction!!

review.title: decent hotel, bad customer service
review.reviewText: Although this hotel looked nice, was clean, had comfy beds, and close proximity to attractions, the hotel staff was not responsive or very friendly and the traffic noise and the noise of others was easy to hear...and I am hard of hearing. For the price, this hotel was not worth it.

review.title: Great hotel in a great location.
review.reviewText: Thanks to Expedia for finding me a great hotel in a great location at a price I could afford!  I would recommend this hotel.  I can't think of a bad thing to say about it.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was wonderful.
review.locationRemarks: Walk to Pier 39.

review.title: Nice hotel and great location
review.reviewText: Hotel is close to Ghirardelli Square, Pier 39, great restaurants, local and touristy shopping. The hotel consequirs were so helpful and friendly. On 3rd day had no water from 10-4pm due to hotel renovations and had no notice since we booked through Expedia, but hotel credit me $100 towards my bill which made me happy. Lots of street noise, but I was able to sleep through it. Had to have my room key reprogrammed 3 times to get it to work, seemed as though other guest had the same problem. I will definitely stay at this hotel again because of the location, room renovations and friendly staff. The renovations should be completed by my next trip.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, room renovations, helpful consequirs.
review.negativeRemarks: Street noise, better communication to guest regarding water outages, free breakfast or make it less expensive
review.locationRemarks: Great location, near Ghirardelli Square, Pier 39, great restaurants, near several transportation modes, not a bad walk to Chinatown or Pier 33

review.title: We absolutely loved the room and its location.
review.reviewText: We appreciated the friendliness of the hotel staff and all of the help from the concierge.  I would definitely recommend this hotel to visitors in San Francisco.  It was in a great location, and the rooms were really clean.
review.positiveRemarks: The cleanliness of the room/no pets.  I do not like to see pets where I am going to sleep or eat.
review.locationRemarks: Ghirardelli Square is nearby, Lombard Street is not far, the Fisherman's Wharf is a couple of blocks away.  The tour companies are nearby as well.

review.reviewText: House keepers collected the used towels but didn't offer clean ones.

review.title: Great location & friendly staff.
review.reviewText: Great location & friendly staff. Room was small but the design was absolutely charming!!! The hotel is under construction, upgrading rooms and that was a bit noisy but didn't disrupt our sleep. When we arrived the water was shut off but it was back on within minutes. The hotel lacks a spa. Would have loved that option. Otherwise it was perfect!
Great place to stay. Got hotel last minute. Staff was great. Facility was good too.

review.title: Nice hotel, near all the tourist traps.
review.reviewText: Concierge was great. Staff was great and friendly. All in all a great hotel. I would stay here again if I ever visit SF again.

review.title: Liked the location which is near Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: We checked in and then went to get on the elevator to go to our room.  No one at the front desk told us you needed to use your room key to operate the elevator. It took us probably 20 mins. to have someone show us what to do.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the location and the room was nice.
review.negativeRemarks: The parking fee of $45.00 a day is steep.  Also had an issue getting out of the garage trying to pay.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, good restaurants & the ferry to Alcatraz were all within walking distance.

review.title: Good Value: Convenient, Affordable and a Safe Bet
review.reviewText: We enjoyed staying at Pier 2620.  The location is a huge win down at Fisherman's Wharf.  You are literally steps away from restaurants, shopping, Starbucks, Walgreens and the famous San Francisco Fisherman's Wharf.  Hotels are expensive in San Francisco and we found Pier 2620 to be a great value.  The room was decent.  Nothing spectacular.  It could have been a bit cleaner in terms of the carpet and the bathroom.  The beds were very comfortable and the sheets very clean with new fresh linens.  The bathroom had seen better days and all surfaces could have use a better wipe down. You wanted to keep your shoes on when it came to the carpet.  I can't be too hard as they are in the process of renovating the hotel and our room was one of the older ones.  Overall we found it quite comfortable.  It had a very nice large flat screen tv and a fridge to store drinks and snacks we bought outside of the hotel.  If you want to buy snacks to keep in the room there is Safeway, Trader Joes and Walgreens all a block or two away.  The Main Lobby is beautiful.  The staff were friendly and tried to be helpful.  The concierge, Debbie, helped us book some tours and she was a delight.  Very helpful with lots of personality.  The Hotel could use a pool.  The fitness room was excellent.  High end equipment and amazing set up. I enjoyed using it.  Overall I would for sure recommend this hotel to people staying in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The location.  Price.  Basic amenities.  The gym was fantastic.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs a pool.  The staff are all eager to help, but clearly could be 1st class with a bit of professional training in customer service.
review.locationRemarks: Great restaurants.  So close and convenient to Fisherman's Wharf.  Easy for shopping.  Close to groceries.

review.title: Great hotel close to the wharf area.
review.reviewText:
We were able to walk to the many  things happening around Fisherman's Whart and the North Beach area of San Francisco. 
I had a wonderful morning walk from the hotel around and up Lombard's crooked street, up Coit Tower hill, down Filberts stairs and back to the hotel along the piers. Awesome.

review.title: Swanky remodeled (6/2015) hotel near SF waterfront
review.reviewText: Great hotel, easy access to waterfront fun and great restaurants. It was in the middle of a remodel when I went but the staff was helpful and the place was pleasant, fun, and artistic.
review.positiveRemarks: New decor is swanky without being uncomfortable or non-functional for a business traveler. Great fitness center with lots of equipment.
review.negativeRemarks: Not much.
review.locationRemarks: Waterfront is minutes away.

review.title: Convenient Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location. You get some street noise but not too bad. We didn't like the sliding bathroom door. And there was only one hook for hanging towels. For the price, breakfast should have been included. The staff was friendly and helpful. The beds comfy and nice to have a fridge.

Awesome, helpful staff with great recommendations for local restaurants. 
Great location close to Fiaherman's Warf.

review.title: First Class!
review.reviewText: Extremely professional and friendly staff. Only complaint was that 2 queen bed room was very tight for our family of four to move around each other in. Beds were quite comfortable and restaurant was very good

review.title: friendly staff; great location!
review.reviewText:
We were on the third floor and had comfortable beds, a quiet room and an outlook on to the pleasant courtyard.
Although renovations are on going, they were not intrusive, and when finished this hotel will be top notch.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, and Location.
review.negativeRemarks: Lighting in the room, reading difficult. We relished having a bath after a lot  of walking but found the bathtub shallow and slippery. Safety bars?
review.locationRemarks: Equal distance from Cable Car turnarounds and Fisherman's Wharf, and Trolley bus routes.

review.title: Made Our Last Day in SF Super Special!
review.reviewText:
I was apprehensive at first due to other reviews mentioning an ongoing renovation. But seeing the pictures, hotel seems nice and location is great. I checked in with Priscilla and she was the friendliest. :) She made me feel at ease and welcome compared to previous receptionists I've encountered in our road trip. after a quick check-in, we parked at the self-parking garage (parking fee is $45). We then proceeded to 3rd Floor. The room that we got was HUGE for all three of us! 0_0 I love the window part where you could sit and watch people & cars passed by. One thing though, I think our room was newly renovated cause of the smell. But it wasn't that strong. We sort of adjust the AC before leaving our room for some sightseeing and when we came back, the smell sort of went away. It smelled much better than when we first open the room. 

Anyway, we enjoyed our stay in this hotel. Our room/bed was clean, there's coffee,creamers, & sugar. The bathroom has bottles of shampoo, conditioner, and body wash (body wash was empty already but they have a bar soap too). So, it wasn't a big deal for me. We had our breakfast too in the hotel. Continental breakfast is about $14 and buffet is $21 something. I mistakenly grabbed some eggs and oatmeal but the waiter said it was okay I was just charged for the continental. Supposedly, for continental breakfast, you could pretty much grabbed anything EXCEPT for the hot food, otherwise it would be the the buffet price. :D
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is just a walking distance from Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square, and if your up for walk, I think Lombard St is pretty close?
review.negativeRemarks: Hopefully the hotel can find a way to get rid of the newly renovated-smell? Also, pls provide brown sugar for coffee and max 4 creamers per 2 guests?
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square, USS Pampanito tour, Lombard St.

review.reviewText: Great modern hotel. Just a little noisy from the traffic. Ear plugs provided were helpful
Excellent rooms and staff, I will stay every time.

review.title: Walking distance to the wharf
review.reviewText: Hotel is undergoing renovations, with extremely thin walls. Power in room kept going in and out while they were working on the floor below us.

review.title: Nice hotel, great location near the wharf
review.reviewText: Right near the heart of Fisherman's Wharf. Excellent location and wonderful staff- so friendly and helpful.  Rooms are nice and beds are comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and staff
review.locationRemarks: The Wharf is only a couple blocks away. So much to do and see nearby. Bike around the city, over the Golden Gate Bridge, visit Alcatraz.

review.title: our hotel stay
review.reviewText: We arrived and found out there was construction going on. We were given a room in the newly remodeled section only to go in and smell paint so badly that my asthma kicked in.  We asked for a room change and went to a pre remodel room with the sound of construction right above our head. we asked for a room change again and got the same thing.  This was one of the worst nights we spent in a hotel room. next day I complained to the hotel management. He said he would call me and follow up. I have not heard anything back yet despite my calls.
review.positiveRemarks: location

review.title: Nice hotel.  Great area.
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice.  Staff were friendly and helpful.   Great area.

review.title: Good hotel but don't use until July 2015
review.reviewText: I love this hotel. I have stayed there four times. However, it is currently under renovation. I booked a king suite and had to move to two queen room trying to avoid the noise of jackhammering. The room adjacent to the next room the offered us was also under construction. They start early and don't quit until after 7 pm even tho the desk assured us they would quit at 6 pm. I was very upset and they were booked up so could not offer us anything else. They apparently will be finished after July 2015. If you are looking for peace and quiet look elsewhere.
review.positiveRemarks: It is clean and comfortable and close to everything and the newly updated rooms are beautiful
review.negativeRemarks: At least let people know that you are under construction
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans wharf, cable cars, piano bar and all site seeing opportunities

review.title: Whitewashed picket fence and distressed abode
review.reviewText: Modern lobby and friendly staff did not compensate for fading carpets in odiferous corridors. Same old carpet in guest room was less disturbing than dirt and debri left on desk from prior guest and used hand towel hanging in bathroom. Pricing and prior ratings do NOT reflect accommodations!

review.title: Nice hotel close to many tourist attractions
review.reviewText: Very convenient for people who will be taking any type of tour as they are walking distance from Fishermans Wharf. Very clean and comfortable!

review.title: Hotel is in process of remodeling during the day
review.reviewText: Walking distance to attractions or cable cars to Union Square. Very nice service. The noise in daytime is loud from new construction/remodeling.
review.positiveRemarks: employees and location

review.title: Great everything.
review.reviewText: Close to good spots. Many reasons to stay here. Helpful front desk with trips and tsxi

review.title: Nice hotel close to Fisherman Wharf
review.reviewText: We got to the hotel before check in,we were told that our room was not ready. We went and had lunch and got a call letting us know that our room was ready. We got the top floor facing the courtyard like I requested. Everyone was very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Boutique hotel in the midst of renovation
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel for its good location, two blocks back from the Fisherman's Wharf waterfront. Unfortunately our room was at the front corner of the hotel, directly under the renovations and rubbish skip outside, which made for a very noisy first evening. The duty manager, Gisele, kindly accommodated our request for a room change and we found the newly upgraded room to be stylish and comfortable. However, we couldn't understand the absence of sound proofing/double glazing at the windows. They let every sound from the pavement and busy road junction into the room by day and by night. There was a demonstration at the nearby Hyatt hotel throughout our stay and we heard every chant of complaint about that establishment. We also had a false fire alarm at 0100 in the morning and spent the rest of the day walking up and down the stairs while the elevator doors were re-set. The reception desk staff seemed tired and resigned to the disruption of the ongoing renovations. A mixed review reflecting the ups and downs of our stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, location, location. Polite, gracious duty manager.
review.negativeRemarks: Sound proofing of rooms. Walk-in showers, not dangerous bath/showers.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf + Piers 39 & 33 - Alcatraz. Old San Remo hotel with live jazz music. Trolley cars. Jeremiah O'Brien liberty ship. Golden Gate Bridge

review.title: Clean hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: Best part of this hotel was that it was within walking distance to everything! It was clean, staff was very kind, and overall a wonderful experience. I would stay here again

review.title: Hotel Under Construction
review.reviewText:
Very disappointed with this stay, arrived hoping for a nice relaxing 2 day break. Instead we arrived to find the hotel under very noisy construction ( had I been made aware of this prior to my arrival I would have stayed elsewhere). The hotel switched the water off for full day so no chance of freshening up before heading out to explore. The construction was happening in the room above us, constant hammering and power tools etc. We called the front desk to ask how long the noise would likely last and they were most unhelpful and unapologetic. The hotel also lost power for about 4 hours. The staff seemed really uninterested about helping improve our stay. After check in we went to our room to find our key cards didn't work and we couldn't get it, had to return to desk to get a new set which also didn't work after 2 trips up and down with luggage the bell man eventually escorted us to our room and had to try multiple cards before we could get in. There was a tray of left over room service food outside our door when we arrived that the bell man said he would have removed immediately, it sat there for 2 days despite housekeeping cleaning each morning.
A hotel without water or electricity that's under construction doesn't lead to a great stay. Expected better from a "nice" hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Walking distance to local attractions. Lots of amenities close by.
review.negativeRemarks: Advance warning of major construction for guests would be nice.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Wishermans Wharf, Embarcadero etc. lots of nearby restaurants.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel has a great location, great facilities and great staff. It would have scored much higher on comfort and cleanliness had it not been for the refurbishment going on. We stayed in the middle of the rework so had a lot of noise and mess. We mentioned our desire to move a couple of times to the desk staff who were unable to help, if it were just for a couple of nights it would have Ben fine but we stayed for six!
review.positiveRemarks: The location to fishermans wharf is superb. Within the hotel the staff are all friendly, welcoming and helpful
review.negativeRemarks: Once the refurbishment is complete this will be an exceptional hotel choice for a stay in the fishermans wharf area.
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans wharf is so close you can taste the sea food!

review.title: Excellent for short break
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel very close to fishermans wharf , the hotel are having work done at moment which is ok, just a little noisy.
review.positiveRemarks: Position

review.title: Very good location.
review.reviewText: The only problem we had was the noise from the floor upstairs.  The floor creaked and we could hear every footstep, frustating when they people upstairs were getting up at 6:00 am.  We mentioned it at check out all the clerk did was apologize.  We stayed in room 128 I would not recommend it.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Fix the creaky floor
review.locationRemarks: Bus close to Golden Gate Bridge, 5 min walk to Fishermans warf, safeway, little Italy, crooked road, starbucks.  Location is very convenient.

review.title: Newly refurbished and perfect location
review.reviewText:
We had the most wonderful time in San Francisco and the stay at this hotel definitely enhanced it. Although the hotel is currently being refurbished this didn't effect our stay in the least. On arrival my boyfriend had organised with the lovely hotel staff for flowers and champagne for my birthday. We had one of the new rooms which are very modern, clean and comfy. I especially loved the choice of lighting in the room. We had to pay for a parking but there were plenty of spaces with in and out privileges. The wifi was complimentary and fast, although on the first night we couldn't seem to connect but it was all sorted by the morning. 

We were there for 4 nights total and would highly recommend this place to others.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: This is a block from Fishermans Wharf and if you like seafood is the place to be. We also like walking and every street is different so walking into town was fun for us. It is also easy to walk to the Bridge. We enjoyed the Hotel and the location.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, renovated big rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Could be a bit cheaper.
review.locationRemarks: Boat tours, eating seafood, walking.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel, it's within walking distance of just about everything. the hotel itself is clean and elegant. However they had construction going during our stay and you could hear drilling pounding and the workers speaking through the walls. Making it hard to relax in the room. I think the staff could have managed this a little better or disclosed this shortly after booking.instead of finding out when we check in.  Overall good hotel.

review.title: Return to the bay
review.reviewText:
The hotel is in a good location ,a couple of blocks from pier 39 ,so easy access.
You could have been anywhere in the world, the rooms had no real character, they were clean, comfortable but very generic.
10 minutes walk to pier 39 for all the great fish restaurants, and easy access for the Cable cars and street cars.
There was a restaurant  and breakfast buffet, we did not use this, we chose to go to the Hollywood cafe for a fantastic start to the day.
review.positiveRemarks: Location.

review.title: Very Clean Hotel in High Traffic Area
review.reviewText:
First impression was very clean hotel in a safe neighborhood.  I've stayed in other area's of San Francisco and this was the nicest.  The reception area was always staffed, it smelled nice and everyone was friendly.  There are 2 elevators that work with your room key.  There was a well equipped fitness room and lovely courtyard outfitted with outdoor lounge furniture and patio heaters.

The room/bathroom were impeccably clean and smelled fresh.  The windows in the room could open to allow fresh air.  The heat and air conditioning worked perfectly.  The room had a desk/chair w/USB charging ports, an overstuffed chair w/ottoman, a giant LCD TV, 2 cup coffee machine, iron/ironing board, hairdryer, and very nice toiletries.   The shower head was a little lower than expected, but powerful with plenty of hot water.  My room had 2 very comfortable queen size pillow top beds with fresh linens and small table in between with a lamp.  There was a dresser with two sets of drawers and a semi-cool refrigerator.  

Because this hotel is in a high traffic area of the city you should expect city and tourist noises at ALL hours.  Which means people and city utility noises (street sweepers, trash collection).  The windows in the room DO NOT block out the city noises and we had to run the air all night as white noise.  There was sufficient insulation to block noise from other rooms and the hallway.

PROTIP: They will block 100$USD/night for incidentals, not once but for every night of your stay
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean, always smelled nice, friendly staff, VERY close to a number of activities and restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: We had a constant issue with our room key cards not working in the door lock.  Very frustrating, but the front desk staff fixed it each time.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Chinatown, North Beach(Italian), Fishermans Wharf, Ghirardelli Square, 2 Cable Car lines, Trolley, Bus, and Restaurants.

review.title: Noisy stay, good food
review.reviewText: Good location. Clean. Lots of traffic noise heard in rooms making it difficult to sleep. Construction going on inside. Very little sound proofing in rooms. Could hear everyone around you and outside. We had 8 people in 3 rooms because one of our booked rooms was given to someone else. Hotel over booked because of construction. couldn't get a receipt at the end of stay to show that we were not charged for the first night. Front desk workers did not let others' know what was going on with bookings and rooms. Lots of confusion about our rooms and information was not passed along. Front desk staff need more training. Concierge was rude because she couldn't get her phone to work and she was not very knowledgeable.
review.positiveRemarks: Food staff were very pleasant, helpful and extremely accommodating. Food was delicious and hot. Lobby and dining areas were pleasant. Great beds.
review.negativeRemarks: Sound proofing. Knowledge and ability of many, though not all front desk. A welcoming concierge.
review.locationRemarks: Very well situated. Easy to walk to many venues, restaurants, shopping, wharf.

review.title: Walking distance to wharf
review.reviewText: Walked to little Italy, China town, fishermans wharf, walgreens across street was convenient

review.title: Website is deceiving
review.reviewText:
This hotel has a very nice website and the lobby is updated and nice, but the same attention has not been given to the rooms.  
My room was aged with stains on seats, and worn furniture. The toilet paper holders fell off the wall when I pulled on the paper and the toilet broke and would not flush. 
Would not return, especially for what I paid.

review.title: Perfect location!
review.reviewText: This is the second year in a row that I've brought my gymnastics team to stay here we we visit San Francisco . It's the perfect location for our short stay!

review.title: LOCATION WAS ONLY POSITIVE
review.reviewText: BEING SOMEONE WHOM TRAVELS OFTEN I WAS DISAPPOINTED IN MY EXPERIENCE WITH PIER 2620. THE WHOLE THIRD FLOOR WAS UNDER CONSTRUCTION SO THE ANYONE ON THE SECOND FLOOR WAS AWAKENED AT 730 AM EVERY MORNING MY DRILLING, BANGING, AND SAWING. OUR ROOM WAS ALSO EQUIPPED WITH ONLY ONE TOWEL FOR THE ENTIRE ROOM WITH TWO OCCUPANTS STAYING THERE. ONCE I BROUGHT MY ISSUES TO THE STAFFS ATTENTION IT SEEMED AS IF THEY COULD CARE LESS. TO TOP EVERYTHING OFF I WAS SURPRISED BY THE INCREASE IN PRICE FOR PARKING BY $10 A NIGHT WHICH WAS NOT DISCLOSED ON WEBSITE OR BOOKING SITE. I WOULD NEVER CONSIDER STAYING AFTER THIS EXPERIENCE. NOT THE QUALITY YOU WOULD EXPECT FOR SPENDING OVER A $1,000 FOR TWO NIGHTS
review.positiveRemarks: LOCATION AND LOCATION ONLY
review.negativeRemarks: QUALITY OF STAFF AND IF GOING TO BE DOING CONSTRUCTION TO DO IT IN SECTION AND NOT HAVE GUESTS STAY RIGHT BELOW THE WORK SITE
review.locationRemarks: SHOPPING AND DINING

review.title: Great location to so many attractions
review.reviewText: Clean and comfortable but San Fran expensive! Very friendly staff and willing to help any way by can

Everyone was super helpful and nice. There was a bit of construction noise during the day but we weren't in our room to sleep other than at night so it wasn't a bother. Very clean and appears to be newly remodeled. We will most likely stay again next time we go to visit.

review.title: Nice and comfortable hotel near the Piers
review.reviewText: Staff was very nice, clean and comfortable  rooms and beds; the hotel located in a safe area near the Piers and Ghirardelli Square,

review.title: OMG...the NOISE!
review.reviewText: Our first room was #201, which was next to a busy highway, smh. It was as though, the traffic was in our room! The first night at this hotel was horrible, so the next day, we asked and was granted another room. Room #259, was not any better. There was active construction happening above our room between the hours of 9am-7pm. Before knowing the noise was construction, I thought there was a bowling alley above our room, and furthermore, the walls are VERY thin because my husband and I were able to actually hear our neighbor's conversation word for word. We asked for another room due to the overhead construction and were told, "The complete 3rd floor was under construction, so the noise was unavoidable." I asked why was that not advertised on their website because I would have never booked that hotel if I had known that fact because we were in San Fransisco 9 days. An apology was given, but the damage was already done. On a brighter note, the concierge, Joanne-the Social Butterfly-was an angel! She was so attentive and sincere; she was the ONLY positive experience about Pier 2620.

review.title: Sunday in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hotel close to busy wharf area - great for walking to catch boat ride, sample an ice cream from the famous chocolateer, or see the Giants play. Currently there are renovations going on/ sleeping in not suggested!

review.title: Hotel 10 minutes from the waterfront
review.reviewText: No issues to report and the hotel was very tidy and good value for money
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent gym - most impressed
review.locationRemarks: 10 minutes from waterfront

review.title: Good location, shame about the noise in the room
review.reviewText:
Room very noisy. Adjoining door to next room lets all noise in and outside windows let all the noise in. Windows need to be double glazed and sealed. Can not darken room too well if you want to sleep in.
We were double charged for our room so make sure you check your credit card statement before leaving the Hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was good. Getting refurbished which was nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise entering into the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything at Fisherman's Warf

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Great spot to travel around from. Bed was very comfortable and San Francisco is an amazing city! Can't wait to visit again.

review.title: Very walk-able to everything...
review.reviewText: We stayed for 3 nights and that is all we did at the hotel; return at night to sleep. It was easy access; clean, friendly staff. We were on the first floor where there is a gym although we never used it. There was a decent size outdoor patio that appeared inviting but too chilly to be out at night. 2 queen beds for a family of 4 was decent. It appeared to be more for business travelers since we don't recall seeing any other kids besides ours.

review.title: Location, Location... Nice.
review.reviewText:
The hotel is quite close to Pier #39 (Fisherman's wharf) you'll see that on the map, pleasing staff members all around.

Now the rooms, they can be a bit on the noisy side (specially with spring break at the helm).  The walls are some what thin, there fore snoring, heavy walking (if your on the 1st. or 2nd. floor) slamming of doors at 3:am, is very noticeable.

Staff will try to accommodate you the best they can.. hence, Excellence on there part.

Happy Stay... ;-)
review.positiveRemarks: Staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Better insulation between rooms.
review.locationRemarks:
There's museums, bike rides, be prepared to walk, eat and people watch..don't forget the iPhone.. 
This was my town so please take care of it.. lol.

review.title: Very near fisherman's wharf and pier 39
review.reviewText: They are working on finishing a hotel renovation...we were on the second floor and construction started upstairs on Friday morning while we were still in the room.  The room and beds were very nice- we stayed with two kids and the queen size beds were a nice change from the doubles that we had been staying in during most of our driving trip up the coast.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable beds, location to cable cars, fisherman's wharf, and pier 39
review.negativeRemarks: It will be a great place to stay once they have completed all of their renovation.
review.locationRemarks: Easy walking distance to all of the wharf activities.  Great starting point for cable cars.

review.title: Nice clean hotel with a great staff
review.reviewText: Great location that's close to many points of interests, the hotel staff were very helpful with questions and accommodations, The room was nice and clean plus the bed was very comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel staff were very friendly and the room was clean and comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Fisherman's Wharf and the Trolleys, many points of interest and places to dine nearby that were all within walking distance.

review.title: Very good location - access to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Staff was very good.  Concierge was helpful in planning activities.  Rooms were very clean.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, cleanliness, staff friendliness/helpful
review.negativeRemarks: Pretty satisified with everything
review.locationRemarks: Only a couple blocks to Fisherman's Wharf where there are many activities and restaurants.

review.title: Pier 2620-great location okay hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was a GREAT location to all the main attractions. Steps away from Fisherman's wharf, the F line, cable cars, tours, and ghiradelli that has a beautiful view of the San francisco bridge. Hotel itself is under construction but that was only a slight inconvience when we took a mid day nap. Most of the construction was done between 9-6. Also the elevators were out of service for a period of time. Ohhh and in order to go up in the elevator to your room you have to insert your room key above the floor numbers, no one told us that and we couldn't figure out why we weren't moving (front desk needs to tell guests this when u check in) and throughout our trip we found new guests having the same problem.

review.title: Nice hotel - easily accessible to everything
review.reviewText:
The hotel's location is great! Don't bother with a car unless you're planning on spending a lot of time out of the city. The trams, trolleys and buses are all a very short walking distance away. It was a little on the noisy side but trade off of convenience is worth it. The staff were all helpful and friendly.
A few words of advice for the area:
Book the Alcatraz tour far in advance. We had pre-booked but many people in line to buy tickets were going to be out of luck. Sold out for the next week
If planning on Muir Woods by car, plan on a long walk from car to park during busy season (and will involve steep hills).
The #39 bus takes you from a block from the hotel to the base of Coit Tower - it's a very steep hill by foot. 
I would recommend Pier 2620. It's a reasonably priced hotel. It has a little more than the basics but everything you need for a city trip

review.title: Horrible early construction noise
review.reviewText: At check out, when I complained about the construction noise it became "my fault" for not telling them about it at 7 in the morning when it started. Get this, they would have "switched my room" at 7 am in the morning AFTER allowing the noise in the first place. As if somehow everyone wants to change rooms this early in the morning. THIS HOTEL DOES NOT CARE ABOUT CUSTOMER SERVICE.
review.positiveRemarks: It has an excellent location. So pick another near hotel. There are lots of other hotels nearby.
review.negativeRemarks: The noise and the argumentative staff.
review.locationRemarks: Near Fisherman's Wharf and an easy walk to Columbus Avenue.

review.title: Good location, close to Fishermen Warf.
review.reviewText: Pier 2620 was enjoyable, liked the free coffee in the morning but not the breakfast buffet, very expensive.  Lots of breakfast very close to hotel. Enjoyed our stay in San Francisco. Biked the Golden Gate Bridge, cable car rides, hiking at Muir Woods, good food. Great experience!

review.title: Location location location
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is perfect for its price tag. The staff is nice, but lacked local knowledge. They were doing some major construction right above our room and I would have appreciated knowing that before I booked. They also turned the water off for 4 hours one day and that was very inconvenient. The house keeping didn't bothet swapping out our used washed clothes with new ones the entire week. At the end of the day, it was convenience that makes this hotel worth the money. I think when they get their construction completed and housekeeping in order this place will get better ratings.

review.title: More than adequate
review.reviewText:
This hotel is conveniently located with very polite and helpful staff. The rooms were spare but clean and the bed was very comfortable. The Bay Grill for breakfast was also convenient as was the printer for boarding passes, etc. The concierge was available to hail a taxi and to store our luggage.
No complaints at all except for $48 parking fee which I guess goes with the territory.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the location, the staff and the cleanliness.
review.negativeRemarks: I missed having a mini-fridge in the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf was a few blocks away with all the sights and eateries there. Public transportation was also near.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Had a nice stay at Pier 2620.  The room was older but very clean and the staff was very friendly.  It was close/walking distance to many things and the area felt very safe.  Our one complaint was that it was pretty loud.  You could hear lots of traffic and people above us.  I think a lot of that comes with it being an older building.
review.positiveRemarks: Walking Distance to a lot of tourist attractions.  Very Clean. Very Friendly and Helpful staff
review.negativeRemarks: Our one complaint was that it was pretty loud.  You could hear lots of traffic and people above us.  I think a lot of that comes with it being an olde
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, Alcatraz Cruises, Cable Car and Ghirardelli's Square.

review.title: Hotel was conveniently located to Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Nice room, the staff were extremely helpful with all our sightseeing questions, they gave many excellent recommendations.

review.title: Hotel
review.reviewText:
It was under renovation !! Also no water during the day (6,30 hrs) for 2 days..

Comfy clean rooms & friendly staff

Disappointed abt not having a restaurant !! 

Expensive for self parkg In garage!!
Convenient location 
Excellent food nearby

review.title: Great SF Hotel close (enough) to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
My wife and I stayed here overnight on the night of our anniversary.  Very pleased with our experience.

Hotel fronts onto a two way street making it easy to access by car. Valet parking right out front of the hotel was quick and courteous (although like everywhere in SF, not cheap). Grea

We checked-in around 3 in the afternoon on a Saturday and reception was not busy at all.  Reception staff were attentive and friendly and within minutes we were on our way up to our room. Our room was on the first floor.  The room itself was more than adequately large, clean and well maintained.  Nice to see actual tea and coffee service in the room instead of just one bag of nasty drip coffee. Only downside to our room was that it was right next to the courtyard. There are shutter blinds on the windows to provide adequate privacy though. Luckily for us though, no-one was in the courtyard so we could open up the windows since it was such a pleasant day outside.

There was a four-piece Jazz band playing downstairs that evening from 7 p.m. (no cover charge) so before heading out for our 9 p.m. reservation we were able to stop by for a pre-dinner drink. Have to say the band was excellent! 

We never used room service but all of the staff I passed in the halls were very friendly.

No hassle with check-out and the valet had our car out front in minutes after handing them check.  They do have a convenient call ahead service to have your car waiting out front for you if you're in a hurry.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean.  Curteous staff. Nice bar/lounge. Free Jazz! Location, location, location.
review.locationRemarks: Couple of blocks from Fisherman's Wharf - close but not too close! Starbucks round the corner, Safeway and Walgreens pharmacy close by.

review.title: Nice experience
review.reviewText: Centrally located near Fisherman's Wharf but away from most of the fray.  Near the street car F line and trolley car stops.  Near car rentals.  Clean. Friendly.  Secure.

review.title: Great location, nice rooms, good ammentities
review.reviewText: This hotel was perfect for the type of stay we needed.  Unfortunately, upon check in we learned that the water would be off for three hours every mid-day because of construction on the third floor.  Ok that's not too bad because we were usually out sightseeing during those three hours, but construction started early and the dumpster was right under our room on the street and we had to hear banging around as a company would come to empty it or pull it away and drop off a new one around 5:00 am each morning!  Not cool.  I still rated the hotel as if none of this was going on because under non construction mode I think it fits our needs.
review.positiveRemarks: see above
review.negativeRemarks: see above

review.title: Nice Hotel

review.title: Average hotel, close to wharf.
review.reviewText: This hotel is ok; nothing special. It is just a few blocks from the wharf. There is a Trader Joe's 2 blocks away, which is very convenient. The staff was friendly. There are renovations under way. Some of the carpeting & wall paper is dated, but the place is clean & functional.
Nice place. Very convenient! The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful.
Window latch was broken and could not stay completely closed.

review.title: Nice hotel close to pier39
review.reviewText: Very good experience. Friendly staff. Comfortable beds..walking distance to pier 39, and restaurants.

review.title: great Staff- Poor accommodation
review.reviewText: TV was very short on selection.  Ice maker did not work and was never repaired although mentioned several times to various staff members.  Noisy location and construction on above floors on going,  even weekend. Outrageous charges for parking.  Very few amenities.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: TV - movies.  Removal of trash along outside of property.

review.title: Nice hotel near the Wharf
review.reviewText: The streets surrounding the hotel are very noisy at night, especially Columbus.  Lots of horn honking and loud voices from the street.  Did not sleep well on any of the 5 nights we stayed.  Room was very nice and the staff were friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms were nicely renovated and clean

review.title: Great location.  Very expensive parking.

review.title: Decent Hotel
review.reviewText: Overall okay hotel with really fast daily room cleaning service. You can tell this hotel has been around for a while with some small broken furniture like broken cabinet and opened air condition. Huge TV and comfy bed, but internet connection will hang sometimes. A bit noisy on the Jones St. side at night. Overall great location around the Wharf area.

review.title: Horrible hotel to stay
review.reviewText: No AC, No internet. Costed 340$ per day.lolz am not kidding . Would never Stay again.

review.title: Nice hotel walking distance from the pier
review.reviewText: Overall an excellent experience with this hotel. Very well maintained and excellent staff. Will be using them in the future

review.title: Wonderful location

review.positiveRemarks: Comfy and clean. Felt very safe.
review.negativeRemarks: None

review.title: Great Stay

review.locationRemarks: couple blocks from the warf, lots within walking distance.

review.title: Beautiful hotel.

review.positiveRemarks: Location.
review.negativeRemarks: Room décor could be modernised.

review.title: Excellent hotel 2 blocks' walk from Wharf.
review.reviewText: Enjoyed a week in San Fran with my girlfriend...first time for her in SF. Loved that we were literally couple of blocks from all the action in Fisherman's Wharf and Ghirardelli Square. Many restaurants, bars, cafes, galleries nearby. Many boat tours depart from nearby Pier 39. The place to stay in San Fran! Hotel was modern, chic and very clean. Staff was helpful and friendly. Great deal!
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean. Modern chic decor. Very updated and comfortable. Large rooms. Very close to many popular spots.
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. Boat and bus tours depart from the wharf. In the opposite direction is Ghirardelli Square with many cafes and shops.

review.title: Hotel 2620
review.reviewText:
Hotel was well placed for Fisherman's Wharf.  Staff were friendly and helpful. Room was clean and adequate.
Only one problem - we were on the front and twice a week a cleaning truck comes past at 2-4 am and is quite noisy! Otherwise stay was good.
review.positiveRemarks: Well placed for Fisherman's Wharf.  Friendly and helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: This was good value for money and would expect it to be costlier if improvements were made
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is just two blocks away from the front at Fisherman's Wharf (two minute walk!) with all its attractions and you get a real feel for the city

review.title: Nice hotel, very close to Fishermans Warf.
review.reviewText: Was able to walk to just about everything we wanted to see and do.

review.title: Great hotel in the heart of SF Bay!
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel with very comfy beds and a big tv with lots of channels! Room was bigger than it looked in pictures and the staff was very friendly. Awesome wine bar down stairs and walking distance to everything San Francisco! Will definitely be going back soon.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfy beds, spacious room, free wifi, clean bathrooms, lots of pillows!
review.negativeRemarks: Arrived at 2pm and none of the rooms were ready yet due to the maids being on lunch. Had to kill some time before  we could check in.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf, Ghirardelli Square, Golden gate bridge, Alcatraz tours, pier 39, sea lions, chinatown, great food.

review.title: Fishermans warf
review.reviewText: We were hardly in our room but anything we needed staff was always friendly and helpful!

The whole experience was great. Nothing about my stay there was negative. They were so nice and accommodating. The location was perfect. Walking distance to most attractions. I will be staying at this hotel again.
good experience, traveled with my family with two teenagers.
review.positiveRemarks: ubication and rates.

review.title: One night to visit San francisco
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, easy walk to Fishermans Wharf. Ate at Scomas.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to wharf
review.negativeRemarks: Need refrigerator with ice freezer in room. I am diabetic, needed to freeze ice block for insulin case
review.locationRemarks: Lots of restaurants and shopping

review.title: Nice but do not stay on the street side
review.reviewText: Just do NOT stay on the street side or loading as Put me. Awake at 2:30am each morning... Loud cars and trucks.

review.title: Nice Hotel, 2 blocks from the wharf
review.reviewText: We had a great time on our trip and a lot of that was due to a great hotel for a good deal. There are a lot of expensive options in the city, but I feel like we got a deal for such a nice hotel. The bed was very comfortable, everything was clean. We loved that the hotel was only two blocks from the wharf. It was easy to get to and it was easy to get on public transit (only a block from the hotel for the bus). Parking  was pretty costly, but probably normal in a big city. We would highly recommend this hotel. No complaints. The concierge staff was extremely helpful answering questions about the best transit deals and recommendations for dinner and outings.
review.positiveRemarks: So close to the wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking rate seemed expensive.
review.locationRemarks: We ate at Tadich grill and had fantastic crab cakes. Took the bus and walked to see the wharf, painted ladies, breweries, etc.

review.title: Comfortable stay
review.reviewText: Comfortable stay. Lovely big beds. Very clean. Handy location for fisherman's wharf. Had a room overlooking the courtyard which was nice and quiet.

review.title: Close to wharf & North Beach
review.reviewText: It is very comfortable and convenient to the pier, Ghiradelli Square and North Beach restaurants. Works just fine for us.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Location is the best. Paying for parking $50 is insane....no breakfast....there are only signs for vending no machines.... Comfortable and clean though.

review.title: Third stop our west coast tour
review.reviewText: Overall good stay, wonderful buffet breakfast, good gym for a hotel , rooms not so great , old plumbing system in bathrooms and a slight scent  of cigarette in bedroom . Valet not very helpful. Saw us arriving by car ( after a ride from Tahoe) and we had nearly to beg him to take our suitcases in.
Nice location, friendly staff, clean rooms, good price for two queen size beds

review.title: SF Weekend
review.reviewText: A quick trip made a little less stressful by the staff and setting. We got rid of our rental car early and the staff gave us credit for that day even though we missed the cutoff. That was great. Staff were friendly and courteous. Concierge was very helpful and knowledgeable.
review.positiveRemarks: Great bedding and ambiance with finishings at the 4 star level. Location was just 2 blocks from everything and self parking downstairs
review.negativeRemarks: No way to turn on A/C to fan only to drown street noise and hallway noise. Pretty quiet otherwise, streets are quiet at night so luckily this was Ok.
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans Warf was quick walk, lots of shops and restaurants. Breakfast nearby were good but high demand. Attractions galore.

review.title: Great location nothing else
review.reviewText:
Quoted wrong price for parking.  Rooms need interior paint, upholstery on couch ripped.  
Location is the only good feature of this hotel.

review.title: Noisy rooms. Noisy refrigerator. Thin walls.
review.reviewText: Noisy rooms. Noisy refrigerator. Thin walls. Upgraded lobby but 2 star rating rooms!

review.title: Happy as a Clam ;)
review.reviewText: Had a wonderful time during my stay. I booked this hotel the day of, and I got a really great deal. It was perfect!
review.positiveRemarks: Awesome Hotel! Very comfortable and unique. felt fresh. Not to mention the AMAZING location!

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel, reasonably priced, and within walking distance of all the attractions at fishermans wharf. My one and only complaint was that parking was outrageous! $48 to park for one night. If I stay in San Francisco again, I'll get a hotel outside the city with free parking.

Comfortable hotel, however with many nights in the 30's ... They never lit the fireplace in the lobby?  It was unusual to see a big Xmas decorated fireplace, yet it was never used. It would have been comfortable warm fire for the guests sitting in the lobby area!

review.title: Walking distance to the wharf, great stay...
review.reviewText: The overall experience was Awesome.. Very clean and comfortable rooms. The wharf and other piers are within walking distance. The only problem was the parking . We thought that the parking garage in the hotel would be included but it's 40 dollars plus taxes each night. It would've been nice to know that ahead of time.

review.title: Great hotel, convenient to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: The hotel is convenient to Fisherman's Wharf, which enabled us to easily walk to restaurants and sightseeing. We did not rent a car -- parking is prohibitive, and driving is not worth the trouble if most of your activity is within the city.  The hotel staff was very friendly and the concierge was most helpful with recommending restaurants, giving directions, providing discount coupons, and giving tips on riding local transit. The hotel restaurant is only open for breakfast, but there is plenty of dining nearby. There is also no ATM, but there is one in the Marriott across the street. When we went into the Marriott there were large groups checking in and out, making us appreciate the quiet lobby of our own hotel. Our room was comfortable, basic with king size bed, easy chair, small refrig, and coffee maker. Bathroom was adequate and clean, though would prefer an arrangement with the toilet in a room separate from the sink. Price of the room was very reasonable thru Expedia. We would definitely stay there again.

review.title: New Year's in San Fran
review.reviewText: We spent a few days over New Year at the hotel.  It has great location just a block from Fisherman's Wharf.  The staff were friendly and helpful, the room (standard double) was a good size for the four of us (two adults and two children), clean and well kept.  Overall a good experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, location, location.  Good service, comfortable rooms and great beds.
review.locationRemarks: A block away from Fisherman's Wharf, 10 minute walk to Pier 39, 15 minute walk to Pier 33 for Alcatraz and a few blocks to Cable Car.

review.title: Nice hotel and convenient location to the pier
review.reviewText: Great experience for my first time in san Francisco

review.title: Nice hotel central to fisherman's wharf.
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was fine. Room was clean and service was good. The hotel staff was not very friendly or helpful when it came to asking directions

review.title: San Francisco hotel close to pier
review.reviewText: Excellent location for tourist activities, clean room, friendly staff
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: None

review.title: should of been a better stay
review.reviewText: The fridge was broken, temp in room would not stay consistent and the made came in as the door sign said privacy.
review.positiveRemarks: clean room and location
review.negativeRemarks: some maintenance

review.title: Close to Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: I stayed here two nights with my wife and two children. It was comfortable and clean. The staff was very helpful and quick to meet our requests. The Internet signal was week in the room so the next morning they moved us and the signal improved. However, even with good signal the speed was painfully slow and we pretty much gave up using the hotel wifi. The location was perfect for us as Fishermans Wharf, Starbucks, Safeway and Walgreens are all close. Overall we enjoyed the experience here. Lastly, the price was okay for comparable hotels and underground parking was secure but expensive.
review.negativeRemarks: WiFi speed needs to be improved, dramatically.

review.title: Comfortable hotel - excellent location
review.reviewText: Very kind and friendly staff - from the concierge to the front desk to housekeepers.  With a brief walk and the city pass, we were able to get everywhere we wanted.  I would highly recommend it.

review.title: Nice remodeled hotel on the Wharf. Super Clean
review.reviewText: Super Clean, Awesome friendly and helpful staff.  Helped us without even asking. Wouldn't accept tips for simple tasks
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness and Helpful Staff
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to almost everything San Francisco

review.title: Great location - just don't get a room steet side
review.reviewText: The parking is overpriced ($57 a night including tax), but so is all of SF - and the side we were in there was a garbage truck every morning around 5:30am - unpleasant wake up call... Beyond those issues the location is great, staff is friendly, and room was comfortable.

review.title: Hotel ok
review.reviewText:
Pros: close to wharf, clean rooms.
Con: stayed on first floor and could hear the guests above me walk around...front desk says its because hotel was built in 70s.

review.title: Great Hotel:Great City
review.reviewText:
Absolutely wonderful hotel. Quiet, clean and with friendly and approachable staff.
I holiday in San Francisco each year and always stay in the Fisherman's Wharf area
due to it's excellent location and amenities, this year due to the Pier 2620 Hotel, this 
year outstripped the previous 3 years. 
Believe me I shall be booking early in 2015 to make sure I'm there again in November.
The excellent fitness room and access to breakfast/snack room on the third floor, which, 
along with attentive service of the Phillipino hostess (sorry I didn't catch her name) really
rounded off such a wonderful experience.
review.locationRemarks: Close to all points of interests and good transport links.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: We loved our stay in San Francisco.  The hotel, Pier 2620, was very clean and the staff was very accomodating.  Its location was perfect for walking to our destinations.
review.positiveRemarks: Location

review.title: Great hotel - one caveat
review.reviewText:
My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Pier 2620 Hotel. The only thing that marred our enjoyment was when we lost the key to the room safe and were charged $150. We were told that the cost was for "breaking into" the safe (implication: taking it apart and rebuilding it). In reality, two workers came to the room with keys on a ring and tried each key until they found one that would open it. The person at the desk explained that they were going to have to drill out the lock and replace it with a new one. 

Our fault for losing the key; a disappointing way to end an otherwise wonderful stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was large and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Changing the room safes to ones with combination locks that can be programmed by the room occupant.
review.locationRemarks: Location is fabulous. It is within walking distance of many wonderful restaurants and other interesting sites.

review.title: Great hotel. Clean, modern and friendly staff.
review.reviewText: Stayed for four nights. I would go back to this hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel, close to cable car and trolley car
review.reviewText:
The hotel is just a couple of blocks walk to Pier 39 and it's really easy to get into central San Francisco using the cable car or trolley streetcar.

Staff were very friendly and helpful. My room was incredibly spacious, included tea and coffee making facilities, was absolutely spotless and the free wifi worked well.

review.title: Great bargain hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: This hotel was a pleasant surprise. The staff was helpful and courteous. Just came off a Hilton franchise and the lobby and fitness room (which was the best hotel fitness I've seen) have been redone. Room was spacious with brand new bed that was extremely comfortable. Very convenient and safe garage parking. Will definitely go back here.
review.positiveRemarks: Pretty much everything.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking fees could be reduced for guests.

review.title: Nice staff and clean room
review.reviewText: I enjoyed the stay. Courteous staff and clean room
It was OK. Room needs updating. Too far, rather stay in union square.

review.title: Great Hotel.
review.reviewText: The hotel was a very nice hotel. Great staff. Very clean. Close to the Pier and most of the tourist stuff. The only problem we had was with other guests at the hotel. There was a group of guys that were partyers. They were loud at all hours of the day and night and were very immature knocking on doors of other guests rooms and running. When we complained to the front desk, (which we had to do twice),  they did upgrade us and move us to another room which was wonderful. But I think the guys were allowed to stay which I felt bad for the other guests.
review.positiveRemarks: The upgrade when we had a problem. That was great for us. There is a restaurant and a lounge at the hotel. No room service though.
review.negativeRemarks: Handle unruly  guests better.
review.locationRemarks: The pier is very close by, lots of seafood restaurants close.. Ghiradelli square is near. Lombard street is near. The base for the tour buses is near.

review.title: Great value, close to the Wharf Action
review.reviewText: Pier 2620 was a very good value for the cost.  I came with my kids and the proximity to the multitude of attractions in the Wharf area was a huge bonus for us.  The rooms are clean and comfortable. You can tell parts of the hotel are little older, but it is well-maintained. We'd come again.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms were nice and everything was clean. The staff was friendly and the proximity can't be beat.
review.negativeRemarks: Some of the facilities felt a little dated and tired.
review.locationRemarks: A quick walk to all the Wharf attractions.  We loved the number of breakfast restaurants nearby too.

review.title: Parking problem
review.reviewText: Power out and couldn't leave because gate would not open.  Got. Reimburse for my trouble.

review.title: Very nice hotel in an excellent location
review.reviewText: Pier 2620 was a very nice hotel in an excellent location for visiting San Francisco as a tourist.  It is only a few minutes away from Fisherman's Warf and only two blocks from the F Muni line, which makes it easy to take public transportation.  There are many excellent restaurants within walking distance and it is also easy to get to the pier for the Alcatraz tour as well as Ghiradelli Square.  The hotel itself was very clean with excellent amenities such as a bar, coffee in the room, and a large flat-screen TV.  We would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Thanksgiving in San Fran
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and comfortable. Full sized shampoo, conditioner and body soap in shower. Bathrooms in good shape. Bedding very nice, and carpet was very clean. Housekeeping was great.  Hotel close to lots of dining and things to do near Fishermans Wharf.

review.title: Great Location & Price
review.reviewText: The location is very close to Fisherman's Wharf and a cable car line. We went in Nov. so the lines for the cable cars were very short. It was a fun ride to Union Square and shopping. Plenty of restaurants nearby too.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, cost, helpfulness of staff

review.title: Close to many attractions
review.reviewText: Very welcoming staff, helpful in directing us to places to see. Room was large and very clean and comfortable. I especially liked the brand of shampoo, hand lotion, etc. the lounge was surprisingly nice. Would return here anytime!

review.title: Close to everything.
review.reviewText: Staff was very friendly and helpful. We walked to everything we wanted to do and see. Overall a great experience.
Close to everything at Fisherman's Wharf and only a couple of blocks from Lombard Street. The staff were very friendly. The room was very clean & comfortable.  We will definitely stay there again.

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: Staff was helpful, room was sufficient and location was perfect

review.title: Nice hotel just two blocks for Fishean's Warf.
review.reviewText: The staff were all really friendly and helpful. I just though the self parking was so high at $40 per night.

review.title: Short walking distance to the wharf
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly and very helpful. The room was clean and the King size bed was very comfortable.  We will most definitely stay there again

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: This hotel is located in a perfect location and only a couple of blocks to Fisherman's Wharf.  We were able to hop on buses and the cable car all within a city block.  We stayed for six nights.  The first night our room overlooked Bay Street and was quite noisy.  We switched to an interior room and it was super quiet.  My recommendation would be to try to book an interior room on the third floor.  Room was very clean and the beds and pillows comfortable.  Will definitely stay here again on our next trip to San Francisco.

review.title: excellent for tourist activity
review.reviewText:
Location is within easy walking distance of most of the things one would want to do do.  If too far to walk then the Muni is easily accessible.  We used it just as a place to sleep - room was clean, comfy king size bed and huge flat screen.  The fixtures and fittings were looking a little tired, but as we spent so little time in the room, it wasn't an issue. Breakfast was 20 dollars a head, so cheaper to go elsewhere.

There was also someone to help you plan your day's activities.  Although we didn't make use of this facility, with hindsight we should have done for some things!
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient and friendly
review.locationRemarks: Close to Fisherman's wharf and cable car

review.title: Need to rethink comfort standards
review.reviewText: no water in the room (which has a refrigerator and the concierge did not warn in advance) requires a run to shop for water because the water downstairs is quite costly.   turning on the light in the bathroom causes a droning, metalic sound--no relaxing bath possible--until i called for the engineer to unwire it.  then, it was quiet, except when the people upstairs turned theirs on.  this was a surprisingly odd touch to an otherwise well-located hotel with a pretty comfortable bed and windows which open for fresh air.  that was nice.  then came using "seamless" to order in dinner.  it should be called "shameless." we ordered a plain lassi and got mango--my husband does not eat sugar, so we threw it out.  the restaurant did not offer to replace it, which was to be expected.  all in all, the staff did their best to supply us with what should have been in the room, i.e. glasses, plates, tea and coffee cartridges.  it was ok in the end because the restaurants we visited were extraordinary--yet far and the cabs costly.  thank you for allowing an airing--hope there will be improvements for the next guests.
review.positiveRemarks: well-located hotel with a pretty comfortable bed and windows which open for fresh air.  that was nice.
review.negativeRemarks: water should be supplied, even if a charge is required at check out.
review.locationRemarks: the Wharf is nearby

review.reviewText: The hotel was close to the attractions and clean helpful staff
Room was dusty. Filters in a/c very dirty, but very comfortable. Street noise was unpleasant.

review.title: Excellent Wharf Choic
review.reviewText: We scored a great deal on Expedia on this hotel and we couldn't be more pleased. It's two blocks from the Wharf, and just walking minutes from Alcatraz ferries, Pier 39 and seafood restaurants. The rooms are new-like with modern decor and bedding. The rooms are also well apportioned, with lots of space to move around. We had a quiet stay on the first floor, even though our upstairs neighbor was a little noisy in the morning (not the hotel's fault). The hotel offers $20 breakfast buffet but we passed on it for restaurants just walking minutes away, including Starbucks, IHOP, bakeries and others.
Room did not have good air conditioning and does sit next to the road which is noisy. Not a good hotel overall

Superb location and comfort at a reasonable price. Definitely our future go-to location in N San Fran. Only minor criticism involves the hovering bell staff who would not leave our side and not let us pack/unpack our car in peace - very annoying - they would not leave our side even though we asked them directly and  gave a them a good tip.

review.title: Great hotel, great staff, great location
review.reviewText: This hotel was awesome. The concierge was very helpful when we needed to know things. Staff were always friendly and wanting to help and the location was superb!  Highly recommend!

review.title: Great Hotel in Fisherman Wharf
review.reviewText: Location and facilities were amazing, I will definitely return.
review.positiveRemarks: everything was great
review.negativeRemarks: They can improve in the bathroom cleanness.

review.title: Good location.
review.reviewText: A nice hotel if you are sight-seeing on foot.  Also close to cable car turnaround.

review.title: OUTSTANDING!
review.reviewText: Stayed at the Hilton for 3 days prior to checking in at Pier 2620 and this place blew the Hilton away! Great Staff, Clean immaculant room, Fantastic comfortable bed! Just an outstanding place to stay and I highly recommend. Probably one of the best hotels I have stayed at in a very long time!
review.positiveRemarks: EVERYTHING!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing!
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco, Alcatraz, Golden Gate Bridge, Sonoma Wine Country, Napa Valley Wine tasting, Muir Woods, Muir Beach and The Wharf!

review.title: Nice hotel close to fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice, only down fall is traffic noise and the fact you can hear people walking around in the rooms above. Great location close to water, Hyde street cable car and Lombard street. Great value for money as this was the cheapest hotel we could find
Nice location and very friendly staff. Happened to be their 1 year anniversary, got a lot of freebies

review.title: Very nicely located and great atmosphere
review.reviewText: Very good. Liked room and shutters. Roadside view was great.p
review.positiveRemarks: Location

review.title: Ecxellent Location - Very thin walls
review.reviewText:
For the price I expected a nicer hotel.

The walls were so thin I could hear the guy in the next room snoring.  The people on the floor above sounded like a herd of elephants and I am sure they were probably walking normally as this continued all week.  My biggest and only real complaint is the wood structure and seemingly poor soundproofing of the building.

Location was excellent and the staff were very helpfull and friendly.  Easy check in and check out - no other issues.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was excellent and the staff were very helpfull and friendly.  Easy check in and check out.
review.negativeRemarks: An update of the rooms should be happening if the price is to stay where it is.
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans Wharf and all Piers - very close by - easy walking distance.

review.title: Average stay
review.reviewText: This hotel was convenient to all the shops in fishermans wharfs. The hotel was just average and in need of a upgrade. The cons were getting in to it. The parking wasn't that good and getting out of the garage was difficult. They deactivated my key so I had to call someone to come and let me out of the garage. There are better hotels in the area for cheaper.
review.positiveRemarks: Its location
review.negativeRemarks: The price per night and the parking
review.locationRemarks: All the shops

review.title: Perfect Spot at Fisherman'sWharf
review.reviewText:
This is the perfect location for accessing Fisherman's Wharf and the cable cars. This one-year anniversary hotel is a gem - a flawlessly clean room with perfect bedding and beautiful appointments, our one-bedroom was the perfect spot. When we checked in (early), Bill greeted us at the front and provided unsurpassed service.

With so many food mecca's nearby, a full restaurant would've been a waste of space. We came to see the city, so Pier 2620 Hotel was the perfect safe, clean, comfortable and affordable refuge to enjoy our downtime. 

Traveling from Atlanta, we found it on line and took a chance. We're not disappointed and would happily return. Two thumbs up!

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText:
Great location, nice staff, huge room with even bigger TV!

Also had access to their Club 2620 room which had free snacks and drinks available from early afternoon til late evening which made it even better value.

One of the best hotels I have stayed in.
the staff was wonderful, clean rooms, and anything you needed they got for you. will go back.....
Great staff. Stayed during hotel anniversary.  Awesome customer service.
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything in Fishermans Wharf.  Perfect location.

review.title: Vacation
review.reviewText:
Very expensive breakfast. Drinks at bar very expensive.
Good location and staff extremely helpful.

review.title: Better the 2nd time around
review.reviewText: The room & location was better the 2nd time we stayed. Less noise & the halls on the 1st floor smelled better.
review.positiveRemarks: Closeness to the wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: I thought the breakfast was a little overpriced.
review.locationRemarks: Tours, transportation & restaurants were close by.

review.title: Very responsive...
review.reviewText: Overall, the stay was nice, comfortable, thank your staff for their attentiveness to all our request. 2620 excellent service, restaurant, bar created a friendly environment making sure we were happy  and satisfied, housekeeping and concierge was marvelous.

review.title: Noise & smell halls
review.reviewText: There was a lot of street noise & the halls had a musty odor. Didn't get much sleep from the noise. When the clerk at the front desk asked how was our stay & I told her about the noise & all she said was well have a nice day. I was a little worried because we were returning in 2 days.
review.positiveRemarks: Easy & early check in

Kind regards 
Gill and Dave Bradford

review.title: Close to everything, but like a hotel 6
review.reviewText: Close to a lot of things you would like to see when visiting, $40 to park per day average for a city. Staff poor at best do not offer to bring your bags to the room, I asked the front desk for change to pay for street parking they told me the store was a few blocks a way an they had change. Stay in two rooms both smell like mold, wall paper is falling of the walls. You can hear people walking on the floor above and the AC sounds like a city bus This is a one star show at best stay some were else!!

review.title: Not on the wharf

review.title: Close to wharf
review.reviewText: Liked it a lot, except for the fact that the wooden floors above us allowed us to hear every single step taken in the room above us.

the hotel was in a great location. Room was decent, clean. I ask for a king bed at first we came in the room and it was 2 queen bed so I ask to be changed then they gave me 1 queen bed not KING. Its like same kind of room removed the the other queen bed and place a chair on the side. But over all it was ok.

review.title: Club level 2620 is not worth it.
review.reviewText: Only open for breakfast and some nights.  CLosed at all other times.  In evening, they have only few slices of deli meat and bread and condiments.  Not even cheese.  All alcohol on Honor Bar system where you write down what you drink and they bill you.  Pretty pricey too.  I tried the red wine and wasn't even good.  Breakfast was actually pretty OK (though they ran out of croissants pretty early).  Hotel in good location and overall pretty clean and nice.  If you stay, don't recommend the Club Level (or at least be prepared that it won't be as nice as club level / concierge floor amenities as you would find in nicer chain hotels.

review.title: Nice place in sf
