The pier 2620 is a very good hotel well located near pier 39.
The room  cleaniness is excellent and the cosr rate is very good for bay area.I recommend the hotel for people desired to visit north san francisco (fisherman's wharf, golden gate, presidio...).

review.title: Good location close to some great restaurants
review.reviewText: Great location. Fishermans wharf is so close and close to trolly turnaround. Only bad thing was the a/c unit is so old and when turned on smelled like mold..and windows old too. Very noisy.
The hotel was a little outdated but overall clean. Pretty good location for sightseeing

review.title: Very Clean and friendly staff
review.reviewText: This was a great place to stay while in San Francisco.  Cant beat it for the price in Fisherman's Wharf.  Staff was very friendly and the rooms were very clean and comfortable.  Would highly recommend.
review.positiveRemarks: very clean and comfortable bed
review.locationRemarks: 1 block from the pier.  good options for dining in any direction.

review.title: Unacceptable
review.reviewText: The hotel staff on check in were terribly rude and not helpful . They changed our room once they realized I had a service animal to the worst room in the hotel and the cleanness in the room was appealing . The next day I called for my car about 15 mins before I came down and the car was there but the valet wasn't as he was getting other cars and I waited 20 mins for my car . When I asked the front desk where my key is she said with arrogance you'll have to wait for the valet. Hotel is a joke and motel 6 makes this place look like the ritz .

review.title: Great Hotel  Within walking  to lots!
review.reviewText: Would stay here again. Very clean, comfortable bed and close to all the San Francisco must sees , like Fishermans Wharf, Pier 39, Cable cars, view of Alcatraz and the Golden Gate Bridge.

review.title: A really good hotel to stay in.

The hotel was very close to Pier 39 which made it easy to access sightseeing companies.
We would recommend Pier 2620 Hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms were great- very comfortable beds, shower was excellent, room was quiet.
review.locationRemarks: 5 minutes walk to Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Nice hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel for two nights last week. This hotel is situated close to the Fisherman's Wharf. The room quality is OK and the hotel stuffs are quite kind and helpful. We expected higher quality of breakfast.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Very clean hotel  , helpful staff good wifi and free

review.title: Noisy
review.reviewText: It was great. Just very very noisy above our room at 5am!!

review.title: Perfect stay close to the Walrf.
review.reviewText: I loved and enjoyed my stay at Pier 2620. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The room was clean and the bed was so comfortable. I would stay there again.
The room was clean and comfortable.  Staff were courteous and helpful.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and in a good location near Fisherman's Wharf.  There is a Starbucks just down the street and a Walgreens.  I would suggest the Walgreens towards the Wharf as it is much larger and has a lot more than the one across the street.  There is also a Trader Joes and Safeway in walking distance.  The patio was nice to sit out on in the evening and relax after a long day.

review.title: Excellent hotel with great location!
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a great location. Staff was friendly and hotel clean. The room was nicer and larger than i expected. The rooms almost looked brand new and the continental breakfast was perfect to start off each day. If I was staying in fishermans warf again i would definitely stay here.
review.positiveRemarks: Large Rooms. Good price.

review.title: Nice hotel near all the fun places.
review.reviewText: We had a great time at Pier 2620.  Loved the location, look, cleanliness, staff, and were so impressed with the free breakfast and light meal in our club room.  This was a really great extra.  Our room was clean and well kept.  We really liked how close it was to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, and so many other attractions.  We have never stayed at a hotel that the staff were so friendly!  We have already made up our mind to stay at this hotel when we go back to San Francisco.  Thanks so much to the staff for a fun and comfortable stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness, location, and the club room.
review.negativeRemarks: Night light in bathroom to see during night.
review.locationRemarks: Just a few blocks from the wharf.  Too many attractions to mention.  Lots of places to eat.

review.title: Loved it!!!!
review.reviewText: Great location, can't beat the price for a luxurious hotel with friendly staff.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: After sifting through the many hotels in the Fisherman's Wharf area, it was easy to decide to stay here...  the write ups were all positive and the location proved to be excellent for whatever you are thinking of doing, on any particular day.  Driving in was also quite straightforward .  The club 2620 is a great bonus for travellers who qualify for it.
review.positiveRemarks: THe staff were amazing..  even hunting up, and delivering cookies to our room when I mentioned that it might be a good idea to have some available.
review.negativeRemarks: The location of the club 2620 is a little far to get to if you're not on that floor..  the facility itself though is very well appointed.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf is always popular and the location of the all the tour companies there for excursions is a bonus.  walking into the city is easy.

review.title: Nice location easy access to public transit
review.reviewText: No views. Noisy street  below our room. Lots of pillows and beds were great. Very good home base for exploring SF.  And free wifi is best source for what's going on in SF.  Buy muni passport if you will be using PT.  Cable cars are $6 one-way bus and trains $2.25. Seniors $.75.  Bart senior pass is $9 and is worth $25 travel. Bart goes to SFO and berkley among other out-of-town destinations.

review.title: Good Hotel, Excellent Location
review.reviewText: We had a great week long stay in San Francisco.  Contributing to this was our very good hotel with excellent service;  and extremely well located.  Upon arrival we were upgraded from a "Deluxe King" room to a very spacious suite. This was a very pleasant surprise (and we still got the king bed).  Upon exploring San Francisco, we became impressed with how well located our hotel was.  A 2 minute walk to the on-off double decker bus tour we booked. Two minutes to the hub of Fisherman's Wharf and The Cannery. A Safeway and a Trader Joe's within 3 blocks. Also within 3 blocks are the end of the line for two cable car routes. I would highly recommend staying right in Fisherman's Wharf if your budget permits (rooms are expensive).
review.positiveRemarks: The staff is excellent. The rooms are clean, comfortable and have modern TVs, a fridge and coffee maker.
review.negativeRemarks: The air conditioning was hard to control. It either didn't come on when it should, or worked far too much (cold).

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Loved it, close to restaurants and attractions.

review.title: Great location... nice room
review.reviewText:
Location is great - a few blocks from the wharf and cable cars.  I read reviews and knew to get a "Club Room".   That gives you access to a complimentary breakfast - eggs, pastries, fruit, juice, and coffee.   Also, from 5- 9 p.m. it gives you access to the complimentary snacks - things to make a sandwich and beverages.  

We arrived late - 11 p.m. and the desk person was not very friendly.   Also, she forgot to make our key a "club key" so we had to take care of that the next morning after we hiked all the way up to the club room - 3rd floor.    Also, there is only one set of elevators which seems unusual.

Our room faced the street towards the wharf - it was very loud because it is a bus route!!!  Would stay here again but ask for a different room location.
review.positiveRemarks: Room was nice and access to the Club Room.
review.negativeRemarks: More elevators and a pool would be nice.
review.locationRemarks: Wharf, cable cars, Ghiradhelli Square.

review.title: Walking distance to many attractions
review.reviewText: On our arrival to the hotel I was surprised when no one from the hotel came out to help with our luggage even though there were two employees at the entrance. When we walked in I was impressed by the entrance of the hotel, it appeared new and was very pleasing. I walked up to the desk to check in and much to my surprise we were able to check in early, however only one of my reservations was able to be found. I booked two rooms for two nights each through an online booking site, both rooms had already been paid for.  I was told that the reservation could not be found and would have to book another room. I was then told that there was no manager until after 4pm to help assist with this problem. The manager later resolved the problem and "found" the other reservation. We were told that if the manager were the customer he would expect a credit, but we were never offered a credit since we had already pre paid. I did love that the hotel had a small snack shop and a wine bar. When at breakfast the next morning I decided since I was on vacation I would order a mimosa off of the breakfast menu. When the waiter came to take our order I was told again there is no manager on the property that could open the bar. I was displeased that there were items on the menu that could not be ordered. Later that day we were going to dinner and called the front desk to ask if they could get us a cab for dinner. We were told "that is not something we do" we also were told that we could just walk.

review.title: Nice hotel near Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: this was a perfect location for touring without the need for a car... the Concierge was very helpful locating tours to meet our needs.  Rooms were clean and comfortable.. Great Stay!

review.reviewText: The staff was great! For a "recently" renovated room, it was a little drap and dated. Bathroom could have used detailed cleaning.

The room was very large and the amenities were great!  This hotel is within walking distance to the Mason-Powell cable car, Fisherman's Wharf, Lombard street, and Pier 39.  Easy access to all kinds of public transportation.  On the day of check out, the staff kept my luggage safe until I returned later on my way to the airport.  Would absolutely recommend this hotel.

We had a great experience at Pier 2620 Hotel.   The staff is very nice and accommodating.    We arrived early and they had a room for us so we were able to check in, get settled and start our vacation immediately.  Joanna at the concierge desk was fabulous and helped us so much.

review.title: Fantastic location By Fisherman Wharf
review.reviewText: Great location Central to all of fisherman wharf, 5 minute walk for the tram to Union Square or the F Car taking you to the end of market street. 10 minute stroll to pier 39 for Alcatraz and the whole of what fishermans wharf has to offer. We recommend an evening dining at the Forbes Island restaurant in the pier 39 marina. Will be back soon!

review.title: Very accommodating...

review.positiveRemarks: Location A1 - short (<5 mins) walk to Fishermans Wharf

review.title: Nice Walk to the Wharf
review.reviewText:
Hotel is in a good location within walking distance to the Wharf and markets
Close to catch your trolley/hop on/off/ cable car, street cars
Make sure you get off at the G G Bridge and take photos - it's amazing
Also if you're on the Hop On/Off - get off at the Museum and go to the 9th floor and have a look!!
Listen carefully to your narrator on the bus, as info is interesting
Take your Alcatraz tour either early or the last one - all others are very crowded - Ride is about 15 min.
Listen to who built the Park in San Fran - what an interesting man!
Some areas are better than others - watch where you get off/on
Take the Bart to the Livermore Outlet Mall - good deals -  takes about 1 1/2 hrs to get there - only 2 changes for your bus
Wharf restaurants are a little more expensive than out of the wharf area - although Luigis Pizza was very good as well as the Fudge store!
Cheesecake Factory at Macy's is delicious - get there early or wait in line forever
Do have a look at the DSW shoe warehouse - something for everyone!
Take a look through Nordstrom Rack - things are very reasonably priced!
Take good walking shoes if you plan to walk around the area and through to Union Square
Lots and Lots of all kinds of dogs in San Fran - very clean for walking!
Lots of construction around Union Square - be prepared to fight the crowds
review.positiveRemarks:
Hotel was spacious, concierge "Joanne"was informative. 
Close to amenities, Safeway, Walgreen's(several),Trader Joe's,Market World, Ross Clothing
review.negativeRemarks:
Add a Scale to weigh Luggage
Add some Lemon Water close to the concierge area while waiting or packaged cookies
Could have friendly receptionistsN
review.locationRemarks:
Close to  important amenities
Close to the Trolley, Hop On/Off, Cable Car
Close to restaurants
Close to your supermarkets
Nice walk to the Wharf

review.title: Love the location.

I was very pleasantly surprised as it was about 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and also within walking distance to the office where we were to get our tour bus (for both tours). I gave this vacation to myself and my sister as we were going thru some heavy parental issues and were kind of stressed out. It was so nice to be able to relax and really enjoy our stay. Beds were great. Buffet could be a little cheaper tho.

review.title: Super hotel deserves higher star rating
review.reviewText: Spacious clean and tidy rooms. Extra comfortable beds. Excellent location a very short walk to the fisherman's wharf. Also, Jessica at the reception made sure to move us to upgraded rooms on 3rd floor to fulfill our request on Expedia for king beds. A wonderful experience we had in this beautiful hotel That made our San Fransisco visit a real enjoyable one. Recommended recommended recommendedd recommended.

review.title: Nice hotel, very comfortable

review.title: Close to all places I wanted to go to.
review.reviewText:
I felt that the price to value ratio was not good, In particular the WiFi was not reliable although there were two computers down stairs one of which was always available.
Great location
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: WiFi and not much else Just a rather expensive visit.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf was close by as the Golden Gate bridge and tourist buses , Ideal for a short visit.

review.title: Very nice hotel !
review.reviewText:
2 blocks from Fishermans Wharf, 1 block from vintage trolley line, 1 block from Powell Mason cable car line, Wallgreens 1 block away with everything you need including beer or wine. Parking below hotel is $45 a night, but that is the going rate in SF and so convenient...you do not need a car it this town unless you you are heading to pints elsewhere after SF. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Hints:Skip the overpriced hotel breakfast and goe to Hollywood Cafe and  or Darren's Restaurant, both  only 2 blocks away.
Take the less expensive boat cruises at the pier vs the more expensive name brand cruises. Same exact sunset cruise for less money and you can BYO beer and food. The. name brand lines ran next to us and took same exact route and they charge for beer and snacks! 
Buy a one, three or 7 day MUNI pass depending on your stay. Good for ALL MUNI. Transportation including Cable cars, trolleys, light rail , buses and more. Three day is $23, a one way cable car is $6 and you will want to connect to other cable lines and need to return ...we were there two days, rode all three CC lines as well as vintage trolleys along Embarcodaro to Ferry Building( also worth doing) and to AT&T stadium. Download the free MUNI app map...awesome  even as a street map.
Vist the cable car museum, awesome and interesting for all...my wife loved it. See the wheels driving the cables as well as history of the CCs. Also visit the trolley museum near the Ferry building. Both museums are Free!

review.title: Comfortable stay and close to Fisherman Wharf
Former Hilton Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: This is a new incarnation of the Hilton at Fisherman's Wharf.  It's the same great location but they are missing a few key elements. They seem to have put a lot of money into remodeling the lobby and the first floor. What they don't have, is any room service or any meal other than breakfast being served in the hotel. They offer a series of local vendors who will deliver to the hotel lobby but no actual room service. This seems really at odds with the hotel seeking to define itself as "boutique". They have a wine bar that is only open in the evenings.  And, without having room service, a bar, or an all day dining option, I fail to see how they can hope to rank themselves as four-star and charge $429 a night.  It's a nice enough place, but not a good value

review.title: Excellent staff
review.reviewText: The staff at Pier 2620 were always welcoming and willing to assist us during our stay to ensure we had the experience possible.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff and the club option for a step above service.

review.title: Nice hotel that's close to Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: san Francisco Trip
review.reviewText:
Hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf 
easy walking not on hill
Staff friendly, Tips on good dining.

review.reviewText: Hotel is two block from Fisherman's Wharf and it is very convenient to restaurants and transportation.  It is also within walking distance to excellent Italian restaurants, Lombard Street, Coit Tower, Ferry Building and China town.  We took a bus to get us to Union Square and Market Street.  We took another bus to go to Golden Gate bridge for a walk on the bridge.  The hotel concierge service was extremely helpful in making suggestions for our trips to the Muir Woods and the wine country.  The only downside is that since it is in a prime tourist location, many eateries are quite expensive.  We learned after a few days to find food that is more affordable.

review.title: Good location to the Wharf
review.reviewText: I wasn't sure what to think since I had never heard of this hotel before (because it used to be the Hilton).  It was clean and the staff were so helpful.  It is a little older, but so are most on the Wharf.  Our room was quite a walk from the lobby, but it was quiet and the bedding was wonderful.  I would stay here again.  We were able to walk to all the places we wanted to see on the Wharf.
review.positiveRemarks: Bedding and Staff

review.title: Great location to fisherman's warf and the trolly
review.reviewText: Rooms can always be cleaner but overall clean.  Comfortable room
review.positiveRemarks: Location for our family to walk around the fisherman's warf and the trolly line.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleaner room

review.title: Comfy bed with clean bathroom
review.reviewText: The hotel had friendly, attentive staff. The hotel itself is clean and fashionable upon entering, but has musty old smelly hallways. The propane burners in the courtyard had no propane for our entire stay. The carpet is in desperate need of replacing, along with the furniture. It all feels very shabby. The beds are fantastic and clean. The walls seem old and stained. It was a very eclectic mix.

review.title: First Class Hotel Close to Everything
review.reviewText: The hotel is located 1 block from Fisherman's Wharf in an excellent location.  The staff at the hotel are friendly, knowledgeable and eager to please.   The room was large, nicely furnished and comfortable.  The concierge was very nice and helped us plan our day trips.  Her recommendations were excellent.  One of the amenities that is offered is coffee and tea in the mornings.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf is located approximately 1 block from the hotel.  There are many restaurants located within walking distance.

review.title: Good hotel close to Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText:
The hotel was clean and the rooms spacious enough for two double beds with a separate ensuite bathroom with a shower over the bath. Only criticism was that we had an outside room and the street was quite noisy in the early hours of the morning (either deliveries or bin men). Hotel staff (with one exception) were helpful and friendly.
We did not try the hotel breakfast but opted for Denny's in the next door Holiday Inn instead as well as other eateries around Fishermans Wharf (only 10 mins walk from hotel to pier 39)
review.positiveRemarks: Close to Fishermans Wharf and good size clean bedroom.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking in carpark attached to hotel rather expensive ($40 a night self park - $50 valet park). However parking was expensive all round hotel
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans Wharf, Pier 39, boat trip to Alcatraz is a must. Go on a cable car but not if you are in a hurry. Golden Gate bridge not far by car or bike

review.title: Close to Wharf
review.reviewText: The visit was good. The breakfast was excellent. The location was easy to find.
review.positiveRemarks: Amenities

review.title: Great location! We were able to walk to many sites
review.reviewText:
From the time we arrived the staff was friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our room size and look forward to
a  return visit.
review.positiveRemarks:
We thought the breakfast served for frequent guests was perfect so, we were able to save time and get out
for our days adventure..

review.title: Good Location and Great Staff
review.reviewText: Pier 2620 was a great experience.  We were 3rd floor guests, and the "Club 2620" was a great way to start our day - and it saved us quite a bit of money as food prices are fairly steep along the Wharf.  A great hotel, great staff, and great place to start our daily Bay area adventures (easily walkable to the Wharf, Golden Gate Bridge, and any other "tourist" places to visit in the Bay area (and we are walkers who did a GREAT deal of walking).

review.title: Perfect location for all sight-seeing.

review.title: Centrally located hotel in Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText: Hotel is within easy walking distance of Pier 39, the Cable Cars, Lombard Street and all the cycle hire shops, restaurants and bars.  Its about 45 minutes - 1 hour from the airport and costs around $60 by cab.  We had a room facing the road and it was quiet at night.  Very clean, plenty of storage space and nice bathroom with a lovely hot shower. Didn't use the bar or restaurant so unable to comment apart from saying that they both seemed to be well populated.

I had stayed at a couple of different hotels in previous visits - but found this one through Expedia and was very happy with my experience.  The location, friendliness of staff, modern amenities and so much more were wonderful. I would truly recommend this hotel for anyone!

review.title: Nice hotel, close to attractions
review.reviewText: We have much appreciated our stay , very nice hotel, friendly staff and very helpful. The rooms are large and clean, the service is good. The location of the hotel is excellent, very close to Fisherman Warf , Union street, Lombard street . I would recommend this hotel to my friends
Clean and comfortable  room. Very friendly staff. Great location not far from fisherman's wharf. Can take cable car to union square.

review.title: Great Location! Very Clean & Friendly Hotel
review.reviewText: We enjoyed staying at Pier 2620.  It was very clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful.  The location couldn't be more perfect!  You can run over to Fisherman's Wharf in two short blocks, the cable car turnaround is one block East, Lombard Street is a few blocks South West, you can rent bikes 1 block East and the bus stops are within a few blocks in every direction.  We didn't think the area was noisy at all.  The 3rd floor club rooms have their own continental breakfast every morning and that was priceless!!  It was very convenient and the food was good.  If your looking for a very posh, elegant and luxurious hotel, this isn't the one for you, but it is modern and clean.  We would definitely stay here again!
review.positiveRemarks: Cleaniness, friendly staff and continental breakfast included with club rooms
review.negativeRemarks: The halls and rooms could be updated a little with some more color.
review.locationRemarks: Location is at Fisherman's Wharf.  Cable car turnaround is 1 block away, Lombard street is 2 or 3 blocks South West, Ghiradellli square, Pier 39.

review.title: Great location and friendly staff
review.reviewText:
Staying at Pier 2620 hotel was a good experience.

All the staff were very friendly and helpful. Most importantly my room was clean and comfortable.

The only downfall for staying at this hotel is the parking cost of 40 dollars a day.

review.title: Central to main tourist areas.
review.reviewText:

Would definitely stay here again.....nearby Denny's for breakfast too. Recommend using bus tour companies for City tour and Muir woods...excellent value.  If you want to ride the cable car...join it a few stops into the journey....saves waiting for almost an hour either end!
Must see The Palace of Fine Arts and also walk along Chrissy Beach and up to the Golden Gate Bridge. 
Evening walk along the water front from The Ferry Building to Pier 39 Fishermans Warf is also good.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable  convenient and value for money.
review.negativeRemarks: Being British....I took my own kettle but it would be good to have one in the room...also instructions on how to use the TV!!!

review.title: Great hotel convenient for attractions
review.reviewText: Very pleasant, well situated hotel. Staff were polite and concierge was extremely helpful. Very impressed with the security. The free Wifi was good but patchy at times. $45 dollars a night for parking is a bit expensive but I believe that is what is charged in San Francisco generally.
review.positiveRemarks: Central location and  calm surroundings.
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi

review.title: An excellent hotel in a convenient location.
review.reviewText: My husband, 14-year-old daughter, and I spent four days and three nights at this hotel.  The location is excellent, as it is three blocks from the pier.  The staff was knowledgeable and friendly.  We especially liked two of the concierges, Joanna and Debbie, who were extremely helpful.  They managed to get Alcatraz tickets for us -- not cheap, but not outrageous -- even though everyone was sold out for weeks.  Also, the restaurants that Debbie recommended were absolutely wonderful.  We would definitely recommend Pier 2620, and we plan on staying there again.  Oh, our daughter said to add that the beds were really comfortable -- and she would know!
review.positiveRemarks: We liked the location, we liked the staff, we particularly liked the concierges, and the facilities themselves were very good.
review.locationRemarks: 3 walking blocks from the pier, 30 minutes from the airport, easy taxi and/or bus access.

review.title: hotel close to movement
review.reviewText:
There is no doorman, you go in and out like no one sees you, asks how are you, may I help you with something, or good night. Yes, you can't go up the elevator if you don't have your room keys, good safety future, but they have stairs available. The front desk people don't even look at you when you walk around. When was checking in, I asked with a big smile if we could get a nice view room. No answer from the person who was checking us is. She didn't even look up to say yes/no. I understand I didn't pay for bridge/ocean view, but she could be little nice and say, I am sorry we are all full and nothing is available besides a room looking another building higher than ours. As soon as we got in the room, she had the audacity to call and ask if I liked the room. At that point I just told her it was OK. 
 I was on vacation with my two teenagers, was not going to argue with her why my window shows another building.
review.positiveRemarks: near the tour bus pick-up, Fisherman's.
review.negativeRemarks: I let the management of the hotel to decide what they can improve

review.title: Great Location and Decent Value (for San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great location, only a few blocks to the waterfront at Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square, the curvy part of Lombard Street and 2 cable car lines.  There are numerous restaurants, as well as a few drugstores and a grocery store nearby. As you probably know, almost everything in S.F. is more expensive than you would expect but Anderson Bakery and Darren's Café were reasonable for breakfast.  Taguito and Goodfella's Pizza were good for dinner and all are within a couple blocks of the hotel. If you're interested in going somewhere outside the public transportation coverage area there's also a couple rental car agencies nearby.  We were able to walk or take public transportation everywhere we wanted to go, except our day trip to San Jose.The hotel itself was clean and nice.  The staff were very nice and helpful, especially the concierge.  While certainly not inexpensive, this hotel seemed like a good value for the Fisherman's Wharf area.  We looked at some other, less expensive, hotels closer to Union Square, but the Fisherman's Wharf area seemed like a much nicer part of town and had more of the "touristy" things that we wanted to do.
review.positiveRemarks: Location! Close to lots of attractions but not on a really busy street.
review.negativeRemarks: It's a minor issue but the bathroom vent is ineffective so with 4 people taking showers in the morning, it never really dried out.

review.title: Affordable Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: This hotel experience was a great deal for the price. It was not expensive for being at a great location and everything was top quality. The hotel is a stylish boutique hotel and very very clean. The bed was very comfortable and the room was very clean. They lent us a wheelchair each day for our handicapped friend and were very friendly and helpful. Their parking has in and out privileges. I would highly recommend this hotel to friends.

review.title: Hotel just a short distance from Pier 39
review.reviewText: The gentleman that checked us in was quite friendly and helpful. However, the concierge was not helpful and rather snotty, imho. The room we got must not have been renovated yet though I have seen on other reviews that this is being done throughout the hotel. The room was not as roomy or quite as close to the wharf as I thought it would be. But, all in all, it was adequate and right across from one of the cable car turn arounds if you are planning to use public transportation. Also, the entire time of our stay (5 days) the printer for the public computer was out of ink so you had to go to the front desk and sign on there if you needed to print a document. The front desk staff was always accommodating.
review.positiveRemarks: Location to most transportation and just a few short blocks from Pier 39.
review.negativeRemarks: The concierge could be more helpful, at least the one we approached more than once. She seemed more interested in phone calls than guests.

review.reviewText: Great location near Fisherman's Wharf, cable cars, Ghirardelli Square and various ferries. Plenty of restaurants nearby, and a Denny's in the hotel next door for an inexpensive breakfast. Hotel is clean and well decorated. In case they forget to tell you at check in, you need your keycard to operate the lift, which is a handy security feature.

review.title: Close to Pier 39
review.reviewText: Horrible management.  We had several problems and staff was not accommodating.  We rented 5 rooms July 9th - 14th 2014 for our wedding. One member of our party had cash stolen from room safe.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms were clean
review.negativeRemarks: We were promised things that were never done.  They didn't seem to care.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Piers where there are lots of things to do.

review.title: Hotel was within walking distance to Pier 39.
review.reviewText:
Hotel disappointed us in many ways.  We stayed there July 9th-14th 2014 for our wedding, renting a total of 5 rooms for family and friends.  We requested that one room be on a separate floor due to conflict with one family member.  We were assured, on the three different occasions that we reminded them, that it would be taken care of.  It was not.  They said they upgraded our room, which meant we were put in a handicapped room.  We are not handicapped. The tiny closet only had a low bar so I could not hang my long wedding dress.
The hotel breakfast buffet was twice as expensive as the Denny's next door, and had very few things.
Nobody could print their boarding passes on the computer in lobby because there was no ink. Also, they had the wrong date on computer causing many to have problems when they needed to change their flights due to bad weather.
One of our party had cash stolen out of room safe.  They have keys not combination locks. Hotel response was only, "We'll look into it."
We travel to San Francisco twice a year to see family, and we will NEVER stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms were kept clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Management.
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39 is great.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: The hotel is located 1 block to Fisherman Wharfs, 1 block to cable car station,. It takes u 10 to 15 min to get to Union Square with the cable car. Very clean and comfortable, the pp at the front desk and at the concierge are very polite and helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel.

review.reviewText: Nice hotel.  Good rooms.  Easy access to fishermans wharf and restaurants up Columbus st to green st

review.title: Perfect Hotel!
review.reviewText: Large, clean rooms. Hotel lobby smelled amazing!! Staff was friendly & helpful. Concierge service went above & beyond. Hotel bar was great!!!! Best of all....the hotel's location was right at the center of all Fisherman's Wharf activities. Can't wait to return to SF and stay at this hotel again.

review.title: Great Hotel for a Visit
review.reviewText: WE loved the hotel and it's location. Very nice staff and excellent room. The location of this hotel is perfect to visit the Pier 39 all the ferries, and the cable car.

review.title: Good location.  Close to pier 39.
review.reviewText: I would recommend this place to anyone.  Nice place.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms are Good size.
review.negativeRemarks: More detail to the showers.
review.locationRemarks: Very good.  All is walking distance.

review.title: Family trip to SF!
review.reviewText: Pier 2620 was the perfect spot for our quick family trip to San Francisco.  The room was very comfortable and clean, and a good size for our family of 4.  The hotel couldn't be in a better location, short walk to Fisherman's Wharf, and other waterfront sites, lots of restaurants, shops etc.  We would definitely stay again!
review.positiveRemarks: Location and comfort.
review.negativeRemarks: The name is a little hard to remember.
review.locationRemarks: The waterfront is a block away, we took the short walk to Guiradelli Square, lots of good restaurants within 2-3 blocks - perfect location.

review.reviewText: Very nice hotel in a good location.  Within walking distance of Pier 39 shopping and restaurant area.

review.title: nice hotel close to fishermans wharf
review.reviewText: Hotel was great,if your going to the fishermans wharf,bring a jacket
review.positiveRemarks: cleaness

review.title: Great hotel in prime location
review.reviewText: The hotel is adjacent to the wharf and was a great find. Walking distance to all major attractions. The hop on hop off tour is 2 blocks away, good restaurants all within walking distance. The city is easy to navigate plenty to do to and see. Take the time to go to Muir Woods worth the trip. Did the Alacatraz boat tour did not go on the island book this 4 weeks prior to your trip.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms were very clean and the beds were very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Lower fee for parking at $40 per night.

review.title: Great hotel for price
review.reviewText: Marketed as a boutique hotel, it may disappoint some with traditional room decor, but it more than makes up for that with superb beds, very clean rooms, free wi-fi, excellent staff and more. In short, check the images on the website, if it appeals then a booking won't disappoint. A late check out was no trouble and transport to the airport was arranged by staff with no fuss and a full explanation of charges. Both serve as examples of staff behaviour. We'd like to return.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness, staff attitude, room size, free wi-fi, location
review.negativeRemarks: On a practical level, taking price into account, not a lot. Free bottled water and other boutique freebies would help, but this hotel is not expensive
review.locationRemarks: Great location for Fisherman's Wharf, if that's important, but also for public transport and easy access to other parts of the city

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is better than average well located good gym but no pool close to all the piers and wharfs and also close to Columbus st which is a good restaurant st
review.positiveRemarks: The location
review.negativeRemarks: This hotel does not appear to belong to a chain also breakfast could be improved as it is some what confusing as the staff don't know the pricing .
review.locationRemarks: Very good

review.title: Nice hotel - reasonable price
review.reviewText: Very clean rooms!! Friendly staff and only 3 block walk and your standing on fishermans wharf!

review.title: San Francisco hotels
review.reviewText: Very good hotel. Well located with friendly staff.

review.title: Nice Hotel in the midst of tourist area
review.reviewText: The location is good if you plan to do the San Fran touristy things, Fisherman's Wharf, Alcatraz, etc.  The hotel staff was very helpful and the room was clean.  The hotel is showing its age just a bit but it probably sees lots of traffic.
review.positiveRemarks: location, staff.

review.title: Nice hotel good location
review.reviewText: Friendly staff nice location literally 5 minute walk to fishermans wharf

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We walked pretty much everywhere while in San Francisco and Pier 2620 was a great location. We spent some time with the Concierge one morning and got lots of great tips. We never had time to visit the wine bar but it looked pretty awesome. The rooms were clean and the bed was pretty comfy. We stayed on the 3rd floor (rm 382) and it was fairly quiet at night. We didn't hear traffic or street noise; just the clicking of the air conditioner....which was my only complaint. It didn't seem to regulate properly and would automatically go up to 76 degrees at night even though we had it set on 72.
review.positiveRemarks: pillows and location
review.negativeRemarks: the a/c
review.locationRemarks: Darren's Café for breakfast was awesome! Great service and great food. Also, Pat's Café was perfect for breakfast (Mimosas & Bloody Marys on weekends)

review.title: An excellent hotel near a Fishermans Wharf and oth
review.reviewText: Visited Fishermans Wharf on nights, took the cable car and a trolley bus to downtown. Used the hop on holiday off buss as well
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly and not in your face. They left you a lone to do your own thing
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms could be darker at night with the use of some curtains especially rooms opposite the 24/7 gym room

review.title: Fishermans wharf
review.reviewText: This hotel looked better online than in person. Reception and lounge have been redone but still rather clinical. They use an airfreshner that unfortunately smells like toilet cleaner. The bed was good but the room needs redecorating. Quiet overlooking courtyard but it is brightly lit and shutters do not block out the light. Area felt a little sketchy at night. Close to Fishermans wharf and cable car. Staff were pleasant enough. Certainly better than experienced in most of trip in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Ok
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms feel dated and tired
review.locationRemarks: Close to the waterfront. Amenities near by. Cable car , Starbucks, Safeway. Can still use Safeway card there, unlike canada.

review.title: Nice Hotel for the Price
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was helpful.  Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and convenient to other downtown areas.  Nice clean rooms and nice lobby.  Bed was very comfortable.  Would definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and price. Clean and comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39.

review.title: Acceptable hotel - unacceptable staff
review.reviewText:
Unbelievably incompetent concierge service. The first, a young woman, provided directions to Chinatown (a brief walk) that routed us through strip joints and sex shops. Great except that my wife and daughter were there. One of the "callers" out in front of one place even told us that it was fun for the whole family. Unbelievable. Not only was the concierge completely unfamiliar with restaurants in the city, she knew nothing of the streets or how to get to them.

The second concierge, an older woman, was not much better.  When leaving I asked for directions to Lombard Street on our way to the airport. She indicated that Lombard was closed to traffic (which it wasn't) and seemed to figure out the map while I stood there. She knew that one of the highways was closed but wasn't sure which one and routed me around the city and told me to look for signs to the airport. As it turns out the highway was closed in the Northbound Lanes and not the Southbound (the way to the airport). I expect much better concierge service from a  hotel in this price range. 

The front desk staff was equally useless as the concierge and only seemed to be good at making keys.

The only redeeming element of the hotel staff was the maid service. Our rooms were cleaned promptly and professionally.
review.positiveRemarks: The location. It is 2 blocks from Fisherman's Warf.  There are quite a few other nice hotels in the same area that are not listed on Expedia (tip)
review.negativeRemarks: The entire staff with the exception of the maid service
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Warf, easy walking distance to Little Italy and a little farther to Chinatown. One block from the cable car turnaround.

review.title: Great hotel close to fishermans pier
review.reviewText: Excellent except for street noise. That happens when you want close Convenience. Will stay there again.

Great location close to everything, friendly staff,  will absolutely book again.
Concierge was awesome! !!

review.title: Convenient location near Wharf
review.reviewText: My son and I really enjoyed out stay over the 4th of July weekend.  Many things were w/in walking distance or some kind of public transportation.  Hotel was clean and staff was friendly.

review.title: Walking distance to Wharf and North Beach
review.reviewText: Conveniently located.  Very friendly and helpful staff.  Nice warm daily breakfast (for a small upcharge - worth it).  On site parking is convenient (a little pricy at $46 / day with tax).  Rooms are nice, clean.  There is public transportation to get you anywhere in SF.  We took bus to AT&T ball park.  Took almost an hour in traffic.  We walked back and it was a nice 1 hour or so walk around the Embarcadro.  We stayed for a full week and there is tons to do.  Took some day trips to Monterey, Oakland and Yosemite
review.positiveRemarks: Great Location.  Well maintained hotel.  Warm breakfast.  Friendly and helpful concierge and others.
review.negativeRemarks: WiFi connectivity is a crap shoot.  But its free
review.locationRemarks: Short walk to all the wharf activity:  Bike rental, cable cars, segway, boat tours, Ghirdelli Square. North Beach / Little Italy / Chinatown walkable

review.title: Street noise but close proximity to activities
review.reviewText: First stay in San Fran.  Nice hotel - close to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, Lombard St. & Ghiradelli Square.  Pretty noisy -- street noise, delivery trucks, etc.  Hotel staff (front lobby) was "ok" -- could have been friendlier.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel staff could have been more "helpful"
review.locationRemarks: Location was great.  Just a couple blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, Lombard Street & Ghiradelli Square.

review.title: Fantastic location!
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel to serve as a base camp if you plan to go out and see San Francisco on a budget. It is close to the Wharf, as well as transit, Walgreens, Trader Joe's and other grocery stores. In addition the rooms have nice coffee/tea makers and small refrigerators.

review.title: Location.
review.reviewText:
Very good location, central to all tourist spots, transit and shopping and restaurants.
Very spacious and clean comfortable rooms. Beautiful TV.
Courteous staff.
All in all an average experience.

review.title: Awesome location, great price!
review.reviewText: Hotel was well-appointed, friendly staff, and very close to Fishermans Wharf/Pier 39 and Mason/Powell trolley line.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice beds, appreciated the charging stations on the desk for my iPhone and iPad, plus free wifi!
review.negativeRemarks: Cheaper parking :(

review.title: Not too Bad
review.reviewText: Not too bad for a night considering the cost. Weird that it's two story but has no elevator. Toilet was partially clogged and the bus guy first said we'd hv to wait till the next day because they had no maintenance guy on duty. After "explaining" to him that wasn't going to cut it he brought me a plunger, which he had no idea how to use. I used it and it unclogged. Temp is on a timer and the air cut back off after midnight. Had to get up and reset it to get room to cool back down. Other than all this it was fine!

review.title: Great location hotel with excellent staff
review.reviewText: Should consider to add in a jacuzzi near the fitness center.

review.title: Good value and comfortable beds
review.reviewText: Good location, walking distance to Piers including Alcatraz tour. Knowledgeable and friendly concierge

review.title: Close the wharf, but away from the noise.
review.reviewText: The king sized bed is comfortable in a spacious room.  There's a terrace to get away from it all in the late afternoons.  It's too bad there wasn't a hot tub or pool on the premises.  There is an exercise room, but it's all windows and very hot.  Apparently there was breakfasts, but we weren't offered it and no one gave us a clue how we could eat there.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was the best

review.title: We had a great stay
review.reviewText: Location was perfect. Close to fisherman wharf. Hotel is slightly old but its very comfortable
Good location, nice clean rooms, friendly staff. overall very nice stay in fisherman's wharf
review.locationRemarks: tons of things to see and do in fisherman's wharf. Far from bart though and long walks to other locations but there are plenty of cabs

review.reviewText: Concierge was wonderful.  They gave great recommendations for restaurants and local sightseeing!  Rooms were clean and comfortable.
Brilliant location and very friendly hotel. The only downside is that our room was a little noisy from the road outside but otherwise a great hotel

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText:
This is an excellent hotel - easy going with very efficient and pleasant staff. The room was larger and more comfortable than expected. The beds were superb. The location is close but not too close to Fisherman's Wharf - excellent for the cable cars, cycling trips and boat trips.

The only slight downsides are the cost of the breakfast and the slowness of the hotel internet in reception.

Overall though a really excellent hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: See above.
review.negativeRemarks: The speed of the computer internet in reception should be increased. Breakfast is too expensive.
review.locationRemarks: see above

review.title: Nice hotel close to all restaurants and piers
review.reviewText: With had a lovely stay but was disappointed that the weather wasn't very good and was not able to see the Golden Gate Bridge because of the fog!!

review.title: Very nice hotel.
review.reviewText: Pier 2620 was very nice. The staff where very welcoming an answered all my questions.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the wharf.
review.reviewText:
Staff helpful and courteous. Had to call two days in a row for towels. Stocked with three bath towels and had four people in room -otherwise room clean and beds comfortable.
Walgreens across the street which was convenient.

review.title: Very nice hotel at Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: We stayed one night 16th June 2014 and received fantastic service when we checked in. The room was very spacious, very clean and will certainly stay there again when we return. The standard of the hotel was excellent. Looked very new.

review.title: In the heart of it all
review.reviewText:
The staff are extremely friendly and go out of their way to make you feel welcome.
On one occasion I was trying to dial internationally and pressed 911 by mistake, the room service were at my door immediately checking if I was ok with 911 on hold!! Incredible.
Also when you first get to your room they leave a message with your name on it on the message bank asking if the room is to your standard and anything else they can do for you.
Very committed to making your stay a relaxing and enjoyable one

review.title: A motel
review.reviewText:
This is basic ally a motel . The picture in Expedia is misleading.
The location is good 3 blocks from the Fishermans Warf.
The parking is $ 43 per day
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: The advertisement should match reality.

review.title: Luxe hotel in good location
review.reviewText:
Stayed with 6 adults & 5 kids ages 6-9. Walked to Andersen Bakery in morning for breakfast, walked to Embarcadero & Pier area, walked to cable car stop to ride to Chinatown. Coming back from a museum we took the muni and stopped at Ghiradelli Square, where we could walk back to hotel.

Very clean, good service. Bill at the Front Desk especially helpful in recommending a restaurant for dinner (Pompei's Grotto). Lots of on street parking if you need a car, no need to pay the $50 hotel parking fee. Beds comfortable, nice fitness room, top of the line shampoo/body wash/lotion in the bathroom. Refrig in room to keep leftovers or milk/oj for kids but no microwave. Coffemaker w/ Peet's Coffee in room for grownups.

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText:
We visit "the city" several times a year for some of our sons "away" soccer games as well as just visiting to take in the everything we can SF. Although we live about 45 minutes from the area, we sometimes decide to stay overnight because our kids seem to really enjoy the experience of staying in a hotel. This place has worked out great. Pier 2620 isn't exactly across the street from the Wharf...but if you don't mind a few extra minutes of walking (which is likely going to be the case with your SF visit), it's a great location.

With the few interactions we tend to have with the staff, we have never had a problem and checking or out is a breeze.

We have no complaints about the facilities with one exception...the beds are super comfortable and in an effort to keep from sleeping in to enjoy the city, we have to almost force ourselves to get up. Other than that, everything was clean, updated, with many wonderful receptacles to help keep your electronics charged. Super convenient.

We will definitely come back.

We found this useful - take the whole tour first, then assess what you'd like to re-visit. We also took a Segway tour of the Bay Area & city sights: this was awesome! Fun, memorable & the company also had Alcatraz tickets that we're seemingly unavailable at Pier 35. Alcatraz is a must & Coit Tower really offers a beautiful view of this amazing city.

review.title: The Perfect Location to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
After doing a little homework, we knew we wanted to stay near Fisherman's Wharf - the location of Pier 2620 Hotel did not disappoint. We were right near Pier 39, Ghirardelli Square, Boudin Bakery, tons of great restaurants and shops. We were able to walk to catch the HoHo tour buses, the Ferry that took us to Saulsalito, The street car, the segways, the bike rental shops - it couldn't have been more perfect.
JoAnna at the concierge desk was so helpful in pointing us to all the sights and stops we wanted to see during our stay. The only downfall would be that the wi-fi connection was so slow and came & went so it was hard to log-on and get information fast. And for some reason, the room keys didn't work very well. One night our entire floor were having problems trying to get into their rooms, all in all, we ended up having to get new room keys 4 times.
With that being said, these small little issues would not make me not want to go back and stay there again, nor would it keep me from recommending it to a friend.

Someone set off fire alarm at 8 am with a toaster and hotel had to be evacuated. Better safe than sorry but still a bummer.

review.title: Nice Hotel with convenience!

Nice neighborhood feel to area with local bars and stores for convenience. Rooms were clean and spacious and beds were so comfy! The patio area on the first floor was wonderful to relax and enjoy the afternoon sunshine. Good wine selection too.

Transportation to airport with car service or shuttle would have been nice, but there was a shuttle service that the hotel recommended. I would shop around for that and be sure to leave plenty of time to get to airport if flying.

I would recommend this location to friends and will probably re-book next time we visit. Rate per night was very reasonable!

review.reviewText: We arrived 15 minutes before the check in time and were assigned a room on the 1st floor. When we opened the door to the room we saw scaffolding outside the window and two construction workers using an air gun on the wall outside. It was as if there was 4 of us in the room. We couldn't open the window because of the scaffolding. When we complained to the front desk we were told it was our fault because we checked in early. It was not a cheap room. We persisted and were given a room on the 3rd floor away from the construction.

review.title: ABSOLUTELY MARVELOUS - WONDERFUL STAFF - CLEAN
review.reviewText: This is about the best hotel in the San Francisco / Fisherman's Wharf area. About ten minute walk to the Pier and Market Square - You are able to get the full flavor of the Wharf atmosphere from this location. The concierge went above and beyond arranging shuttles and was more than familiar with sites and attractions their guests might want to visit. Restaurants of every flavor and price range were located in close proximity to this hotel, and many even delivered after a late-night bus tour. The linens and towels were clean and replenished daily and the halls were quiet. Although the hotel is going through a major renovation, we were unaware of any construction during our stay other than the fact that the exercise room was closed for same. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone coming into the San Francisco area. I know this is where I will return if and when I ever get the opportunity to return to San Francisco. Kudos to the staff at Pier 2620 Hotel -- Great Job and thank you for making my stay a wonderful experience!!! (p.s. I am a paraplegic in a wheel chair and had absolutely no difficulties whatsoever navigating this hotel, the room or the walk to the Pier).

review.reviewText:

We found the hotels location to be excellent. 1 block from a Cable Car terminus, 2 blocks from the F Line and 4 blocks from Pier 39.

We were staying in Room 181 which was along Bay Street and as a result was very noisey. Not only from the traffic, cars & trucks but vehicles using the service entrance.e were woken up by the dust cart several times at around 4am. Also the windows did not seem fully sound proofed. We could not close the window fully, preventing the noise being blocked out.

review.title: Walking distance to many tourist attractions
review.reviewText: Although this hotel is walking distance to many tourist attractions, be prepared to pay for that. Restaurants in the area (unless it's a chain like Denny's) are not very 'kid friendly', as in not many food selections for kids, and the prices do not reflect a kids menu. The Walgreen's across the street is convenient, however be aware that it is not 24 hours, which was a disappointment when one of our children woke up at 4:30am with a high fever. Being so close to the many tourist attractions, means that there are many homeless folks in the streets. This was a tough thing to encounter, especially when traveling with children. They were not bothersome, but it was not really what we expected so close to the hotel. Overall the hotel was okay, the rooms were fine and the staff was helpful. Personally, I will not stay so close to the tourist attractions on my next trip...far too expensive, and not really oriented for younger children.

review.title: Too loud
review.reviewText: The fan in the bathroom once you turned on the light was horribly loud and rumbling and it wasnt like you could not use the light. The other rooms had the same problem because we could hear the room next door when their bathroom light was on too.Also when we went to bed, the outside road noise was very loud too. We could hear the traffic all night and the passer-bys talking. The windows themselves were very thin. It would have been a good idea to request a room on the courtside but then there would be a view of the interior courtside to look at only. The room itself was very nice and clean and the beds were very comfortable. One small touch missing was that the coffee pots were well stocked with the exception of stir sticks or spoons to mix the cream and sugar so we passed on the coffee because we were in too much of a rush to either call for them or head downstairs to get them. Close to the wharf was convenient. Parking price expensive!! $50 and the front desk attendent made no recommendations for more reasonable parking so we drove down the street and found 24 hr parking for $30. Wasn't too much of a walk and we saved the $20 for crab sandwiches instead at the wharf! Will make more effort to find the right place next trip to San Fran.Expected to pay a lot for the room but thought it would be without these problems

review.title: Weekend Mom & Me getaway to SF
review.reviewText: I brought my Mom to S.F. for her 68th birthday. The room we had was two queens, and everything about the room and the hotel was great! Very helpful staff at checkin who gave us a map and showed us things in the area to do. Had to ask for more creamer for the coffee - not a problem, quick and courteous accommodation to that request. The room has a really nice, big flat screen, nice view of the city street through a canopy of trees. There's a great outdoor seating/courtyard area which would have been great to sit and sip cocktails if it hadn't been raining. The lobby area is all very modern and there's a wine bar, tv's, and lots of seating grouped in large and small areas. Best part is parking - although you pay $40 plus tax to park, it's good from checkin until 3pm on checkout day (checkout is at 11am). So, if you want to linger and sightsee you still have several hours of parking left at this hotel to do so.

review.title: Awesome breakfast & quiet, clean hotel
review.reviewText:
Stayed over Valentines weekend. Lobby, dining and bar areas just renovated. Our bathroom seemed updated & new. Very quiet room overlooking the courtyard, where we enjoyed late nite snacks and wine. Exercise equipment was new (1 bike, 2 ellipticals, and 4 treadmills, free weights). Hubby & I splurged on the breakfast buffet which featured local cheeses, specialty meats, fresh fruit as well as eggs, potatos, bacon, etc. Breakfast also inc'd oj and a small smoothie.

Easy access to North Beach and Fisherman's Wharf so plenty of dining options. Easy walk up Columbus Ave to Chinatown. Bus Stop is a block away so very easy to go to Golden Gate Park.

Concierge was very helpful and provided coupons and helpful advice about attractions and bus routes info.

I tend to not like touristy areas and have avoided stays at Fisherman's Wharf but decided to give it a try this time. Loved this hotel's location on the edge of North Beach and Fisherman's Wharf. Very convenient for our adventures!

Loved staying at Pier 2620!! Will be back for sure!!

review.title: Nice for the Price
review.reviewText: This Hotel (Pier 2620) was nicer than I expected for the reasonable price we paid. Sporting a minimalist style in decoration, the staff was helpful and courteous, the rooms were clean and stylish (without that garish bright coloration that lesser hotels seem to favor), and the bar, although small, was set-up nicely. I would like to single out the concierge for being untiringly helpful considering that her laptop had been stolen the night before, she gave us good advice and helped us first-time-visitors untangle the maze of bus and trolley schedules and locations.

review.title: Great location, helpful staff, clean rooms
review.reviewText: Ideally situated for those who plan on doing a lot of sightseeing. Lots to see within walking distance, on good bus routes to every direction, and close to two cable car terminals. Front desk staff very helpful, and our room was immaculately clean for most of our stay. However, we stayed a week, and our room cleaner's days off were noticeable. On those days the bed was not well made, and the bathroom was not cleaned properly (towels not changed, soggy washcloth left in a heap on side of tub).Suggest housekeeping supervisors watch their casuals more closely. But the lady who cleaned our room for most of our stay did an excellent job. Our room was very nice and the beds were comfortable. But the walls are thin. We could hear the alarm clock in the room next door (via the adjoining door), and whoever was upstairs thumped back and cross the floor for much of the night. We also got a fair bit of traffic noise through the window (suggest ask for a room overlooking the courtyard to avoid this). They offer a buffet breakfast for around $24, but we ate breakfast elsewhere for a lot less. There is an IHOP within walking distance that we thought was very good. But we think the hotel should offer a more reasonable cooked breakfast option.

review.negativeRemarks: More affordable cooked breakfast. Free local calls (currently charge $1 per call). Closer supervision of casual housekeeping staff.

review.title: Affordable, clean and perfectly located
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel for two nights in February 2014. The room was clean, the neighborhood quiet and facilities were all functional albeit with a sober, non-luxurious appearance, which I am totally fine with. Being two blocks away from the Fisherman's Wharf made this hotel very convenient for my running workouts and for finding great seafood places nearby. The one only thing that made this hotel (slightly) inconvenient was that it was somewhat less accessible from BART stations, which is what I typically use to get from the San Francisco airport to whatever place I am staying at. This can be easily worked around by using the bus. Finally, the concierge at the hotel was very, very friendly and gave us all kinds of tips on how to make the most out of our trip and also helped us find a trustable cab to the airport. I greatly recommend staying at the Pier 2620 Fisherman's Wharf hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, great location, it rained while we were there and hotel staff gave us a couple of umbrellas. The location is super, 2 blocks from the F streetcar endline and 1 block away from the cable car endline. Many buses stop nearby. There´s a Walgreens at walking distance so you can get your bagels and have breakfast in the room, which has coffee maker and small ref. You can also print your boarding passes at the lobby. Free wi-fi in the room. They seemed to be kind of flexible for check-out time and will happily store your bags. All good, really!
review.positiveRemarks: Location mostly, but room was comfortable, clean, good heating system too.
review.negativeRemarks: I think breakfast charge is too expensive.
review.locationRemarks: Location is great, can walk to pier 39 if you want to. Public transportation (F streetcar, cable cars, buses) very close...

review.title: Skip the club level. No perks worth the extra $$$.
review.reviewText:
The hotel it self was beautiful and smelled awesome the moment you step in. My only grip is I reserved the club level thinking it would be worthwhile and it just wasn't. The front desk didn't advise me anything as for perks. The in room info book said to go between room 336-340 for breakfast and evening snacks I walked down there and nothing was labeled or present.
So I guess we paid an extra $20+ a night for 2 bottled waters.

My two cents stay at the hotel and save your $ and skip the club level.

Obviously we didn't let it ruin our experience in the city or the hotel, and we had a wonderful stay. We would definitely come back for sure! Thank you for our great first time in san francisco! :-)

review.title: GREAT SPOT!
review.reviewText:
I needed a room for just one night, close to North Beach. We checked in and the valet and staff were all very friendly. The location is ideal, so we walked to our event since it was just minutes from Washington Square. After over eating and drinking in North Beach, we walked back to our room and had an excellent night's sleep in our very comfy beds! The next morning we had coffee in the room and watched a little TV on the 50" screen before heading out for our Sunday brunch plans.
We will come back for sure. The hotel is updated, clean and comfy! I look forward to staying again.

review.title: Comfortable and good location

We usually stay in Union Square so this was a switch. The hotel is very nice and clean and the room super comfortable. The ebd was wonderful and the bathroom was very user friendly with a large vanity and a nice shower.
The coffee maker was a nice touch.
The location is also great, with lots of restaurnats around.
The AC system has not been part of the renovation and it took a little effort to get it in the temperature we wanted but ti did work out at the end.
The staff was very helpful and pleasant and always ready to guide us as far as transportation or any otehr questions.
Would definetly recommed this hotel but try to get a room facing the courtyard and not the street since it is a busy corner.

review.title: Hotel -- great location for us.
review.reviewText:
We were visiting our daughter in North Beach and enjoyed how close it was the piers and Fisherman's Wharf.
We stayed at the hotel on the last days of Hilton's ownership before it was sold and became Pier 2620 (a reference to its 2620 Jones Street address).

Room was very nice. Only problem I had was adjusting the heating -- which had just been changed under the new ownership. Could have been made easier with new button system.

Still, staff was courteous, friendly and full of information tips.

So overall I recommend it.

review.title: Ideal location at an Ideal price
review.reviewText: Stayed the weekend after Christmas. Great price for location. Renovations were completed (verified prior to booking). Great lobby area! A number of lounge & seating options. Wine tasting bar was a wonderful touch to the atmosphere & very affordable. Parking was $40 (self parking). Very easy access. The room was everything I expected. Clean, comfy, & secure. Functioning windows were a personal plus for me. King size bed very comfy. Clean bathroom and nice meaniful updates as well. Hot water was working fine and when extra fir extra towels there was no hesitation. They were at my door immediately. Check in and check out were seamless. We even were allowed to keep the car in the garage after checkout up to 24 hours from the time we checked in. There after it was the normal which was $6/hour. Our trip was perfect. Could I ask for more yes. Will I no! Great stay! Please don't raise your prices!!!!!!!!!

review.title: Well appointed hotel in great location
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at here on 6th and 7th November 2013. We were on the homeward leg of our US trip and wanted a location that was handy to the key sights and locations as we only had limited time available, to do & see everything we wanted to. The hotel was perfectly located to access the San Sightseeing Company Hop on Hop off stop at wharf 39, wharf for Alcatraz tour, trolley cars and of course Lombard St for the some exercise. I had read some reviews about work being done at the hotel but decided to stay here anyway and I'm glad we did. We didn't see or hear any construction work during our stay. The room was comfortable and had all the things you would expect - although we didn't spend very much time in the room or at the hotel. We did use the gym facility which was well appointed and was nice a clean.

review.reviewText:

Breakfast Buffet...Hilton could/SHOULD do a lot better. Regular scr. eggs, scr. eggs w/veggies, 1/4oz sausage links, crisp bacon!!, brkfst potatoes, heat & serve french toast, round chafer of oatmeal, limited fresh fruit and breads, the rest of the usual. Either lower your rates or upscale the breakfast. Fortunately (or Unfortunately), in todays mindset, it will take that little to swing the guests to you.
No restaurant but you're in Fishermans Wharf for goodnees sake. Who needs one.
No real Bar but they did have Makers Mark 46 Bourbon!!!

review.title: Don't stay there until construction is finished.
review.reviewText: As others have mentioned, it is currently under construction and is a mess. Otherwise the location is good and the rooms are average. Currently is not up to the standard of other 4 star hotels. Wouldn't have stayed there if I'd read the reviews.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for taking the time to share your experience and we apologize for the inconvenience of the renovations. We are sorry you did not receive the room you requested, in addition to the confusion among staff members. We take great pride in the service we provide our guests and we will be sure to discuss this with the staff. Your comments are important and we will take them into consideration.

review.title: Great location for sightseeing, but outdated room
review.reviewText: We stayed here in mid Oct 2013 and got a great rate for the area. When we arrived the lobby was under construction so the front desk was in a conference room. No big deal, we just wanted a place to sleep and keep our bags for the morning. The room we requested was a king and not until reaching our room did we find out we got too doubles. Not to mention the room was very dated and slightly musty. When I called the front desk to enquire about the bed the night manager told me they were out of King rooms and offered me complementary breakfast in the lobby restaurant. I said that would be fine and went to sleep. At 5 AM contstruction started outside our window and woke me up. After we got ready I called the front desk to ask about breakfast. The day manager told me he was not informed of the breakfast offer and told me he had to call the night manager at home to find out the situation. I got tired of waiting so I went to the lobby and explained that if eggs and toast were such a big deal then it wasn't necessary to make big deal about it. The issue was not about breakfast, but taking care of the customer.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is ideal for sightseeing
review.negativeRemarks: Our room needed updating and the staff could use some customer service training.
review.locationRemarks: We walked to Mama's for an amazing brunch and then climbed Telegraph Hill to see Coit Tower.

managementResponses.response: We have taken your words to heart about posting a more obvious construction notice on the website. We’re so glad you like our location. It’s one of our best features. We apologize for the location of the rooms and the air conditioner. We definitely agree construction can cause a less-than-desirable effect on guests, but we hope that when you come back to stay with us after completion, you’ll feel it was worth it!

review.title: BEWARE!
review.reviewText: Hotel under renovation!! Not informed of this prior! No lobby, restaurant....very unhelpful customer service. Parking fee not disclosed prior either and it was quite expensive! I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Rooms ok but hard to get to and very hot even with the air on full force. The only good thing about this hotel is the location as it is a couple of blocks from fisher mans warf. We would have been a little happier if the hotel gave us some compensation for all the inconvenience of their renovation......noise, dust, etc, etc, etc.
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing
review.negativeRemarks: Hot room
review.userLocation: Fisherman's Wharf, San Francisco, CA, USA

managementResponses.response: We’re sorry to hear about your unusual experience. We never intend for our guests to be uncomfortable and appreciate your feedback of our guestrooms, which we are reviewing. Please make plans to come see the newly renovated hotel when it’s finished.

review.title: Expected more from a Hilton.
review.reviewText:
Rooms are quite dated. Musty smell upon entering room. AC/Heater fan was very loud (sounded like it was scraping). Windows need resealed...loud street noise even on top floor.

Valet lost key to our car for 20 minutes which is a little unnerving.

For $200+/night you can do much better in San Fran.

I will still stay at Hiltons as this wan't typical of most of my experiences.
review.positiveRemarks: Room service was prompt
review.negativeRemarks: Update/clean rooms (carpet), fix noisy windows and climate control.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf

managementResponses.response: We appreciate your review, although we are disappointed that our current renovations posed some issues for you. We apologize for the condition of the ground floor and the absence of hotel facilities. As always, the feedback from our guests is very important and we thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts about your stay.

review.title: POOR VALUE FOR MONEY
review.reviewText: HOTEL WAS UNDER A MAJOR LOBBY/GROUND FLOOR REFURB, CHECK IN TOOK PLACE IN A SIDE ROOM ANNEXE, THERE WERE NO HOTEL FACILITIES AVAILABLE APART FROM THE ELEVATOR TO THE ROOM. IT WAS A BED WITHOUT BREAKFAST EXPERIENCE FOR € 200 USD, SHAMEFUL PROFITERING HILTON. TAKE, TAKE, TAKE. WE SHOULD HAVE STAYED IN A MOTEL
review.positiveRemarks: BREDROOM
review.negativeRemarks: ALL OTHER ASPECTS
review.locationRemarks: GOOD PROXINITY TO FISHERMANS WHARF.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your understanding. Although your stay did not exceed your expectations, we can assure you the current renovations will be worth it. We are glad to hear the staff was helpful and kind, and the rooms were roomy and clean. We appreciate your feedback, as we are always working to improve communication with our guests. We apologize for any inconvenience. We look forward to seeing you in the future!

review.title: Hotel under construction
review.reviewText: This was an unplanned overnight on our honeymoon. After sever nights of camping we were looking forward to a nice comfortable night in a hotel. When we found the hotel there was a sign at the parking garage that said it was full so we needed to find street parking. Unfortunately most of the street directly in front of the hotel was blocked off due to construction. We ended up parking around the block from the hotel. Right away we could see there was work being done and the staff/ hotel was doing the best they could. We had booked a king sized bed but was told at check in there were no available kings. We were offered 2 doubles and given complementary breakfast buffets instead (which we were fine with). We didn't mind the construction but it was a little frustrating being woken up at 7am on a Saturday to the construction noise. It would have been nice if we had been warned since the work was being done right outside and right under our room. I know work needs to be done from time to time but a warning would have been nice. The staff were very helpful and kind. The rooms were roomy and clean. We would definitely go back as long as there was no construction going on at the time.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for taking the time to share your experience and we apologize for the inconvenience of the renovations. We’re sorry to hear the hotel lobby was dusty and the hotel staff was not easily accessible. Your comments are important and we will take them into consideration.

review.title: Very Disappointing Overnight Stay
review.reviewText: I wouldn't stay here again!! There is a major remodel going on in the main lobby which creates a number of unpleasant results...the entire lobby area is dusty and noisy, the makeshift main desk with check in is far from the elevators, the concierge and hotel staff were not easily accessible and not accommodating, the walk from cavernous garage to main desk to hotel room was very long, overnight parking fee was exorbitant, and, for a non-smoking hotel....we had someone smoking in the room across from us...stunk up the entire hallway! We were thankful that we had only booked 1 night stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Location to Fisherman's Wharf was good...that's about it!

managementResponses.response: It’s always nice to hear praise for the staff! I’ll pass along the thought. We’re all happy to know you enjoyed the convenient location. We are currently undergoing renovations and we apologize for the dust. We will actually be moving to free basic WIFI the beginning of November and are excited to welcome you back soon.

review.title: Hilton San Fran fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: The hotel was quite OK cuz very convenient to the wharf! Staff very amiable and friendly! The disappointing thing was that it was so dusty due to the constructions going on. Hilton should provide free WFI access in all the rooms! ! Even hotels in 3rd world countries have it now you know!
review.positiveRemarks: The amiable and friendly staff!
review.negativeRemarks: Free wifi access to the rooms!

managementResponses.response: We appreciate your choice to stay with us during our renovations. We realize they can be a bit of an inconvenience for our current guests, but they will be well worth it in the end, we can assure you. We hope you will make the choice to come back and see us after they have been completed, to enjoy all that we have to offer.

review.title: Unfortunately big renovations.
