review.reviewText: Huge renovations meant that check in etc in temporary area. Room basic for a Hilton . Close to all that Fishermans wharf has to offer . Walk to piers, food, big bus etc

review.title: Not what I expect from Hilton
review.reviewText: The rooms looked rather dated, more like a road-side hotel than the Hilton. There was construction going on that Expedia made no mention of. The Expedia web-site claimed free WiFi which is simply not true, they charge $10. The TV was hard to use with the crappy remote and there was virtually no channel selection to speak of. Not even something basic like CNN or ESPN.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was OK

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice, just was not told it was under construction. But it was still nice and did not affect us at all.

review.title: Dusty and Dirty
review.reviewText:
The room and lobby were dusty and dirty making it a terrible experience, it felt like you were walking in to the 1970's. Good luck finding parking because they do not offer it for your vehicle. Instead they charge the tourist $50 a day for parking so the lot is full the entire time but they still manage to add in a charge on your bill for parking, weird.

Go across the street and stay there.

review.title: It's okay overall, but some staff are very unkind
review.reviewText:
One staff look like angry all the time; hang off my phone call herself. The others were nice.

It was cheaper to extend hotel from front desk than paying on Expedia.

review.title: Great location but under construction, annoying.
review.reviewText: The hotel is conveniently located to fishermans wharf, walking distance to alot of attractions and restaurants or a short taxi ride elsewhere. You do not need a car and to park it is about $40/day so if you're debating check how much it is for a taxi to airport or what the hotel offers. The lobby is under complete construction which is a minor inconvenience, honestly how much time do you spend in a lobby?

review.title: Good location... That is it!
review.reviewText:
To begin with we got there and found out that the hotel lobby and guest services floor was under construction! First impression... Not the best. When we checked in the lady who checked us in had a very bada attitude, never smiled or asked anything other than what last name was our reservation under! Once she gave us the room keys I asked her how we would go about getting the breakfast that was included and free internet. She gave me "the stink" eye and said that she couldn't see that neither of those services were included! I told her that I would pull my itinerary and show her, so I did! She gave me the coupons and told me how to access the Internet. And that was it! Never did they say they were sorry for having such a huge mess nor did she ask anything about how we were doing! The cleaning staff were really nice, we got Margarita and she was always nice and friendly . The waiters at the restaurant were also very nice.
We stayed in a superior double and ely like it was very small, you hear everything from the street and other rooms. I will never stay at this hotel again or at another hilton, we always stay at the Sheraton and I regretted not doing that my whole trip!

review.title: Renovations
review.reviewText: With the renovations being done, one would think the hotel would provide some complimentary services or additional offerings. The minor inconveniences and construction noise would have been a little more acceptable if the hotel management acknowledged the work being done detracts from the whole hotel experience.

review.title: My stay
review.reviewText: It was a pleasant stay. Staff were very polite and friendly. They helped me with anything I requested.

review.title: Eh, remodeling sucks
review.reviewText: This was our first stay at a Hilton. We were unaware that Hilton had torn out their main entrance, front desk, lobby and common areas and were in the middle of a major remodel. When we walked into the side entrance(this is the temporary entrance) we were checking in to a construction site. The front desk was located in a small room with folding tables and files everywhere. The staff was nice and helpful and seemed to be doing the best they could under these circumstances. I was disappointed that after driving all day (with 2 tired kids)we didn't get to enjoy the beauty and relaxed atmosphere we expected (and paid for)at the Hilton. Our room was small and a little dirty (sticky pink spots on the carpet) the size was pretty much what you would expect for the area (fisherman's wharf). The parking was pricey and confusing. The parking garage was about $43 per day, we later realized we probably could have found much less expensive and secure parking nearby.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, Location, Location right in Fisherman's Wharf
review.negativeRemarks: Let potential guests know you are remodeling. Take a look at the carpet when you are cleaning. Sticky stains? If only I had my bissel.
review.locationRemarks: San Fran, Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Hotel Lobby under Reconstruction
review.reviewText:
No one told us when we booked our room that the Hilton is undergoing a major lobby reconstruction.
Noise, Dust, Inconvenience abounds. Not worth the price. Should have disclosed or reduced room rate.

review.title: Excellent ubicación
review.reviewText: It is a great hotel, ubicated on a walking distance to the wharf which makes it perfect for us

review.title: Not what one would expect at a Hilton
review.reviewText: One lamp next to the bed didn't work, which made reading in bed a problem. The bathroom door wouldn't stay open, a prior guest had made a door jamb out of a piece of cardboard. There was no room darkening curtain, only the sheer daytime one, so the bright lights immediately outside the room shone in on the bed all night. There was a $38 charge for parking, which seemed excessive even in S.F. and a $10 charge for internet. Even the cheapest motels (heck, even bus stations!) have free internet these days. The staff at the front desk were not particularly friendly or helpful either.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean, quiet (we had an interior room, not facing the street), and close to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Nice hotel, near the wharf
review.reviewText: Check in was confusing, staff wasn't sure about setting up the computers-- they are about to remodel the lobby, don't go within the near future because it will be a construction zone:(, but the staff was nice, the room was great.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was great--within walking distance of the wharf. Parking was expensive--$38 dollars per night to park in the garage. Nice hotel, though.
review.negativeRemarks: It would have been nice to know about the construction ahead of my stay.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf and wharf attractions all within walking distance.

review.title: Nice Place to Stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Everything was very good but the rooms are not that big.
review.positiveRemarks: Very close to the Fisherman's Wharf, everything is at decent walking distance.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the Fisherman's Wharf, everything is at decent walking distance.

review.title: 5 stars Hotel
review.reviewText: Clean room, friendly stuff, quite area. Nothing Negative about this hotel. Definitely stay at this hotel again.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Walk around Fisherman Dwarf and Pier 39

review.title: Hotel Hilton, Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay close to all activities at Fisherman's Wharf. Bed was very comfortable and the room clean and a roomy size. But please why don't hotels offer wi fi throughout the entire hotel it is so frustrating to only be available in 1 or 2 areas of the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and roomy room
review.negativeRemarks: Not having wi fi throughout
review.locationRemarks: Great location easily accessible to Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Hotel staff
review.reviewText: This hotel's staff is well educated. Thank you very much.

review.title: Easy access to all San Francisco has to offer.
review.reviewText:
First, the staff at this Hilton were the rudest I have yet to meet. I am a Hilton HHonors member and have stayed at my fair share of Hiltons, so this statement is based on knowledge of the Hilton chain. Front desk staff acted like they could have cared less that we arrived. The valet was not available, so we left our keys at the front desk with a verbal promise we would receive a valet ticket sent to our room. We did not get our valet ticket until the next day, and although this might not be a big deal, not knowing where your car is located becomes a big deal. Bartender at the little bar downstairs was just as rude.

Anyway, enough complaints about the staff. The hotel itself is very nice. Rooms are clean, beds are comfortable and the sheets are crisp and smell wonderful. Bathrooms were a little small, but plenty of fluffy towels and great water pressure. The hotel is located two blocks from the waterfront, and accessing the cities best areas was just a walk away.
review.positiveRemarks: Easy access to waterfront and other attractions. Fresh linens that smelled fantastic. Large number of restaurants located nearby.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel staff could receive a lesson in hospitality. I know it is a thankless job, but customer service is important.
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans Wharf Ghirardelli's China Town Little Italy Shopping District Waterfront National Park Fort Mason

review.title: Review Hilton--Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco.
review.reviewText:
Great location--walking distance to everything.Great staff--very helpful.
Some confusion over the breakfast buffet--cost and paying for it.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Cost of breakfast buffet
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: stay at the holiday inn across the road!!
review.reviewText: you pay for the Hilton name, great location but to park is $35 a night, I would stay at the holiday inn, better location and the rooms are the same as the Hilton but cheaper
review.positiveRemarks: location
review.negativeRemarks: expensive for anything, parking, wifi.. you pay for the Hilton name and that is it
review.locationRemarks: good

review.title: Hilton, Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Rooms were very clean. Staff could not do enough for you. Food was very good and prices were very fair. Would stay there again. No problems. Close to everything .
review.positiveRemarks: Food and staff
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything. Cable cars, the Wharf what ever you wanted it was close.

review.title: Just what we needed after a long flight
review.reviewText:
Just what we needed after a long flight from the UK. Beds were very comfortable and room had everything we needed.
Thank you
review.positiveRemarks: Comfy beds
review.locationRemarks: Close to all the important SF places

review.title: incredible location
review.reviewText: Couldn't ask for a better walking location as easy walking distance to everything you want to see and visit. If you want to go into union square just jump on the cable car which is only 2 blocks away. Room size was nice but beds need updating as ours sagged in the middle. Breakfast not worth the money. The staff were really friendly and helpful. We would stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: We loved location and the staff.
review.negativeRemarks: update the beds, would have loved to have a hot tub or pool.
review.locationRemarks: Lombard, Coit tower, wharf, ferries (regular & Alcatraz), cable car all within walking distance. Lots of restaurants to choose from for all budgets

review.title: Nice hotel walking distance from the Bay
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel in perfect location to walk to restaurants, tours, shopping and entertainment. Rooms were clean and spacious. Staff very courteous and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, staff, cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: walking distance from the bay, close to many restaurants, tours, entertainment venues

review.title: Overbooked and cold breakfast
review.reviewText: We booked a King size bed hotel room and when we arrived (several hours before check-in) we were informed that there were no King bed rooms available and they said they "overbooked" rooms and we could only get a room with 2 double beds and the hotel staff put us in a room very far away from the elevator and next to the housekeeping elevator which was noisy. The staff did offer us free breakfast buffet but this was also disappointing because the eggs and bacon were cold and we had to ask for utensils to eat our food. This is not the quality I remember of Hilton hotels and I feel they have gone downhill. We will not book a room at a Hilton hotel again.

review.title: Clean and quiet room-close to pier
review.reviewText: The hotel was within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and a great little place around the corner for breakfast called Hollywood Cafe. It was cheaper than the hotel breakfast. The hotel itself was clean and so was the room. My only complaint was the bed. Way too soft and it sagged in the middle.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean hotel, friendly staff
review.negativeRemarks: The beds
review.locationRemarks: Walgreens across the street, cable car turnaround was at the end of the block. Bike rentals, tour bus stops, & Pier all within 3 short blocks

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Clean rooms were a little warm but the air conditioner did work if we needed
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness and the great service
review.negativeRemarks: Didn't stay longer
review.locationRemarks: Right in the heart of San Francisco

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText:
2 blocks from the water, walking distance to many restaurants, shops, piers, and cable car turnaround station. Fisherman's Wharf is a fun area. Take the cable car to Union Square and then walk back through Chinatown and Little Italy. Also, hotel is not too far from Lombard St.
Hotel room was spacious and clean. Front desk clerk was very friendly and highlighted areas on a map that are a must see.
Parking fee is expensive, but there is no way around if you have a car. Streets having parking meters or 2 hr. parking limits. Can't park for free anywhere unless you live there and have a resident sticker.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, reasonable rates, cleanliness.

review.title: Just OK.
review.reviewText: Expected more from a Hilton. This isn't a Hilton "Garden", it's supposed to be the full deal. The price certainly was. We were originally put in a "accessible" room, which was very drab, poor lighting and tired looking. The staff was very cordial and accommodating in moving us to a regular room, which was better. Location within the city was very good. Parking was convenient but expensive.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Tired feel to the decor
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient

review.title: Stay away from the room 183!
review.reviewText:
Never, ever accepte the room 183!!! 1st floor very noisy outside and the best part the garbadge truck at 12am or 2am just under the room! Light sleepers, stay away from this room!
Since I hate to be only negative, the big advantage of this hotel is the location, very close to most of the interesting things in SF. So the car stays in the garage...

review.title: Great location. Expected more for price.
review.reviewText: Hotel is located a couple blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39. I guess that is what you are paying for... Don't forget $38 to self park/ day or $45 to valet. Staff was very nice and professional. The have me a free Buffett coupon, because they did not have the king bed I reserved. It was a want, not a need so it's ok. Everything was fairly neat and clean, but no frills. Room was very basic, could use help in the decor for the rooms. Quite boring. I would stay there again if the opportunity presented itself. Location a plus!
review.positiveRemarks: Location!
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive, for no extras, or frills. No pool.
review.locationRemarks: A plus! Quiet in evening surprisingly. And I was on the street side.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Would recommend to anyone staying in SF near the Wharf. Walking distance to ALL attractions. Employees were helpful and friendly. Beds were very comfortable. Anything we asked was done ASAP. Would stay here again in a heartbeat!
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was very comfortable. Staff was friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Four of us in the room. We needed four coffee cups every morning. Only two were left. They brought more, but we had to call for them.
review.locationRemarks: Location was perfect. We walked anywhere we wanted from there. We are not used to all night city sounds but I brought ear plugs and slept like a baby!

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: This was our first time in San Francisco. This hotels employees were very friendly and helpful. The room was very spacious, clean and comfortable, although room service a little costly we really enjoyed our stay. Also in great location for Fisherman Wharf visitors. I would stay here again and recommend to family and friends.

review.title: Three generation journey
review.reviewText: Staff is outstanding. They went out of there way to solve our parking problem. I was very disappointed at the daily cost of wi-fi. That will be a factor in my next hotel choice.
review.positiveRemarks: Outstanding staff
review.negativeRemarks: Cost of wi-fi
review.locationRemarks: Close to Pier 39 and trolley and Alcatraz tour.

review.title: Great hotel and great location for tourists
review.reviewText: The hotel experience was really good, the rooms are confortable and the service is great. The best thing for me, was the location.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, is very close to fisherman's wharf and pier 39
review.negativeRemarks: The parking rate
review.locationRemarks: The best

review.title: Very noisy hotel
review.reviewText:
This Hotel is in an area of San Francisco where the tourist will come , no matter what.
The hotel is used to seeing maximum occupancy and has little incentive to improve !
It does NOT live up to the standards of a HIlton.

The is only one person at the reception desk on Friday evening at 7.00 pm. Why only one person, when the guests are arriving at a fast pace at that prime time?

The rooms are very noisy, especially the ones facing the pool.
I stayed at 308 and it was disturbing because the A C plant is right under that room.
I wonder what the noise level at 108 and 208 would be?
That A C unit needs to be enclosed to dampen the loud noise.

Please revoke its affiliation to Hilton, and down grade the rating
review.positiveRemarks: Good location, close to fisherman's wharf
review.negativeRemarks: The loud noise from the A C plant in some of the rooms

review.title: Enjoyable stay.
review.reviewText:
Room was small but clean & comfortable. Great location. Close to many good restaurants and sites. Friendly, helpful staff. Parking was convenient albeit a bit pricey...$38 per day. Felt my car was safe.

Will stay here again on next visit.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Easy walking distance to Fishermans Wharf shops and restaurants. Great hotel to stay at, even though we only stayed one night. Staff were very friendly and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Beds were very comfy, free wifi
review.negativeRemarks: Bit far from San Francisco airport

review.title: Good hotel for family
review.reviewText: Hotel is nice, clean, and in a good location. Great experience overall. Staff was friendly and helpful. Only complaint is the cost of parking. $38 per day for self park and $45 per day for valet parking. Other than that, great.

review.title: great location lousy beds
review.reviewText:
The beds suck. both me and my wife had sore backs after one nigh.We stayed 4 nights If
We did not prepay We would have switched hotels The power was out for one day. so not hot showers I guess this does not happen a lot I was told. The people are nice and helpful. But if you do not get a good night sleep.What good is the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: location
review.negativeRemarks: beds
review.locationRemarks: Hilton on the wharf Jones and Bay st

review.title: Great location for sight-seeing!
review.reviewText: Stay was for the US Half Marathon in early November. Perfect location since it was only a few blocks away from Aquatic Park. Great hotel, friendly staff!
review.positiveRemarks: Complimentary breakfast buffet was exceptional
review.negativeRemarks: Street traffic was noisy 24/7
review.locationRemarks: Great proximity to Fisherman's Wharf, Ghiradelli Square, cable cars, street car, local dining.

review.title: It's ok
review.reviewText: This hotel is nice enough... Seems a little older in design however it seems to,be nicely kept.

review.title: Happy at Hilton
review.reviewText: Ver efficient and accomadating staff. Concierge knew her stuff. excellent location at Fishermans Wharf so great for tourists and business people alike. Easy access to transport and shops. Breakfast and free internet were included in the price. I would expect free internet at all levels. Breakfast fine but restaurant area without windows and was a little small.............however this is a minor issue and didn't detract from the experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Room size and ammenities
review.negativeRemarks: restaurant size and location
review.locationRemarks: excellent location to tourist area of Fishermans Wharf and to local transport of ferries, cable cars and bus transport.

review.title: GREAT HOTEL
review.reviewText: We were surprised when we were there during fleet week and world cup. Enjoyed every moment and had a wonderful stay at Hilton. Close to pier 39 and all the other attractions. Would go again and stay at the Hilton. Wonderful choice!!!!
review.positiveRemarks: exceptionally clean rooms
review.negativeRemarks: Parking charges but they almost all charge for parking
review.locationRemarks: walking distances to all sites including cable cars, buses. parked our car and either walked or took transit.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Me and my kids enjoyed our stay. It is close to Fisherman's Wharf and we felt very safe and comfortable walking around at night. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Motel 6 quality for a Hilton Price
review.reviewText: Old food in the fridge from the last occupants. $200+ for 5days parking. Sketchy elevators. Overall it was a Motel 6 stay for a Hilton price. We have stayed at much better places in San Francisco some for more $ some for less

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: Great. Clean, comfortable. Even has Chinese language service.

review.title: Great location but no so great inside...
review.reviewText: The hotel is at great location and the staff were quite nice. However, the beds were not comfortable: made so much noise even a small child moved a little on the bed. We stayed on the second floor and we can hear the foot steps of who was on the third floor. The hotel rooms can really use some upgrade.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Business center was good. Overall a pleasant experience.

review.title: Great hotel near Fisherman's Wharf!
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay very much! We only stayed 2 nights, but it was a great location ! The staff was very helpful and friendly ! I was traveling with my daughter and her friend and we all enjoyed our stay!
review.locationRemarks: Great location!

review.title: Great location and great for families.
review.reviewText: My family (husband, 15 year old daughter, 12 year old son) were very pleased with the experience we had staying at this hotel. The location was great, the staff helpful and the hotel was clean. We parked our car at the convenient parking garage and walked everywhere, fisherman's wharf, Ghiradelli Square, North Beach, China Town and the Ferry Building. It was an excellent trip.
review.positiveRemarks: We love the location.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: It's really great hotel no problem at all. The only issue for me is the concierge staff: everyday is a different one at mostly of then is not nice!
review.positiveRemarks: Location and Comfort
review.negativeRemarks: Concierge staff
review.locationRemarks: Perfect!

review.title: DIDN'T WANT TO LEAVE!
review.reviewText: So clean and comfortable. Neighbor above us were so noisy though. We referred to him as the Clysdale but that's not the hotel's fault
review.positiveRemarks: coffee and water in the lobby every morning
review.negativeRemarks: no free parking for guests. Parking is so expensive in San Francisco
review.locationRemarks: Loved it. Right on Fisherman's Wharf and close enough to walk elsewhere

review.title: Great location, see all the sights!
review.reviewText: Great location, we could walk to so many interesting sights. Hotel staff extremely friendly and helpful. Disappointed parking was so expensive.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean comfortable room. Breakfast available within hotel
review.negativeRemarks: Cost of parking
review.locationRemarks: Although not really any views, great location with attractions within easy walking distance.

review.title: Super Location
review.reviewText: Great location for visitors to San Francisco...walk to everything in Fisherman's Wharf!
review.positiveRemarks: location
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast prices
review.locationRemarks: walk to everything!

review.title: Nice hotel close to Wharf
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice and great location close to Fisherman's Wharf. We also walked to Ghiradelli and China Town. Had breakfast in the hotel a couple of days and it was just okay. I would recommend eating breakfast at a local mom and pop place around the corner which was awesome. Concierge at the hotel gave us the recommendation. Staff was friendly overall. Only downside was our room was on the first floor and you could hear traffic going by. I would stay here again for sure..but request 3rd floor.

review.title: Good Hotel for San Fran Visit
review.reviewText: The rooms were a good size and clean. Staff was helpful and friendly. Good walking distance to all the things to do at Fisherman's Warf area and transportation. Only complaint was that our room was overlooking a street and it could get pretty noisy especially in the mornings.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location
review.negativeRemarks: Noise
review.locationRemarks: Close to Fisherman's Warf area and transportation to other parts of town

review.title: Hilton treats you like family
review.reviewText:
Our only critique is that free Internet access should be available in the rooms, not just the the lobby. In today's world of easy access of information, it was an annoyance to have to go to the lobby. Especially in an exciting town where little time is spent in the room.
The staff was friendly, helpful and attentive.
We look forward to returning.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location and great staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of free wifi in rooms

review.title: WORST STAY EVER!
review.reviewText: staff were very unhelpful, you had to 45.00 a night for parking. Beds were very uncomfrtable. There was no pool.... worst stay I have had in a long time
review.negativeRemarks: BED
review.locationRemarks: SAN FRAN

review.title: Choose another hotel.
review.reviewText: This hotel was very expensive for what you get. It was no better than an average motel. You are paying for its location

review.title: One night in San Fran...
review.reviewText: I booked the room for two adults and two children. The room had two double beds, though comfortable, too small for two adults to share.

review.title: Hilton Fishermans Wharf:great location but eat out
review.reviewText:
This is a small Hilton with fewer facilities than others I have stayed in. Bedrooms are generously proportioned and are clean. Showers are the over- bath type but powerful with plentiful hot water.
Location is very convenient for Fisherman Wharf and for connections uptown by cablecar and trolleybus. I didn't try it but breakfast is available and prices seemed consistent with other offerings nearby. You can eat as well and more cheaply by selecting a cafe/ diner for your meals.
the hotel bar was closed at times you'd expect it to be open but that's not a bad thing when 2 glasses of local wine cost 19 dollars. (I paid $7 for 2 in local bar and the wine was better).
In short, stay here but eat out as most folks do. Staff were helpful and polite and location very good.
review.positiveRemarks: Location- quiet but convenient
review.negativeRemarks: Bar prices
review.locationRemarks: See above. Great for tourists visitng the Wharf, golden gate bridge, Alcatras

review.title: Hilton Fisherman's Wharf, May 30th - June 2nd 2012
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with the porters/bellhops and the concierge -- sorry we don't remember names. They were the ones working the day we arrived, Wednesday, 5/30.
review.positiveRemarks: Conveniece & helpful employees
review.negativeRemarks: Cost of parking, but somewhat understandable
review.locationRemarks: Location was good since we could walk most places or catch the trolley or bus easily.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Comfortable rooms (had two adjacent) in convenient location. Noisy but expected in a busy city (others have complained--must not be used to a city!) Front desk staff and concierge were friendly, helpful--offered EXCELLENT suggestions for dining and getting around. Valet parking expensive, but service was excellent, and prices were normal for the area.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, location, location!
review.locationRemarks: One-two blocks walking to the Embarcadero attractions and to cable cars, other transportation.

review.title: Great stay in SF
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly and helpful when it came to any of our needs. The room was nice and comfortable, no one we were with had any complaints about our stay.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Great location-walking distance to everything.

review.title: Location is perfect
review.reviewText: The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We had 2 beds in our room. One bed was very comfortable yet the other seemed like it needed a new mattress it was very uncomfortable. The location of the Hotel is perfect.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location in the middle of everything we wanted to do so it was all within walking distance. We just needed the cable car for Union square

review.title: Excellent hotel, but noisy
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice, but noisy. You could hear water running through the pipes when other guests were showering, and the street noise went on most of the night.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, beautiful
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient

review.title: Nice Hotel in a great location.
review.reviewText: Easy walk to Fisherman's Wharf and pier for tour to Alcatraz. Very helpful staff. Only draw-back were the double beds - would have slept better if they were queen size.

review.title: Great hotel but take ear plugs!
review.reviewText: Hotel was brilliantly located in Fisherman's Wharf, easy to walk to harbour. Hotel staff very helpful and rooms clean and good facilities. Only problem was that our room overlooked a busy road and the double glazing was really poor so it was very noisy all night which did spoil our stay a little. Only recommendation is to take ear plugs!
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Street Noise

review.title: Good hotel, dreadfull parking cost!
review.reviewText: Beware the parking cost!!! I ended up with a $140 parking bill for three nights!!!
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: The parking costs

review.title: San Francisco hotels showing their age.
review.reviewText: No free wifi in room, Double bed instead of queen sagged badly, needed to stuff pillows under the mattress to level it. One of the elevators was out of commission. Some of the television channels were standard def and very fuzzy. Floor above us creaked loudly whenever someone walked across.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Sagging mattress.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco, 2 blocks from fisherman's wharf.

review.title: Super Service
review.reviewText: While the creature comforts of this Hilton are commendable, the most notable aspect of our short stay was the incredibly personable, quick, and considerate service we received from the staff. No matter how big or small our questions may have been, the staff jumped on our requests like they were their top priority. We will definitely be booking with them again.

review.title: Good not great
review.reviewText: It was nice, but I would have expected parking as part of the room and just felt like I was squeezed for every penny.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice rooms
review.negativeRemarks: No in-room amenities. Tv was there but not great
review.locationRemarks: Best location for any city lover, warf within a walk, trolley stops right outside and will take you anywhere

review.title: Good location, Older rooms, but reasonable value.
review.reviewText:
SF is expensive. This hotel (and area) offers good value. Its a little outdated (like a 70's Hilton), but its fine compared to others and value.

We did have to ask to change our room, as it was located right next to the vending and ice machines which sounded like construction work through the walls, so watch for that.

The location is excellent in Fishermans wharf. A two block stroll and you are down at wharf side, with restaurants, trams etc. A good base camp.

Breakfast was excellent (crab cake eggs benedict being very fine).

Word of warning, if you arrive late (after 09:30) all restaurants are closed!! You can get an in&out burger down 2 blocks or the Hyatt Restaurant down a block and right.

Paid Parking is 1 block down and available overnight.

Recommended with caveats.

review.title: Quiet and clean
review.reviewText: Stayed in one of the rooms facing the interior courtyard, quiet, clean, comfortable beds and pillows, easy access to Fishermans Wharf and surrounding sites. Very helpful staff. Spent three nights here with my wife and two small children. We had to pay extra to have a fridge so I could store some medication which was a little disappointing but apart from that a great place to stay for a family that needs somewhere quiet to sleep. Darrens Cafe in Taylor St just around the corner does some great food and we had some very good sushi at Miyabi.
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet enough for the kids to get a good sleep
review.negativeRemarks: Paying for a fridge to store some medication
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to Fishermans Wharf and some good restaurants

review.title: Ceilings not sound-proof
review.reviewText: Ceilings are not sound-proof, can hear every step in room above your's. Hotel has 3 guest room floors. We stayed on second floor, bad luck. We were continually awakened during the night. Make sure your room is on the third floor to avoid hearing the commotion above your room.
review.positiveRemarks: Courteous Service
review.negativeRemarks: The noise above my room
review.locationRemarks: Prefer not to stay in Fisherman's Wharf. Very touristy.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Excellent location, walking distance to restaurants and entertainment, very clean and great staff. Parking is expensive, it's in a noisy area so you can hear cars and I even heard people walking outside the hotel talking loud and my main complaint was the beds, very old and uncomfortable, strange since Hilton is known for it's comfort. I would stay again but I would make sure I get good beds and a room in the highest floor to avoid noise.
review.positiveRemarks: Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square, Little Italy, Chinatown, cable car, pier 39 and Alcatraz tours in Pier 33.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs to change their mattresses, they are very old and uncomfortable.

review.title: great location and very clean.
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location for family's, couples, everyone. Very clean and comfy beds.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and cleanliness
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of information about what was going on around the city for New Years.
review.locationRemarks: Great location for tourist.

review.title: Average
review.reviewText: We had some billing issues at this hotel, where we were charged twice for our stay. The hotel staff were not really willing to help or understanding about our situation and their mistake. It took us 5 days to have the manager finally speak to us.
review.positiveRemarks: Very close to main pier attractions
review.negativeRemarks: staff quite unhelpful
review.locationRemarks: the hotel was very close to the main pier attractions, however quite a long walk from union square, where you will find all the shopping!

review.title: Great location on the wharf
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Easy access to all SF attractions. Walk to Pier 39 and more. Breakfast was great and staff helpful. We will be back
review.negativeRemarks: needs wifi in the rooms

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: The hotel was ok.

review.title: Good hotel in a great location when touristing in SF!
review.reviewText: The hotel is located close to everything a tourist would want to see on a short stay in San Francisco. Ghirardelli square, cable cars and pier 39. Clean and comfortable and with a friendly staff. Good breakfast!
review.locationRemarks: I love the Marina district of San Francisco. A little bit quieter, and very beautiful. Nice streets to stroll around and close to many tourist attractions.

review.title: Ash
review.reviewText: Location and price was so good for us! Thanks Hilton hotel!

review.title: Good stay
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was very accomodating and friendly

review.title: SF - one week - Great Time
review.reviewText: My wife and I spent a week at this hotel and had a great time. Everything is within walking distance or close to public transportation. Room was quiet, but who stays in a room for very long. Staff was great with suggestions and responsive to all of our needs. Had a great week!!!

review.title: Great location and quiet comfortable room
review.reviewText:
We were allowed to check in 3.5 hours early which was great considering we had bad jetlag from hour 14 hour flight. The room was large, clean, had a comfortable bed and good water pressure in the shower. The staff were friendly and there was a newspaper slid under the door daily.
Breakfast was good in the buffet with a design your own omlette offered as part of the buffet.
The ONLY thing preventing me from giving this hotel a perfect 5 rating is that we accidently left a credit card in the room. Whilst we did cancel it with our bank immediately upon realising our mistake we rang the hotel and asked them to cut up the card for us. The receptionist told us this could be done and said would ring us back and/or email us as confirmation.... well it's 2 weeks later and still no comfirmation.
If you're not inclined to make a mistake like we did with our credit card then I recommend this hotel highly... it's just the "after-customer care" I'm disappointed with.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText:
I reserved online through expedia.com Check in was easy, thanks to Priscilla at the front desk. The room was clean and the bathroom had plenty of towels. More or less what you expect from a Hilton. One thing that stood out in sharp contrast was the safe. My laptop and valuables fit well, but I had to remove the sliding closet doors to open the safe door wide enough!
Overall it was a nice stay

review.title: Love the location...clean rooms!!!
review.reviewText: Top notch. The location was perfect. The room was very clean. We would definitely stay again. Try Pompei's Grotto on the wharf...the best crab dishes.

review.title: Perfect Location and Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel! The breakfast buffet was convenient with an amazing selection of items. Very friendly staff. If looking for a place close to Fisherman's Wharf but away from the hustle and bustle this hotel is perfect. Close to bus, trolley and train stops.

review.title: Very Convenient
review.reviewText: Overall, the hotel was okay, the rooms are basic and look like they have been well used. The fabric on the arm chair was tattered and torn, the hotel towels needed to be replaced, the carpet was slightly worn, but everything was clean, it just needs a bit of updating. The bathroom was nice and clean. The hotel does have an air conditioner, which is a plus. The hotel seemed very safe and all of the staff that we spoke with were friendly and accomodating. The location is great, we were able to walk to all of the area attractions, including Lombard street, the Italian area, China Town, Fisherman's Wharf, etc...

review.title: Great location! Conveniently located near Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Great location! Conveniently located near Fisherman s Wharf and to public transportation. We walk EVERYWHERE! Close to Little Italy!

review.title: Too Noisy for Me
review.reviewText:
This hotel is well located for fishermans wharf, which to me is very tacky and best avoided. However, very good to get to the trolley car stop.
The beds are small, single glazed windows and poor room to room sound proofing.
We were awakened each morning by traffic noise, noisy pedestrians or other guests getting showered so not a vefry relaxing stay.
Parking is expensive in SF and this hotel is no exception.

review.title: Would Always stay in this hotel when in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Staff at this hotel were very helpful, breakfast is great and also good value, location is very good, we would highly recommend this hotel for good value for money, good service good accomodation.We would always book this hotel when in San Francisco

review.title: Very Impressed!
review.reviewText: The hotel, services and staff were excellent and the location was great.

review.title: this hotel worked perfectly for our SFO vacation
review.reviewText:
We enjoyed our stay at the Hilton on Fisherman's Wharf. It is in a perfect location;
a few blocks from the waterfront with enough distance to have a quiet stay but close enough to be very convenient. The hotel felt like a pleasant reprieve from a busy way of sightseeing. The trolley turnaround and Starbucks are on the corner. We will stay there again when we visit San Francisco waterfront.

review.title: Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a great location for Fishermans Wharf and ideal for tourists

review.title: Fishermans wharf
review.reviewText:
Can't believe that a 4* hotel doesn't have wifi facilities in the room. This is supposed to be a business hotel and can't provide this basic requirement.

Very dated decor and very average service. Stay elsewhere

review.title: Convenient, but doesn't feel very cleanly
review.reviewText:
Was within walking distance of the Warf, cable cars to the Embarcadero, as well as the trolley to downtown.

I would hestiate booking here again for one reason: I think the hotel uses a laundry service that employs "environmentally friendly" cleaning practices. The towels were disgusting. Like most hotels, they were white- or at least they were supposed to be white- they were more of a dingy gray. The towels did not look clean or smell clean. The hand towels were fine, but the larger body towels were just gross. We had new towels sent to our room hoping to alleviate the problem, but the new ones were just as bad. When staying in a hotel, I want my towels to smell of bleach, or at least of laundry detergent, to give me the sense that they are clean and unused. These towels smelled like the sweat of 1,000 souls. Just "ew."

The staff was friendly and helpful, but the maid service could use some attention. Dirty flatware was left in the hallway by a room near us and it stayed there even after the maids had come through.

The hotel is going through renovations and hopefully the cheap construction fixes in the room (such as crumbling, moldy grout) will be replaced.

review.title: Not for families or extended vacation
review.reviewText: This hotel is good for an overnight stay, but a poor choice for families or exteneded stays. It lacks availability of vending machines, and on site laundry. The window latch was broke, so our window did not close all the way, a dressor drawer was also broke and the temperature was very difficult to regulate. A used drinking glass remained in the same spot in the hallway for 4 days. The staff was very friendly and helpful in answering questions. However, are next vacation we will make sure we stay at a place with laundry, breakfast and a swimming pool.

review.title: Best hotel I stayed in SF
review.reviewText: I went to SF several times but this was the best hotel I stayed in SF. The price was cheaper than Holiday Inn(the time of booking, about 10 days before my check in date), but the quality was a lot better that Holiday Inn.

review.title: Not impressed at all
review.reviewText: For the to have been a 3 1/2 star hotel i have to say I was disappointed. It was really on the average hotel list. Nothing outstanding. The service workers were pleasant and helpful. The toilet in our room had issues we informed them and the next day it still hadn't been repaired even after two days when we were checking out. When we expressed it the just apoligized and that was it. The morning buffet was really nice. The television in the room even thought it was a flat screen it was on the lower end of quality. Again it was nice but not great or what you would have expected. I would stay there if I had to but it's nothing special to encourage others to go to. I think it was no question overpriced. I also couldn't believe there was not a free shuttle from the airport.

review.title: Great in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel, very clean and close to the Warf. Would definitely stay again - just make sure to ask for a courtyard room to avoid street noise.

review.title: Walking distance to everything
review.reviewText: Everything was good (near the pier, trader Joe, shopping, food and just a 15min walk to Mama's for breakfast) except the street noise at night, bring ear plugs.

review.title: Like it!
review.reviewText:
It was just a 2 day in San Francisco, and and we had a great time...
I and my son attend the NFL game at Oakland and we reach the stadium easily by the subway...

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: Location is great, close to all major attractions and trasportation. Trader Joes and Safeway supermarket are 2 blocks away and so is Walgreens. You can request a refrigerator for the room ($ 15 per night) and be able to have a quick breakfast in the room. San Francisco Gray Line tours are within walking distance and they organize various tours in the SF and nearby areas like wine country, Monterey, Yosemiti national park, etc. Rooms of the hotel are large, clean and comfortable. Overall had a great experience at Hilton Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: Location, location, location. I couldn't have picked a better one. The only question I had was why no wireless in the room? I had to go to the lobby to get wireless access for my itouch. It was minor. Definately consider this property when I go back to San Fran.

review.title: Great location...staff could be better
review.reviewText:
The hotel is in a great location, a short walk to Pier 39, Ghiradelli square, etc.
The room was not huge, but nice. The desk staff was informative but not that friendly. The woman at the concierge (activity) desk was rude and barely gave me the time of day. Consequently we were unable to get information on an outing we were interested in doing in town.

review.title: San Fransisco's best location for Fisherman's wharf ,must go back.
review.reviewText:
We had a great stay at the Hilton at the Wharf.Friendly staff,real nice room.
We had booked a room with a King bed,but when we got there they did not have one at the time.The second day we were moved to anew room with a King size bed,and to make up for the problem the hotel delivered a bottle of
Champagne and snacks.(Thank you Bill ) If you plan to visit and not driving
the location is perfect to get to any where you want to go.

review.title: San Francisco VACATION
review.reviewText:
Great time in San Francisco....Learned that you could bu a MUNI pass for certain amount of days....used that pass to travel all around San Francisco (Buses, Street Cars, Cable Cars, & Muni)....svaed a bunch of money doing that...no need for a taxi

as far as the room....nothing spectacular, but everything was comfortable...the one thing I would suggest is to ask for a room away from the street....can get a little noisy in the morning for all you late risers...

From this hotel we were able to walk to Fishermans Wharf, Little Italy, China town.....

If you plan on going to Alcatraz BUY YOUR TICKETS AT LEAST A MONTH AHEAD OF TIME

review.title: Nice and close to warf
review.reviewText: Typical Hilton with small rooms a GREAT beds. very comfortable to stay. We werent in our rooms much but it was nice when we were. Very close to Warf, Cable cars, lombard street ect...

review.title: Noisy, but good if you want to be by the Wharf
review.reviewText:
The hotel was loud and noisy. During my first night I was on a side of the hotel with a street below. I heard every car go by and could also hear bumping above me all night. I was able to get moved after the first night to a courtyard side, which eliminated the car noise, but it was still noisy.

However, the location is great if you want to be down by Fisherman's Wharf and the other touristy things.

review.title: SF Hilton
review.reviewText: The room was basic but clean and comfortable.What you are paying for is the 5 minute walk to Fishermans Wharf and several other tourist locations. The staff was friendly and the room was clean. No pool or spa and be prepared to pay a lot to ensure that your car has a comfortable stay...typical San Francisco. There were plenty of good places to eat nearby. I might check out one of the Holiday Inn's nearby next time to see if they have a pool.

review.title: San Francisco was a beautiful and fun city to visit.
review.reviewText: Hilton San Francisco Fisherman's Wharf is a great hotel to stay at as it is in a great location to get to all the tourist sites to see. The restaurant is very good also.

review.title: everything I expected it to be
review.reviewText: We had some trouble with parking, as hotel parking is quite pricey, but after we dropped off the car, things got easier! Hotel is a couple blocks from Ghirardeli Square and from all the action of Fisherman's Wharf, nevertheless in a quiet area. Yet, expect the sounds of a large city at night. Public transportation is great, so you do not need a car unless you are going to Napa. Hotel is well maintained and clean. A very positive impression overall.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice Hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Would stay there anytime
review.reviewText: Pleasant Staff and very clean hotel. Would recommend to stay there.

review.title: Hope to return soon
review.reviewText: Great hotel, close to fisherman's warf. Great trip, hotel needs a restaueant for lunch and dinner, they only served breakfast. Would go back in a minute.

review.title: Pay my way and i'll go back tomorrow!
review.reviewText: Located only three blocks from fishermans wharf. Food at hotel VERY pricee but plenty of restaurants within a short walk. Lots to see and do closeby and the hotel was a great place to recharge our batteries. By ALL means stay here and have the time of your life.

review.title: Would recommend
review.reviewText: Overall, we had a good experience with this hotel. It is very convenient to Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square, and trolley turnaround. We did have some trouble with the air conditioning and the plumming, but both were fixed quickly. The web site also said refrigerators were available upon request, however we were told there were none available when we arrived. This was inconvenient for me since I had medication that needs to be refrigerated. The hotel did give us us two mornings of complimentary breakfast buffet (which was yummy and had great service) for the issues we experienced, which I thought was very nice.

review.title: Enjoyed San Francisco but would not go back
review.reviewText:
The room we had in the Hilton Hotel was spacious and very clean and comfortable. Hotel was very good, only major complaint was the fact that you had to use your hotel card to operate the hotel lifts and we always seemed to have serious problems getting the card to work in the lifts. We were not the only ones as on many occasions other people in the lift could not get their cards to work it either. The card also had problems working on the hotel room door as well. Otherwise the hotel was very clean and tidy, staff were helpful and organised the pickup from the hotel to the airport for us. Hotel was handy for Fishermans Wharf and The Cannery, Ghiradelli Square etc.
San Francisco was very busy but this may have had something to do with it being Spring Break. Enjoyed our time but would not go back.

review.title: Okay, I guess
review.reviewText: I was disenchanted with the whole San Francisco experience. It was so crowded, the Hilton included. Parking was near impossible. At the hotel you had underground parking that could only be accessed from a certain direction because of traffic and the roadway. $40 to park was ridiculous. SF is so difficult to get around in and expensive in everyway you can think of. We went to see Alcatraz and the Science Museum which were very good but the hassle of the city will keep me from returning.

review.title: Great stay in SF
review.reviewText: My stay at the Hilton-SF Fisherman's Wharf was one of the most, if not the most, pleasant hotel experiences I've had. Everything went well from check-in to check-out. The staff was incredibly helpful and professional. I will recommend this hotel to anyone I know that's headed to SF. As a matter of fact, I'm thinking of treating of co-worker of mine to a few nights stay coming up in May.

review.title: Good value but a bit noisy
review.reviewText: Nice hotel with affordable rates. Proximity to Fisherman's Wharf can be viewed as plus for runners. Food is highly overpriced in restaurant and bar. Suggest utilizing the neighborhood establishments. Rooms along the main road can be a bit noisy but no more so than any large city hotel.

review.title: Just another Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was great when they actually picked up the phone at the front desk. Bed was quite old, definitely not the most comfortable bed i have been in.

review.title: couldnt have been better
review.reviewText: had a great time..Arrived early and they had a room for us right away.. It was rainning like crazy and the hotel had umbrellas for us to use..Everyone was very helpful with suggestions....Just a great stay

review.title: hard to fault.
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and were very happy with practically every aspect of this hotel. it was so close to the centre of Fishermans wharf and just a 2 minute walk to the excellent tram system. my only gripe was a faulty ice making machine on our floor made it necessary to get ice from another floor. Apart from that the stay was great. On our last day they gave us a complimentary late check out which was most appreciated as we were facing a 15 hour flight that night back to Australia

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: Within 2 blocks of the piers. Could walk 2 to 4 blocks to just about any major attraction. The streetcars, and buses went within a block of the hotel. The trolley was about 4 blocks away. Great restaurants all around the hotel Parking at the hotel was a little pricey - $35 plus $6 tax, a day. Lovely rooms, great beds. The restaurant in the hotel was overpriced for what they had to serve, don't waste your money.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: Our room was newly remodeled and very close to major attractions. The staff was very courteous and we had a great time!

review.title: Awesome Location!
review.reviewText: Hotel was great, clean rooms and friendly staff. Location was awesome, just a 2 min walk to shops, restaurants and electric trams, a 5 min stroll to Fisherman's Wharf. Cable Car was just around the corner as was the All Loops hop on hop off bus, which is a must!

review.title: good hotel for the money
review.reviewText: Wonderful beds and bathrroom . Noisy at times. Room was a little narrow. Close to the Wharf and all types of transportations.. My 2nd time at the hotel and would go again, but would ask for a room on the back side away from the elevator. Was disappointed that the room had no refrigator. The staff was friendly and the free computor use was a plus.

review.title: What I expected
review.reviewText: For the price and location I thought this hotel was a good choice. The location seems safe and is in walking distance to Fisherman's warf. The rooms were clean and quiet. Enjoyed my stay.

review.title: Great Hotel Great Location Friendly Staff Would Definitely go back
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at this Hotel. The location was great, just a short walk to the Wharfe. The Staff were extremely friendly and went out of their way to make your stay comfortable. We would definitely go back again.

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: My husband and I traveled to San Francisco for vacation. Having never been before, I researched a lot of hotels and picked Hilton Fisherman's Wharf because of it's close proximity to everything! We did not rent a car so it was important to us to be within walking distance of everything. We really enjoyed the hotel. The only issue we had was that the toilet was not flushing properly, but after placing a maintenance call, someone was there within 15 minutes to fix it. We would definitely stay there again!

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent service, clean rooms, this hotel has all the things you can expect from a Hilton. But it's not very fancy for a Hilton.

review.title: very convenientto cruise dock and fishermans docks
review.reviewText: very good

review.title: Street Noise
review.reviewText: Corner room with street noise and flag hardware squeaking.

review.title: Great hotel, close to pier 39
review.reviewText: We loved this hotel, and all the staff was exceptional. Its closeness to all we wanted to do was perfect for us, Pier 39 and 33 for the Alcatraz tours. We even walked to Lombard street. The cost of parking was steep but thats the way its goes. We'd definately stay there again.

review.title: As expected
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was very nice but the room I stayed in was on the side of the building that was next to the truck route; it was extremily noisey all day and night!!!!! I would stay in this hotel again but would not stay on that side of the building.

review.title: Kim
review.reviewText: Very conventient for stores, shopping, dinner etc.

review.title: Great hotel in the best location, can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location, three blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, close to Starbucks, Trader Joe's, all in all, we were very satisfied and will go back whenever we go to SF again.

review.title: slim bodies
review.reviewText: I booked a room with 2 queen size beds but got 2 twin beds. It's good in winter time to keep warm but in the spring you need space...

review.title: Worked great for us.
review.reviewText: We stayed for a quick over night at the Hilton. Got a good deal on Expedia. It was very convenient for our four person family to get to the things we wanted to do. The hotel was very accommodating of the few requests that we made. Worked out really well.

review.title: Good Times
review.reviewText: parking sucks and its to expensive

review.title: Good with kids
review.reviewText: Overall a very pleasant stay in this hotel, we went there "en famille" with 3 kids (aged 2 to 9) and they gave us adjoining communicating rooms. The beds were comfortable and the rooms extremely clean, you had full control of the thermostats which is always a plus. The bathrooms were nothing special, just clean and practical. Only failing grade was for the business center, just tiny and ill equipped; the scanner wasn't even working and the staff seemed unable or unwilling to help; fortunately there was a UPS store around the corner that had a scanner.

review.title: Centrally located
review.reviewText: Good location, space for families but lacks pool or other recreational amenitities needing a break from the city.

review.title: Would go back to this hotel anytime.
review.reviewText: This hotel is extremely clean,the beds are so comfortable,great bathproducts in the bathroom,verry nice room,great service and verry friendly staff.Great location,within walking distance to fisherman's wharf.We loved it,would go back there anytime.

review.title: Very convenient to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: I liked it very much! I would stay there again. Walking distance to almost everything. The only complaint obviously would be the overnight parking!

review.title: Great customer service!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was so nice and helpful, and the hotel is located in a convenient but quiet spot. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Doesn't pay attention to requests
review.reviewText: Asked for a King bed (or single bed) got 2 double beds. Request was confirmed at the desk and still went to the room and found 2 beds. Over all we liked the hotel though. Parking overnight is $46. Be prepared.

review.title: Best Hotel In San Francisco
review.reviewText: Initially i was sceptical about the hotel as i had read some of the previous reviews, but i must say i was greatly impressed. I agree with some of the other reviewers about the thin walls, you can hear some movement from people above and next to you, but i didn't let that bother us as we only used the room to crash out in before the next days adventure. Each day the cleaners came round prompt and tidyed up so it was spotless for us. In the morning's for breakfast pop round to Pat's Cafe it's definately worth it and the service is spot on. Ask the hotel for directions if your unsure they will help you out. I would definately recommend this hotel to anybody else staying in San Francisco.

review.title: Clean, looked new, lots of room.
review.reviewText: Less expensive than staying by the "Square" and the hotel is not as old.

review.title: Loved it!!
review.reviewText: Stayed for 4 nights and can't rate it highly enough. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful and hotel was in great condition and spotless. Great place for getting aroundto all the sights.

review.title: Nice hotel in a good location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a good location and offers a high level of service. I was pleased with the concierge service and the complimentary business facilities allowing us to send e-mails to family back home. The staff were friendly and the room service was delicious. The hotel did feel a little worn in places, although, this was due (in my oppinion) to be the result of a substantial amount of guests passing through the hotel as opposed to neglect and under-investment on the part of the operator. We never ate in the restaurant as it appeared to be a little too expensive. Again in all fairness San Francisco is a seriously expensive city and I dont believe the prices were that different to other venues located in the vicinity. A good choice and I would stay here again.

review.title: value for money
review.reviewText: we booked early to get a good deal would recomend this hotel as it was in great location 2 blocks from the wharf. close to ghiradelli sq close to all the transport links (cable car f line) the only gripe i had with this hotel was the noise from the other guests walls where quite thin would recomend staying on the top floor so there s nobody above you

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: 3 blocks from the Wharf, Ghirardelli square, North Beach, and Lombard street

review.title: Very good location with helpful staff
review.reviewText: The hotel was just two blocks away from the ocean and very clean and comfortable. Staff were very friendly. Restaurant was a bit expensive with nowhere else in the hotel to eat, however there are loads of great cafes, bars and restaurants nearby and the hotel staff were happy to recommend them. Very helpful lady sat by reception to advise on trips etcetera, overall would visit again.

review.title: Nothing Special
review.reviewText: There was nothing special about our stay at this Hilton. Average, at best. While nothing was especially wrong, there was nothing especially great either. The room ambience was more like a two-star motor inn, not what you'd expect from a Hilton. If you're looking for a special room for a special night, don't choose this Hilton.

review.title: GREAT LOCATION
review.reviewText: Ideally situated in Fishermans Wharf.The room was a great size, very clean and well maintained.Reception staff were friendly and helpful.Depending where you are you could experience some traffic noise but after a couple of days we got used to it and I believe it would be the same for other hotels.

review.title: Brilliant location
review.reviewText: Very satisfied with The Hilton, staff very pleasant nothing was too much trouble, reception staff and concierge staff well informed and especially helpful. Great breakfast menu, short walk from seafront, and trolley and tram stops ( would recommend the muni pass for getting around the city) would stay at this hotel again

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The location was great--within walking distance to everthing a tourist could want. The rooms were very clean. Not very well insulated for noise if your're a light sleeper.

review.title: Terrific Stay
review.reviewText: As nice as one expects a Hilton to be. Rooms beautifully kept, staff helpful and friendly. Even had a small fridge available for us at special request. Would definitely recommend.

review.title: Comfortable well located hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is comfortable and clean with friendly staff and in an excellent position to visit the main attractions.It has underground parking with direct access to the hotel lobby. Fishermans wharf with its choice of restaurants is a safe five minute walk as are the two trolley lines.Very easy to travel to Chinatown and Union Square with their vast array of shopping.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Our experience at the Hilton Fisherman Wharf was excellent. This hotel is at a great location, only a couple of blocks from Fisherman's Wharf on the Bay. The beds are very comfortable and the service was great. This was one of the better hotels I have stayed at. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: Best Choice
review.reviewText: I searched Expedia for awhile and kept coming back to this hotel. My wife, son and myself were not disappointed. The hotel staff was great. We arrived late morning and got us in a room right away. The room had little view but we weren't planning on spending much time there. It was a great location to the Wharf, cable cars, and lots of shops and resturants. Vinter's resturant in the hotel was very expensive. We did the buffet the first morning and between us three spent 71.00 (excluding tip). No buffet is worth that. Overall, great experience at this hotel. Would go back again.

review.title: Nice hotel. Breakfast would have been nice.
review.reviewText: The hotel was a bit on the pricey side although the location was wonderful. A continental breakfast would have been nice.

review.title: Great location, excellent service, would go back
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location, two minutes walk to the wharf and transport to downtown SF. The staff could not have been more pleasant, the front desk and concierge are always eager to help; excellent service. Our room was spacious (considering there were four of us) and clean, the only downside is that there can be traffic noise in the night,

review.title: Would recommend this hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel had a great location - only minutes from Fisherman's Wharf with views to Alcatraz and GGB, and a short walk from the cable cars that take you downtown. Staff were excellent although we didn't have much reason to need to deal with them which is good. Room was extremely comfortable and clean - only problem was an early rising upstairs neighbour who we could hear walking back and forth a lot due to creaky floorboards! But that wouldn't be a reason not to stay here! Hotel can cash traveller's cheques ($100 per day), which was handy for us. I would recommend this hotel as it definitely had everything that tourists like us needed!

review.title: Great location for the Wharf and bus routes.
review.reviewText: Good location to some local cafes and bars. The bus route was very close. The room was clean and the staff was very helpful.

review.title: Good value & location
review.reviewText: This hotel was a good value if you are looking for basic services. The hotel room was clean, but the facility is in need of updating.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel is located less than 2 blocks from Fisherman Warf, cable car and restaurants and shops. The staff is very nice and pleasant. They will help you with directions and other needs. Overall, we had a very good experience. I will recommend it to everyone.

review.title: can not wait to go back
review.reviewText: The hotel is close from many local attractions , shopping and graet dinning , the room servicve was great .It is great for family .

review.title: Good Hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: This hotel was in a great location - a few blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and in between two trolley car turn arounds. The front desk staff was very helpful when checking in, and the concierge was freindly and very helpful. The only negative was that they put us in a room with 2 double beds (which seemed to be smaller than the average double) even though we reserved 1 king. When we asked to be moved to a room with 1 king, we were accomodated with no trouble, but the room they put us in had obviously been recently smoked in and had an air purifier plugged into the wall. I would definatley stay here again.

review.title: Great surprise
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel because of the good rate, but was pleasantly surprised by the place. Good clean space, good parking, wireless internet in lobby close to wharf and restaurants.

review.title: Will stay again.
review.reviewText: Convient. This is the 2nd time we have stayed at this hotel.We are quite surprised as to how quite the room was, especially at a busy intersection. The staff was so polite and helpful. So many sites, and restaurants at your fingertips, all within walking distance or a short ride on a trolley. The restaurant in the hotel served a wonderful variety of breakfast and brunch specialties. Ate our lunches and dinners at various restaurants in S.F. The rooms were clean and offered all the complimentery goodies most hotels have. Went the week of Christmas and everything was so festive!

review.title: Can't wait to go back-Walk to Fishermans Wharf and much More
review.reviewText: This hotel was clean and courteous staff of people.Easy check in/out. small work out room. nice little lounge downstairs w/2 flat screens. Breakfast Diner. Just steps to Fishermans Wharf,Gherradelli Square.Located very close to everything

review.title: clean and good location
review.reviewText: it was relatively nice and clean but the view of the room was disappoiting. Ad says that I can have a room with bay view but I could see only the street and the other hotel.

review.title: It's great location to the Wharf, cable cars and F trains
review.reviewText: We did enjoy our stay at the Hilton. It's a great location for sight seeing tours, Pier 39, Downtown, Alcatraz etc. The staff at the front desk were very helpful with information for tours and things to do around the city. We did not try the restaurant because it was a little pricy for around the Wharf area. There are a lot of other places to eat and try different style of cooking, the hotel restaurant did not look appealing. It was a great stay and we really enjoyed it and we had teenagers with us!!!

review.title: Would stay here again.
review.reviewText: We were very happy with the Hilton Fisherman's Wharf. The staff was very helpful and friendly. It's located in a great location near Fisherman's Wharf, and a short walk to the Cable cars and buses. When we go back to San Fran, we'll definately stay here again.

review.title: San Francisco best area.
review.reviewText: Hilton Hotel in Fisherman's Wharf, is the best area in San Francisco, you can walk to almost every place.

review.title: Great place to stay in SF
review.reviewText: Great location, good price too when booked through Expedia. Great bar around the corner on the next block. 44 beers on tap!

review.title: Great location! Close to many attractions!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very helpful. We me and my three daughters first arrived we were assigned a room that was a smoking room. I called the front desk to request a change and they sent a bell hop to the room with keys to a non-smoking room and he also moved our bags, which was more that I had expected. They have a very easy automated check-in/check-out kiosk that "dispenses" your room keys and prints out any messages that you may have waiting. It also allowed me to print my boarding passes for our flight home, which was very convienient.

review.title: Good Hotel With Great Concierge Service
review.reviewText: Good hotel in the middle of everywhere. The room beds are super comfortable and the concierge service we received was friendly and accurate.

review.title: Great location, friendly service
review.reviewText: just 2 blocks from Pier area, cable cars and lots of shopping. Many great restaurants within walking distance.

review.title: Hilton Honors
review.reviewText: This is my 2nd stay at this property, and I would recommend it to anyone staying in the San Francisco Wharf area.

review.title: Great location in Fisherman's Wharf!!!
review.reviewText: Nearby the Piers and all the attractions of San Francisco's Golden Gate. Service is good. Ask for a room that is not giving on the street. Good Price Quality.

review.title: Great hotel in great location
review.reviewText: Cannot say enough about the staff at the Hilton - always helpful, courteous and smiling. Made coming back to the hotel a delight. The hotel is in a great location for someone who want to do the ``tourist`` things. Many of the city`s attractions are in walking distance with easy access to transport to other areas. When we return to S.F. this will be our first if not only choice of hotel.

review.title: dont expect to sleep
review.reviewText: First night we were told only queen size beds (I,m 6'4 so did not fit )kept awake by creaking floorboards of bedroom above asked for a larger bed in less noisy room put in another room still with Queen beds on the outside of the hotel next to the traffic ,no double glazing, window handles did not shut the windows properly so kept awake all night by traffic noise by now needed to get some sleep so checked out next day even though paid for another 2 nights will be posting photos of windows etc on trip advisor

review.title: Very Good
review.reviewText: The hotel was well situated, very clean and tidy, room was kept very clean. Woulddefinately stay there again.

review.title: Hilton San Francisco Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Location very handy for Wharf/Seafront and commercial centre. Very clean and tidy but little to no character whatsoever. Beds/linen were excellent as was the room but no fridge!!! A thousand TV channels but no BBC or other British news access. Concierge was very helpful with booking trips/transport etc.

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: This is one of the best hotels that i have stayed at. The king sized bed was very comfortable, the room & bathroom were clean and nicely decorated. The service provided by the staff was very professional. The location is excellent as its walking distance to all the local stores and restaurants.

review.title: Lovely Cool Weekend Spot
review.reviewText: A lovely hotel within walking distance of major wharf attractions.

review.title: Engaged in San Francisco!!!!
review.reviewText: A trip of a lifetime!!! San Francisco was wonderful, got engaged on the Golden Gate Bridge. The Hilton was great. Check in was simple, rooms were nice and comfy, staff was very helpful, but overall the location was so convenient. Transportation to the airport from hotel was $15/person. Close to the Wharf, Cable cars, etc..We rented bikes and toured the city, went over the Golden Gate Bridge to Salsalido. Don't miss out on this, it is a great ride, and Salsalido is a wonderful town. The bike ride was not easy, but well, well worth it.

review.title: Great Place on the Wharf
review.reviewText: This hotel is the best if you want to be right down on the Wharf in San Francisco. Parking is a nightmare in this area and with the Valet, it makes it so easy. Walking distance from here to so very many sites to see and activities to take part in. The local restaurants are superb and in great number. The staff is friendly and accomadating and can answer most any question.

review.title: Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Great location! The valet was wonderful, easy and helpful. Rooms were comfortable.

review.title: Good facility, Great Staff, Great Location
review.reviewText: Very enjoyable stay at this well-run hotel. Concierge was excellent and enormously helpful, made all the difference in our vacation experience in S.F.. Front desk staff was terrific. Breakfast at restaurant was mediocre and over-priced, only ate there on the first day and went elsewhere after that. The management and employees at this hotel made all the difference, can't say enough about how well they do their jobs and treat their customers.

review.title: Perfect location near Fishermans Warf
review.reviewText: Hotel was most attentive. Very Clean. Walk to Fishermans Warf is only a few minutes.

review.title: Everything seemed fine to me
review.reviewText: A good stay, nice room, nice area.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: This is my second stay here, and will definately come back. The hotel is very conveniently located to many attactions and within walking distance, so there is no need to drive anywhere. The only area that I was not satisfied with was the restaurant. I think the prices especially for breakfast were on the high side.

review.title: Ultra helpful staff
