review.reviewText: I had a particular personal problem and decided to ask the Hotel staff assistance. I had a solution to my problem in less than 5 minutes. Even though as a hotel it does not outshine the others in the same area, the servive received was too good not to recommend it.

review.title: Great central location, can walk to many attractions.
review.reviewText: Very nice Hotel, friendly staff. Very helpful.

review.title: great experience and convenient to wharf
review.reviewText: Clean, great linens, good service

review.title: Quiet, comfortable place to stay in San Francisco when on vacation.
review.reviewText: This Hilton is as close as you can get to Fisherman's Wharf and be in a place where you feel safe and in comfort. The staff was very courteous and helpful. I will definitely stay there again on my next vacation trip to San Francisco.

review.title: It was pricey but o.k.
review.reviewText: The hotel room was noisy. We were on the first floor and you could hear everything going on in the room above us. Luckily they finally went to bed around midnight. Otherwise, the hotel was nice and the bed was very comfy. Nicely located, within an easy walk to the the wharf area and to Cobb's comedy club.

review.title: good stay
review.reviewText: nice room, friendly staff, overall good experience

review.title: Never again
review.reviewText: I dont like this hotel.

review.title: The best part of the hotel was checking out early
review.reviewText: The staff was rude. It took forever to check in. They told us that they should have a room ready for us at any time but when we arrived we couldn't check in untill 3. They hotel was 10 rooms overbooked so they had to take people to another hotel. In addition we requested a king all they had avialable were double beds. The room keys were broken so we had to wait for someone to walk us up to our room. The carpet around the bed looked like it had not been vacuumed in months. Because of arrival time we put up a do not disturb on the door so we could catch a afternoon nap and the staff banged on the door until we anwsered. We will not be staying here agian!

review.title: Absolutely would stay there again!
review.reviewText: The location of the Hilton was perfact! We were in walking distance to everything. We were close enough to walk to all the local attractions, yet far enough away to not be bothered w/the local tourist camotion. We were able to get back to our hotel midday to change, decompress or get ready for the evening. I can't express enough hoe convient the location was. I would stay there agian.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: The staff were extremely helpful and very nice. Room was great and comfortable. Close to everything.

review.title: Would go back
review.reviewText: Our room was lovely, and with some moving of the easy chair, the roll away bed fit beautifully. Had to ask three different staff persons for the roll away bed. I would stay there again.

review.title: Very Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Great Place to Stay

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We went to SF for Fleet Week - it was unbelievably crowded, but we had no problems at the Hilton, they let us check in at 10:30 a.m, very easy, self-parking garage ($28), everyone was very helpful. The bell captain gave us a lot of useful tips. The Hilton is only two blocks from the Wharf, a 5 minute walk and we were right where all the action was. We plan to stay at the Hilton next year too.

review.title: Great location, big rooms
review.reviewText: You can walk or take public transporation everywhere from this hotel. Nice large guest rooms too

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: My husband and I went to this hotel for our 1 year anniversary. The hotel was very convienentaly located and close to everything. Fisherman's Wharf, Coit Tower, Lombard Street, The Embarcadero, etc is within an easy walking distance. The hotel room was very clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Very clean!

review.title: A great location
review.reviewText: The hotel and staff were extemely courteous and accommodating. The hotel is located close to the transit systems and made getting around San Francisco very accessible. Would stay here again. If staying at the Wharf area this is the hotel to stay at.

review.title: Location!
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel could not be beat! We pretty much walked everywhere we wanted to go with the exception of when we took the cable car, which was only a block away. The room was mediocre, clean enough but awkward for the one room service breakfast we ordered - no place for two people to eat! It was a little noisy, at first we thought the windows were open but they were not - we did have a great view of the TransAmerica Pyramid and Coit tower. Absolutely THE WORST hotel shower I have ever showered in! No water pressure and kept feeling like it would run out of hot water but then would get blasted with hot water! The staff was very friendly and accomodating - they always had a smile for you! We did have a rainy day and as we were trying to decide whether or not to buy umbrellas at the Walgreens (right down the street) the doorman said that you can simply borrow them from the front desk - I know its a little thing but just seemed really nice at the time! I would definitely recommend it to anyone - decent place to stay!

review.title: Very disappointed!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was rude upon arrival. They said they were putting us in one of the expedia rooms that was paid for in advance. We were put in a handicap accessable room with no bath tub for the children. The shower was not clean. The noise level was terrible. We could hear the springs of the bed above us. Very disappointing.

review.title: Easy access to activities
review.reviewText: This hotel is just 3 blocks from fishermans wharf. One can walk to all of the attractions on the wharf. The cable car turnaround is just 1 block away. The quaint eating establishments of North Beach are also within walking distance.

review.title: Plesantly Surprised
review.reviewText: Being a frequent visitor to San Francisco this was my first time to stay at the Hilton Fisherman's Wharf. I was pleasantly surprised as to how large and clean the room was. The staff were courteous and attentive. Very close to the Wharf and cable car.

review.title: Not bad
review.reviewText: Hotel was in a good location.  Restaurant not open at certain times and vending machine very over priced.  Hotel staff very friendly.  Hotel charged for parking...and garage was alway full....no spaces available.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText:
very good location, therefore there is no need to rent a car. In any case parking is very expensive too (Hilton charges $28 per day). 

Too bad they dont have free aiport shuttles or complimentary breakfast.

review.title: Great Choice for Sight Seeing
review.reviewText:
Service was good and accomodating. Concierge is very helpful and can give you several options on what to do and how to get there. Room service is also very good.
Hotel is a two block walk to the wharf, it's a block away from a cable car stop, and close to just about everything in San Fran. On the corner of Columbus Dr, which you can use to get almost anywhere.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Front desk staff very responsive.  Restaurant staff at breakfast mediocre.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: The Hilton Fisherman's Wharf is located only 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. The service was great, the rooms were clean, the decor very nice. It is in the heart of the action, so you will hear street noise if facing Bay Street. It was a great place to stay!

review.title: Location, Location,Location Place to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Hilton at Fisherman's Wharf is a small hotel but right in the middle of everything.  It is the perfect place to stay if you want to see San Francisco.  Two blocks from the heart of Fisherman's Wharf, two blocks from the trolley to take you uptown.  Literally my husband and I walked every where from the hotel, chinatown, little Italy, even the Palace of Fine Arts.  The restaurants close are fabulous and the shopping is great.  I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Concierge was fantastic and staff good - really great location.

review.title: Hilton Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
Nice accommadations, nice staff, nice atmosphere,
nice lay-out. You get the idea. Just don't go in expecting Hilton's most ultra-lavish resort.

In my opinion, the location is extremely handy. It's walking-distance close to many of the best attractions and public transportation. We didn't bother to rent a car, so the latter was quite important. If you are going to depend on public transportation like we did, be sure to bone up on the routes and access times on the 'net before you go. We didn't, and paid for the misque. We "accidently" made a lot longer walk than we really were prepared for.

If you are interested in the least in marine history, be sure to visit the marine museum and old boat display west of the main fisherman's wharf area.

Going to Alcatraz? Do yourself a favor and read Jim Quillen's book before you go. I think it's "Alcatraz From the Inside" subtitled "A Life of Pain and Sorrow." I read it after my visit and realized that it would have really brought the alcatraz visit to life; and it's ly impressive enough going in dry and unprepared.

Take care, and good luck.Ron E.

review.title: Hilton Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: We had an excellent stay at this hotel. It was only about 3 blocks from the actual wharf so it was an easy walk to all the activity at Pier 39, Ghirardeli Sq., etc. It was far enough away however to be nice and quiet at night for a good night's sleep. We had a large room with a king sized bed which was awesome. Room service was quick & the food was good. Pricey but worth it!

review.title: Great location and excellent accommodations
review.reviewText: My husband and I recently visited San Fran for our 10th wedding anniversary.  I selected the Hilton - Fisherman's Wharf off the internet and it turned out to be a great hotel in a great location.  A short walk to the trolley cars and to Fisherman's Wharf.  The hotel itself was very clean and the staff was very helpful.  The concierge desk at the hotel was also very helpful in helping us plan our activities and had some great restaurant recommendations in the area.
